loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Mujeres al Progreso está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, que está luchando y tiene muchas expectativas para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ha podido ir mejorando su bienestar económico dentro del hogar, ella es una de las mujeres emprendedoras quien se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás, y con lo cual ayuda a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Rosa solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, y calzados, para poder seguir con la venta de los mismos, y de esa forma dar a su familia lo que necesita.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres al Progreso" group is in their 1st cycle of the Woman's Committee Program. It is a new group which is striving and has much expectation to be able to help their loved ones.

One of the members is Rosa who through her work and effort continues to improve the economic well-being of her household. She is one of the enterprising women who sells all kinds of products door-to-door like clothing, shoes, variety items, etc. Doing this she helps her loved ones. Rosa is requesting a loan to by a variety of clothing and footwear in order to continue her sales and in this way provide her family with what it needs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with two children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles and other items

Gina has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from her pre-paid mobile load business.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs and noodles

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 56 years old, lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling spare parts since 1998. After marrying, his son began to live separately from him but due to price increases, his son sold his house to make a profit. Now they are all living together, although in time his son will live separately again. 

Bayarsaikhan is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to expand his house by buying building materials such as bricks, cement and planks. After this extension, his family will live in a more comfortable and spacious place where heat won't be lost easily and less coal will be burned for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and planks

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana.
Ella en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que esta con varios indicadores en un nivel muy bajo. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella tiene un Kiosko dentro de su casa donde se dedica a la venta de comestible, bebidas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
La Sra. Juana solicita de este préstamo para comprar comestible, bebidas, verduras, etc., para seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres Trabajadoras" and is in their 2nd cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. They are also participating in the Poverty Stoplight program.

One of the members is Juana. In the last survey she was at level one, which is to say with a numbers of indicators at very low. Through her effort and work she continues to apply the vital behaviors of a successful woman. She is improving her economic situation.

She has a kiosk at her house where she sells groceries,and drinks. We need to highlight the work of the advisers who have been monitoring her training and verification. Juana is requesting this loan to purchase groceries, drinks, vegetables, etc. to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, vegetables, etc for resale.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is young and successful woman. She is 27 years old. Madina is married and has a little child. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Madina is going to organize her business because she needs money. Her husband doesn’t send enough money for living. 

Madina plans to sew national women dresses. She took part in a course called "To Get Ahead" presented by a women's organization and got a certificate. She learned a lot of useful information about managing a business. She needs to buy a new sewing machine for organizing her new business. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear items. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional products to be used for her beauty parlor business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products to be used for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Al-Ikhlas*** Group

texts.en:
The members of the Al-Ikhlas*** Group are four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 290,000 YER from AMB.

Roqyah is the leader of the group and is 52 years old. She is a very vigorous woman and works as a housewife. Roqyah has five children. The oldest child is 23 years old and the youngest one is 16 years old.  

She wants to help her husband in improve the condition of the house. Roqyah says that most of furniture of her house is very old. She can't afford that. So she decided to change all the furniture and purchase other furniture. Her first step is purchasing a bedroom suite. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do so. 

As a result of that, she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. She hopes that her house will be in a good condition soon. Roqyah will use the loan to buy a bedroom suite for the house. She is happy and hopes to get a lot of support in order to finish the furnishing of the house.

Roqyah hopes to provide her family with a better life and furnish the house as well as purchase many appliances for it.

loans.use: To buy a bedroom suite for the house.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya was born in 1961. She always has wanted to organize her own business but she had not an opportunity. Some days ago she took part in a course, "To Get Ahead," from a women's organization and got a certificate. Now, she is ready to start a business. 

She wants to start a business of sewing and selling the national mattress, the kurpacha. She will sew kurpacha and sell them in a local market. There is a great demand for kurpacha in the local market. She hopes that her business will go well. 

She is asking for a loan of 3000 TJS to buy fabrics for setting up her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to set up her new business

loans.name: Asenath

texts.en:
Asenath is a farmer living in Kisii area of South Nyanza Kenya with her family and four children who are of school-going age. She has been getting income from farming for the past 16 years where she produces and sells milk, eggs, and crops. She stated that in through farming, she gets more money from the sale of her farm produce. Her biggest challenge is diseases affecting livestock.

Asenath chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their interest rates are lower than other micro finance institutions in the area and they offer good services to their clients. During the training, she learnt how she can save more for the future of her children. Through this dairy loan she will get more milk for selling and for her family's consumption  and the increased income will lead to her providing good education for her children.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Zarifa was born in 1971. She is a smart and industrious woman who tries for the wellbeing of her family. She is a careful mother of two children. Her children are not yet adults. 

Zarifa is a successful business lady. She lives in a village and has a good opportunity to develop a business in animal husbandry. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than five months. Now, she is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 1,600 Tajikistan somoni (TJS) to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital of new business

loans.name: Charos

texts.en: Charos is a 36-year-old woman. She is widowed and has two children. Her husband died some years ago, and Charos is the only support for her children. Her parents and brother help her, but they also are poor people. Charos is going to start her own business in animal husbandry. She took part in a course by a women's organization, "To Get Ahead," and earned a certificate. Charos is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to buy cattle. Her brother will help her to manage the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from Rafah. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. He started his business, a services office, three years ago. He provides many services, such as printing and copying for students. 

Mohammad would like to improve his business so he took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy supplies for his business like paper, inks and another printing machine. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. He appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy supplies like paper, inks and another printing machine

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras, es un grupo formado en la zona de San Ignacio, se encuentra en el 1er. ciclo, están iniciando sus trabajos con el acompañamiento de la fundación con el programa de comités.
La Sra. Sully, es la presidenta del grupo, ella es empleada domestica y también realiza venta de comestibles desde su casa, como se puede ver es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con sacrificio y redoble de esfuerzos está saliendo adelante.
La Sra. Sully solicita  este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su venta de comestibles, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mujeres Emprendedoras is a group located in the San Ignacio area. They are in their first loan cycle and they are starting their work accompanied by the foundation with the committees program.

Sully is the president of the group. She works in the home and also sells groceries from home. As can be seen, she is a hard-working woman who has sacrificed and worked hard to move forward.

Sully is requesting a loan to invest in buying supplies for her grocery store, including vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she's receiving to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store, including vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new business stock to resell to more people.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Maria Group

texts.es:
Inmaculada Concepcion de Maria se llama este grupo, el cual está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, por medio del cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder seguir trabajando y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Mirian es una de estas mujeres, quien es docente y también se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y por medio de estos trabajos ayuda a su familia, lucha por poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Mirian es una persona que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Mirian pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, y demás, y así seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is named Inmaculada Concepcion de Maria, which is in its sixth loan cycle of the women's communal bank program. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey. This will allow them to understand their situation and apply this to keep working and improving their living conditions.

Mirian is one of these women. She is a teacher and also sells a variety of clothes. With this work, she helps her family, fighting to give them everything that she wasn't able to have. Mirian is a person who wants to improve her living conditions.

Mirian is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothes to sell, including t-shirts, jeans, shirts, and other items. This will allow her to keep working to improve her living conditions. All the members are grateful for this opportunity to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo nuevo que está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que están luchando por un futuro mejor para sus hijos y seres queridos.
Julia es parte de este grupo, y vendedora de verduras frescas que día a día sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es muy sacrificada y lucha por dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y comenta que su meta es poder tener un puesto donde poder ofrecer sus productos.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras frescas para la venta, con lo que podrá seguir luchando por su familia y sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This is a new group that is in its first loan cycle for the women´s committee program. These women are heads-of-household that are fighting for a better future for their children and loved ones. 

Julia is part of this group. She is a fresh vegetable saleswoman who goes out and sells on foot day by day. She is very selfless and fights to give her family all that she could not have, and she states that her goal is to be able to have a vegetable stand from which she can offer her products.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy fresh vegetables in order to sell them, which will allow her to continue fighting for her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables in order to sell them

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, es una persona que esta esforzándose por salir adelante, comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo comprar una notebook, que le facilitó bastante el poder estudiar, como una herramienta de estudios.
Hoy pide de un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estando cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is studying the career of systems analysis.  He is a person who is putting forth great effort to get ahead.  He states that through his last loan he was able to by a notebook, which greatly helped him to be able to study.  It is a tool for his studies.

He is now requesting a new loan in order to be able to make his university payments.  This way he will be able to continue studying and getting close to his goal.

loans.use: to make his university payments.

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es:
Emilse es docente, está estudiando la carrera de ciencias en la educación, su mayor anhelo es recibirse de licenciada.
Ella está llevando sus estudios con esfuerzo y lucha, ya que quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas, que al igual a ella quieren salir adelante.
Emilse pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto, y luchando por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Emilse is a teacher. She is studying for a degree in educational sciences. Her greatest desire is to receive her bachelor´s degree. She is undertaking her studies with effort, and fighting hard because she wants to be able to help other people who, like her, want to get ahead.

Emilse is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay the fees for her studies, since in this way she will be able to cover that expense and fight to improve her life.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her studies

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a 26-year-old single man from Jabalia. He lives with his parents in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Jaber would like to improve the family living conditions, so he would like to buy all the needed stuff. Jaber took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Jaber will be able to provide hot water for his family without using electricity. 

Jaber appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home

loans.name: Deden

texts.en:
Deden runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Deden lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Deden is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Deden began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas está culminando su carrera de veterinario y su anhelo es poder trabajar y tener un sueldo merecido y así poder trabajar y ayudar a sus padres para tener una mejor vida.
Comenta que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su meta, y llegar a ser un excelente profesional.
Blas pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, que le permitirá poder cubrir ese gasto y luchar por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Blas is completing his veterinary degree.  His desire is to be able to work and to have a worthy salary and to help his parents to have a better life.

He states that he is putting forth his best effort in order to be able to reach his goal and to come to be an excellent professional.

Blas is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay his degree expenses.  This will allow him to be able to cover this expense and to struggle in order to improve his life.

loans.use: to pay his degree expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more caustic and palm oil for her iron soap business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candy, bread, biscuits, sugar, etc., to attract customers.

loans.name: Carmen Leticia

texts.es:
Carmen Leticia es una persona  trabajadora, responsable, honesta  dedicada a la familia, al trabajo y a al estudio, ella necesita de la ayuda del convenio kiva para poder seguir adelante con  los estudios y para ella estudiar AUXILIAR DE ENFERMERÍA es muy importante, ya  que ella está realizando las prácticas y  ha aprendido a realizar procedimientos, ella ve que con esta carrera puede no solo ayudar a la familia sino a muchas  personas que lo pueden necesitar. Además con esta profesión ella puede adquirir más conocimiento y llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y la familia, ya que ella también quiere ayudar  a la familia económicamente. Ella sabe que la familia y esta profesión es la motivación para salir adelante con el proyecto de vida.
Ella estaría muy agradecida con la colaboración de kiva porque no tiene los recursos necesarios para continuar con el estudio, pero sabe que con la ayuda de kiva lo puede lograr, ya que es un paso para poder alcanzar las metas.
texts.en:
Carmen Leticia is a hard-working, responsible, and honest person.  She is devoted to the family, work, and education.  She needs the help of a Kiva loan in order to be able to get ahead with her studies.  Studying to be an assistant nurse is very important to her.  This is because she is doing the practices, and she has learned to do the procedures.  

She sees that with this career she is able to not only help the family, but also many people who may need it.  Also, with this profession she is able to acquire more knowledge and come to have a better quality of life for herself and her family.  She also wants to help her family financially.  She knows that her family and this profession are her motivation to get ahead with this life project.

She would be very grateful for help from Kiva.  She does not have the resources that are needed to continue with her education.  However, she knows that with help from Kiva she will be able to do it.  It is a step towards being able to reach her goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma runs a small stall which sells snacks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. Irma lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Irma is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Irma began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Mercedes está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de las catorce señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando por mejorar.
Una de ellas es la señora Sebastiana, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que debe poner un mayor esfuerzo por mejorar sus ingresos, y eso lo hará gracias a las capacitaciones, sumado a su trabajo de vendedora de kits de lentes que recibe a través del programa de microfranquicias de la fundación paraguaya.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de microfranquicias de lentes, que le permitirá seguir con la venta de los mismos, a la vez que ayuda a su familia por medio de los ingresos que obtiene.
texts.en:
The group "Las Mercedes" is in its first loan cycle for the women´s committee program, where they are also doing a poverty elimination survey. In the survey, three of the 14 women were found to be below the poverty line, which is to say they must continue working to improve their income. 

One of them is Sebastiana, who demonstrated a poverty level of one on the survey, which means she has to put in more effort to improve her income. She will do so thanks to the trainings provided, as well as her work as an eyeglass kit saleswoman. She receives the kits through Fundación Paraguaya´s micro-franchise program.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy an eyeglass micro-franchise, which will allow her to continue selling eyeglasses, and at the same time help her family with the income she obtains.

loans.use: to buy an eyeglass micro-franchise

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna runs a small bakery. She makes Armenian traditional bread and sells it locally. 

Anna lives in Aygeshat village with her husband, two children (12 and 10 years old), mother-in-law and sister-in-law.
 
Anna works hard to run her bakery in a sustainable way so her family will be able to sustain its living. By applying for this loan, she asks for financial support to be able to purchase equipment and materials needed for her bakery. Anna has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

She will be very thankful to Kiva lenders if they support her business.

loans.use: to pay for equipment and materials for the bakery

loans.name: Dirgos

texts.en:
Dirgos runs a small stall which sells gas for stovse, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Dirgos lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Dirgos is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Dirgos began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
Ana Beatriz, ella es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y cumplidora de los deberes y obligaciones, ella quiere seguir adelante con los estudios  y ayudar a la familia en todo lo necesario, por eso ella necesita del convenio con kiva, para  poder terminar con los proyectos de vida, ya que el estudio y la familia son lo más importante para ella.
Por eso para ella es indispensable la colaboración de kiva porque es un apoyo para terminar con el estudio de Auxiliar en Enfermería,  ya que con esto puede ayudar tanto a la familia como a las demás personas, ya que ella puede ser una gran profesional en este servicio, ella en estos momentos está realizando las practicas y ha aprendido mucho a realizar  procedimientos a los pacientes y lo hace con amor y paciencia, porque sabe que  lo que hace, lo hace con agrado y la hace sentir satisfecha con la práctica.
texts.en:
Ana Beatriz is a very responsible, hard-working person who pays her debts and obligations. She wishes to forge ahead with her studies and to help her family in every necessary way. For that reason, she needs to use the Kiva loan agreement to be able to finish her life's project, since studying and her family are the most important thing for her.

That's why collaboration with Kiva is indispensable, because it represents assistance in finishing her studies to become a Nurse's Aid. With this achieved, Ana Beatriz can help her family while helping other persons. She can be a grand professional in patient services.

Ana Beatriz is presently carrying out her practice and has learned much in performing patient procedures. She does this with love and patience, because she knows that what she does, she will do well and it will give her great satisfaction as she does it.

loans.use: to pay a semester's matriculation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo runs a small stall which sells gas for stoves, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Dodo lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Dodo is married and lives with five people in the family house.

Dodo began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Rizal

texts.en:
Rizal runs a small stall which sells stationery and mobile phone airtime credits. Rizal lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Rizal is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Rizal began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar runs a small stall which sells groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Azhar lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Azhar is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Azhar began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Tinneihat

texts.en:
Tinneihat is an outgoing and fun-loving girl who loves to travel and meeting new people. She is pictured with her mother. Tinneihat is 20 years old and lives with her family of nine, including her parents, in Imphal, which is in the Northeast State of India. She has three elder sisters and three younger sisters. Everyone in the locality knows them as the seven wonder sisters, says Tinneihat. Tinneihat’s mother is a homemaker whereas her father is a pensioner who earns only 7,000 INR per month. In spite of their situation, they both strive to give their children good education and help them as much as possible. 

Ever since she was small, Tinneihat admired and loves a career in aviation, as this profession provides the exciting experience of flying, visiting different places and countries, and interacting with so many people from different walks of life. The good pay package is another attraction. Like every girl child used to do, Tinneihat would dress up like an airlines hostess and act like one of them, says Tinneihat, with a smile. 

Tinneihat is indeed very glad that she’s able to achieve her dream career. However, she is also worried because the resources of her household are very low and she has to pay the mandatory security deposit to the airlines to get enroll in  the cabin crew training. Therefore, it is vital for her to get financial assistance, without which she will not be able to accomplish her dreams or to give financial support to her parents and her siblings, as she wishes to help them once she gets a stable and lucrative job. She earnestly hopes to count on Kiva and thanks lenders in advance for their generosity and for favoring her wish to develop herself and accomplish her dreams.

loans.use: To pay the refundable security deposit, develop herself, and support her family.

loans.name: Anggi

texts.en:
Anggi runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Anggi lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Anggi is single and lives with three people in the family house.

Anggi began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Bebed

texts.en:
Bebed runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Bebed lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Bebed is single and lives with six people in the family house.

Bebed began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en:
Montaser is a a 21-year-old single man from Bedya, a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in an old house. 

He works with his family in their project which is raising chickens. it is a good business and the demand is high. Montaser would like to improve the family project. 

Montaser took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy fans for the chicken farm. By taking this loan, Montaser will be able to improve the farm, especially before the summer. 

Montaser appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy fans for the chicken farm

loans.name: Andri

texts.en:
Andri runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Andri lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Andri is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Andri began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 49-year-old divorced woman from a small village called Qabatia, near Jenin city. She lives alone in a small house. 

For the past ten years, Maha has been working in  her store where she sells home appliances. She started in a very small store and expanded it later. Maha is a very ambitious woman and she always thinks how can she improve her business. 

She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more home appliances products for her store to resell. By taking this loan, Maha will be able to increase her sales and also her income. Maha appears in the photo in front of her store.

loans.use: to buy more home appliances products for her store to resell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana runs a small stall which sells  mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Nana lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Nana is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Nana began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Dani

texts.en:
Dani runs a small stall which sells  mobile accessories, snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Dani lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Dani is single and lives with two people in the family house.

Dani began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya was born in 1993. She is not married and lives with her parents in a rural area. She did very well in school, and three years ago she entered the Tajikistan State University of Business and Politics. She is a third-year student in the finance and credit department. She studies hard. 

Robiya's parents have been busy with animal husbandry. They do not have the ability to pay for her education in university. Robiya is asking for a loan of 725 USD to pay for her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora was born in 1988. She is a woman with a kind heart. Three months ago, Gulnora began her own business with sewing because she needed money. Her husband has a small income and it is not enough to provide their two children with all necessary things. Gulnora provides services to her clients in her house. Her neighbors are her regular customers and they are glad for her work. Gulnora is going to buy a new sewing machine as her sewing machine is old. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her new business.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a hairdresser. She is married and lives with her husband and in-laws. 

She rents a small space in one of the beauty salons of Gyumri town and provides there hairdressing service. She is a very enthusiastic worker and does her best to provide high quality service to her customers. Tamara's husband is a taxi driver. They both are hard working enough to sustain their family living.

Tamara now requestss this loan to be able to purchase tools (hairdressing accessories, hairdryer,  scissors, chair, mirror) that she needs for the hairdressing service. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan is very important for Tamara and she hopes that lenders will support her.

loans.use: to pay for tools (hairdressing accessories, hairdryer, scissors, chair, mirror)

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine is young retailer from Griboyedov village of the Ejmiatsin region. She lives with her husband and little 4-year-old daughter Victoria. 

She trades in clothing and perfume accessories from her house. Due to three years of hard work, she has been able to gain trust and loyalty from her customers. 

Now, in order to be able to purchase new stocks of clothing and perfume to meet the current demand, she has applied for this loan. The loan will greatly help her to purchase needed supplies and resell them.

Qristine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing and parfume to sell to customers

loans.name: Paublina De La Cruz

texts.es:
Paublina es una mujer trabajadora que día a día sale a vender productos de bellezas a las mujeres que viven cerca de su casa; ofrece perfumes, maquillaje, cremas faciales y corporales. También vende productos lácteos, definitivamente es una mujer emprendedora. Ella vive en Managua, tienen 34 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Junto a su esposo, buscan la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
Ella solicita el prestamo para Comprar: Perfumes, Cremas y Productos Lácteos. Así lograra incrementar los pedidos de los productos que ofrece. Paublina espera seguir recibiendo el apoyo de Kiva, para lograr cumplir uno de sus sueños,  que es acondicionar mejor su casa para la venta de la mercadería. Ella anhela obtener estabilidad económica que le aseguré un futuro prospero al negocio y a su familia.
texts.en:
Paublina is a hardworking woman who goes out every day to sell beauty products to the women who live near her home.  She offers perfumes, makeup, facial lotions and body lotions.  She also sells dairy products; she is truly an enterprising woman.  

Paublina lives in Managua.  She is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  Together with her husband, she is searching for a way to improve the living conditions of her children.

She is asking for this loan to buy perfume, lotions, and dairy products.  In this way she can manage to increase orders for the products she offers.  Paublina hopes to keep receiving support from Kiva to be able to achieve one of her dreams, which is to set up her home better for merchandise sales.  She longs to achieve financial stability, which will assure a prosperous future for her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, and dairy products.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Consolata will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of groceries for resale. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of groceries for resale

loans.name: Ogi

texts.en:
Ogi runs a small stall which sells snacks and  mobile phone airtime credits. Ogi lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Ogi is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Ogi began working with Ruma two months ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Risi

texts.en:
Risi runs a small stall which sells  mobile phone airtime credits. Risi lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Risi is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Risi began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Dewi runs a small stall which sells groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Dewi lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Dewi is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Dewi began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Doni

texts.en:
Doni runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and  mobile phone airtime credits. Doni lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Doni is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Doni began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Iin

texts.en:
Iin runs a small stall which sells stationery and  mobile phone airtime credits. Iin lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Iin is married and lives with five people in the family house.

Iin began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and some beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Nuru is a businesswoman who makes her living by running a local restaurant. She has been in this business for three years now. Her business is open from 6 am to 9 pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly return. Nuru is in her early thirties and is single. 

This is Nuru’s sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to restock her food cooking ingredients like rice, cooking oil, maize and baking flour. Nuru earned extra income which she used to buy a refrigerator and to pay for her personal expenses. She will use this new loan to buy more food cooking stocks. Nuru dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business and buy a plot of land. 

Nuru will share this loan with her loan group ”Sisi Kwa Sisi” which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking stocks for her local restaurant.

loans.name: Range Group

texts.en:
Eufrasia is in her late forties and has four children who are going to school. She is married and has been engaged in a business selling fish. She wakes up early in the morning, 4:30 am, just to board a bus to buy stock at the market. Waking early in the morning gives Eufrasia two main advantages. She gets more fresh fish and she can win the morning market since she sells door-to-door. Eufrasia has a few customers who need fish early in the morning to make soup for their children. Eufrasia closes her business at noon and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This is her sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Eufrasia used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to restock more fish. She sold all of her fish stock and received extra income. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. Eufrasia will use this loan to buy fish stock. She dreams of improving her family's life. 

She will share this loan with her loan group ”Range” which totals three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish stock.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda is 47 years old. She is a highly educated woman. She began work in a rural area after graduating university. Umeda is widowed because her husband died in a civil war in Tajikistan. Umeda stayed with her little daughter. After the death of her husband, Umeda began her own business selling food items. She sells candies, biscuits and chocolates. She has run this business for more than 15 years. She is going to increase working capital now. Umeda is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy candies and biscuits. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy candies and biscuits.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.en:
Mijgona is 24 years old. She is widowed and brings up a little child who is 2 years old. Mijgona is the only provider of herself and her child. She is a sewer.

Mijgona began her business 4 months ago. She sews national women's dresses and European style dresses. Mijgona has her regular customers. She tries to provide high quality service and in this way attract more clients. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy fabrics for sewing women's clothes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing women's clothes.

loans.name: 02.03.8 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Phương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Phương has been involved in this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to resell in the future. Phương is 30 years old and she is married with 1 child. Phương is the group leader of the 02.03.08 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Phương lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to resell in the future.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en:
Ruzigul was born in 1981. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Ruzigul deals with all the family problems alone as her husband has been a migrant worker for many years.

 Ruzigul is a seamstress. She sews traditional women's dresses. Ruzigul has been occupied with this business for more than five years. She has her regular customers. 

Ruzigul needs financial support because her husband is going to Russia but they have not enough money to buy his air ticket. Ruzigul is asking for a loan of 600 USD to buy an air ticket for her husband. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her husband

loans.name: Al- Wedad3 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wedad3. It is made up of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are hard-working and enterprising women. They took a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.
 
Wardah is the group's leader. She is 50 years old, married and has eight children. One of Wardah's goals is to continue to grow her business. Since she has professional experience in this field, she attracts more customers. She started up her business five years ago. Wardah sells incense and perfumes to her customers in the street. She is a door-to-door seller. She is using her share of the loan to invest in her business by buying more cosmetics, perfumes and incense to resell to her customers. This loan will assist her in strengthening her business so that she can increase her revenue. 

Wardah hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business to sell stylish women's clothes.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, perfumes and incense

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
These members are part of group called God Is Able. The group is composed of women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are family women with the average age of 47 years old. They live in large traditional families in Teshie-Accra, Ghana.

The group members, like Helen, who is the first person standing from the left in the photo, engage in the buying and selling of fish. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought after.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the ID Ghana's loan program. They are on their seventh group loan.

Helen is the featured borrower of this group from Teshie, where she excels at selling fish. She plans to use her loan to buy a large amount of fish. She procures her goods from the harbor at a wholesale price and makes her sales in the market at retail for cash to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn a good monthly profit which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling fish. She also wants to save part of her earnings.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 5,000 to enable them to serve customers better.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional slippers to sell.

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Stella, who is in her early forties, is married and has one son, who is in school. For three years now, Stella has made her living by running a general store, selling rice, beans, sugar, maize flour, baking flour, soft drinks, bar and powdered soaps, and other items. She works from 06m to 10pm per working day and is able to make a very small return each month. 

Stella is requesting her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to purchase more products that she had previously not carried in her shop. She keeps restocking her shop with more new items so as to meet more customers’ demands.  Stella plowed the profit back into her shop. She dreams of expanding her shop. She will use this loan to buy more stock for her shop. 

Stella will share this loan with her loan group, MONROVIA, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop

loans.name: Swed Group

texts.en:
This group is called Swed and is comprised of four women. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. This community is hardworking and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children. Her oldest child is ten years old and the youngest one is three years old. She lives with her children in Hodeidah, Yemen. Fatima is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her children with a better future, but her capital is very small. Now, she works selling cosmetics and women's clothes in the street. The income of her business is very low and she has many challenges to improve it. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more cosmetics, perfumes, and incense, as well as women's clothes to resell.

Fatima looks forward to providing her family with a lot of money. She hopes to expand her business through purchasing more cosmetics, accessories, makeup, and women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, perfumes, incense, and women clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four computers and to expand her sewing supplies store

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.en: Bunafsha was born in 1974. She is married and has 2 children. Her children are not adults. Bunafsha’s husband is a master at repairing houses. Now, Bunafsha is going to start a new business because she needs money. She is going to start selling salads and vegetables. She will sell at a local market. Bunafsha took a course as part of IMON's "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead" called "To Get Ahead." Bunafsha is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy vegetables for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her new business.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, wheat flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cooking fat, wheat flour, and other items for resale. Her business goal is to have a well-stocked shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a chain of shops. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more cooking fat, wheat flour and other items

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Rosa tiene 33 años, vive en unión libre con su pareja Alberto y tiene dos hijos; de 3 y 5 años, los cuales actualmente van al kinder. A ella y su familia les gusta salir a pasear, caminar y platicar.

Su café internet se llama Meteoro, en honor al meteoro que cayó en Rusia el año pasado. La principal actividad es la renta de los equipo de cómputo, aunque también se hacen trabajos, investigaciones, pago de servicios, mantenimiento de equipos de cómputo y recarga de cartuchos y tóner; está abierto de 7:30 a 22:00 horas.

El crédito lo necesita para la compra de material para construcción para mejorar su local: un carro de arena, varillas de 3/8, cemento, alambre, cimbra, clavos, poliducto, cajas para luz y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old.  She lives in a relationship with her partner Alberto and has two children, ages 3 and 5 years old, who are currently in Kindergarten.  She and her family like to go out for walks and to chat.

Her internet café is named Meteoro, in honor of the meteor that fell in Russia last year.  The main business is renting out the computer equipment, although she also does jobs, research, payment services, computer maintenance, and ink/toner refills.  She is open from 7:30 a.m. until 11:00 p.m.

She needs this loan to buy construction materials to improve her store: a load of sand, 3/8 inch rebar, cement, wire, scaffolding, nails, tubing, and electric boxes, and also to pay for the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her business: sand, rebar, cement, etc.

loans.name: Ajab

texts.en: Ajab is a 56-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of selling cloth in her locality for a period of about nine years.  She buys cloth in different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her fourth loan cycle and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es: José de 48 años de edad, solamente estudio cuarto grado, está separado de su pareja, con cual tiene tres hijos uno vive con él, la otra está acompañada y la otra niña tiene ocho años y vive con la mamá, la niña asiste a la escuela él vive con la mamá, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero tiene dieciséis años de dedicarse a la elaboración de cilos metálicos(hojalatería)el trabajo lo aprendió de CARE, pues los capacitaron, el trabajo lo hace en sus casa de habitación y uno de sus hijos le ayuda. El crédito que él ha solicitado lo invertirá en compra de abono y herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol y compra de materia de trabajo como lo es lamina, estaño, plomo y sellador. Sus planes de trabajo, mejorara para obtener más cliente, el piensa apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio, con el crédito se le ayuda ya que puede comprar los materiales necesarios de una sola vez ya que le sale más barato, las ganancias las gasta en la alimentación de sus hijos
texts.en:
José is 48 years old. He only went to school through fourth grade. He is separated from his wife, with whom he has three children. One lives with him, one has a partner, and the other daughter is eight years old and lives with her mother and attends school. He lives with his mother. He has always worked in agriculture, but for 16 years he has worked making metal silos (tinsmithing). He learned this work from CARE, since they trained him. He does the work in his home, and one of his sons helps him. 

He will invest the loan that he has applied for in the purchase of compost and herbicides for his planting of corn and beans and in the purchase of work materials such as metal sheets, tin, lead, and sealer. His work plans are to improve to have more customers. He is thinking of helping his children with their schooling. The loan will help him since he can buy the necessary materials all at once, and it will be cheaper. He spends the earnings to feed his children.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides for his planting of corn and beans, and to buy work material such as metal sheeting, tin, lead, and sealant

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business selling wood for many years. She sells wood to the people of her community to make handles for knives and furniture and to use for fuel.  Over time, Rabia has become famous in her area for providing good quality wood of different types. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Rabia is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation to purchase bundles of good quality wood and some cutters. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of good quality wood and some cutters.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 28-year-old Albertina from Masvingo. She is married with one child.  Albertina runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of transport problems from South Africa to Zimbabwe. Albertina has requested a loan of $1,500 to buy groceries for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her disposable income and buy a truck. In the future, Albertina plans to own five fully-stocked tuckshops.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be passionate. She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals and institutions. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to have a large stock of maize within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a large supplier.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities of life. With her husband (also shown in the photo), she has had an agricultural business for many years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good-quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Nasreen applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: La Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
La  asociación comunal la prosperidad, está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de tiempo de calidad con sus hijos. En la actualidad luchan día  a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es Marlit y tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, al cual dedica unas 8 horas dirías.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cerdos para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  La prosperidad agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a persona de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The La Prosperidad (Prosperity) loan group is made up of eight members, seven women and one man, who have ten children in their care. They are natives of the Sauce area, which is located in the northern zone of the region. They are known as responsible hard workers, with the will for personal achievement. In their free time, they like to enjoy quality time with their children. Now they strive day after day to offer a better future to their little children.

Thanks to her effort and her will to advance, the coordinator, Marlit, works in raising and selling live pigs. Her business is located at her home, and she works in it about eight hours a day. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling pigs, so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better earnings. La Prosperidad is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy a batch of live pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business by buying equipment and more fish to sell

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Luz Divina está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, madres y padre responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejora  a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tienen la coordinadora es Martha y tiene por actividad económica la venta de marisco de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación como camarones, pescados, jaiba, conchas, punches. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabaja y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de marisco, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas  kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Luz Divina community association is composed of eight members: seven women and one man. They are responsible parents with fifteen children under their responsibility. They come from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible and having a desire to improve themselves. Unfortunately, because of the lack of financial resources, they could not go to university and needed to start working at an early age in order to help with their household expenses. They currently struggle every day to provide a better future to their children. 

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get ahead in life, Martha is the coordinator of the group. Her occupation is the sale of shellfish, as a street vendor and at her home. She sells shrimp, fish, crab, and shells. She spends about eight hours a day selling her products. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business buying and selling shellfish, so that in the near future she could have a better income. Martha thanks the help that Kiva lenders provide to low income individuals in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have respectable work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock their business selling shellfish: shrimp, fish, crab, and shells.

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en: Hamda, age 50, is a hardworking married woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bedsheets and bedspreads for the past ten years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy bundles of bedsheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bedsheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steel sheets for scotchcart manufacturing

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana, age 33, is a married woman. She has two children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his van. He has been driving a van for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shabana has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers.

Shabana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts.

loans.name: Banco Comunal En Dios Confiamos Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal En Dios confiamos está conformado por once integrantes ocho mujeres y tres hombre, madres y padres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Malpaisillos, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables,  con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para bríndale un futuro mejor  a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Agustina y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles, leche, queso, detergente, jabón, huevos, queso, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. En Dios confiamos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community association "In God We Trust" is comprised of eleven members, eight women and three men.  They are responsible parents with twenty children under their care. They are originally from Malpaisillos, a place that is located in the north of the region and are characterized by being hardworking, responsible, wanting to improve themselves.

Unfortunately due to lack of economic resources, they could not go to school and had to work from an early age to help with household expenses. Currently they fight day by day to offer a better future for their children.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to succeed, Agustina is the coordinator and her business is a grocery store.  It is a small store that sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk , bread, milk, cheese, detergent, soap, eggs, and matches. She devotes to her business about twelve hours daily offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital for her business and to buy groceries so that in the not too distant future she will get more income. The "In God We Trust" association is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide for poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to to invest in her business work and  purchase food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, beans, milk, cheese, detergent, soap, eggs, cheese, matches for resale.

loans.name: Al- Sihab Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sihab. It consists of three women who are all hardworking. They are living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 110,000 YER.

Abeer is 29 years old and a married woman. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. Abeer is a very active woman. She works door to door selling women's clothes. Abeer started up her business five years ago. In the beginning, she had a small amount of money which she saved up herself. In time, she invested it in purchasing women's clothes and reselling them to her customers in her area, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. On the other hand, she wants to improve her business to purchase more women's clothes, but she doesn't have enough money to do so; therefore, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers.





Abeer expects a boost in her income and enrolls her children in a private school. Her dreams are to expand her business through purchasing different kind of stylish clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area for farming and her primary customers are individuals and institutions. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems and expensive herbicides. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs and also hire more land for farming. Her business goal is to do farming on a large scale within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs and also hire more land for farming

loans.name: Ronny Alberto Cajina

texts.es:
Los deseos de Ronny por culminar la carrera son notables, sabe que a la edad de treinta años, aún tiene un mundo lleno de oportunidades en el ámbito laboral, sus esperanzas nunca mueren. Vive en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano, Managua. Es soltero y tiene dos hijos, está a cargo de ambos. Estudia en la Universidad en modo sabatino. 
Los días de semana, Ronny trabaja en una empresa y los sábados estudia. Asegura que en la vida se requieren esfuerzos para luego ver los resultados positivos. Él solicita el préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación. Su meta es graduarse, lograr ser un licenciado de prestigio y de éxito;  quiere ser un modelo a seguir para sus hijos, por lo tanto pone su fe en Educredito.
texts.en:
Ronny's desires for finishing his degree are notable. He knows that at his age of 30 years, he still has a world full of opportunities in the working field. His hope never dies. He lives in the neighborhood of Monseñor Lezcano, Managua. He is single and has two children; he is in charge of both. He studies in the university on Saturdays. On weekdays, Ronny works in a business and on Saturdays he studies.

He assures that in life, one is required to strive to later see positive results. He is applying for the loan to pay for his degree course. His goal is to graduate, achieve being a prestigious and successful alumnus. He wants to be a model for his children to follow, therefore he puts his faith in Educredito.

loans.use: to pay for his degree course.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es soltero y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación que tiene el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en La Paz, Wilfredo trabaja como chofer asalariado y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos. Wilfredo necesita crédito para su salud, pues el oftalmólogo le dijo que necesita usar lentes. Wilfredo es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda.
texts.en: Wilfredo is single and has one son who is in school. He lives in his mother's house, occupying only one room that has a dirt floor. The house is located in La Paz. Wilfredo works as a salaried chauffeur and what he earns, he has to cover the expenses of food, education and payment of basic services. Wilfredo needs the loan for this health. The ophthalmologist told him that he needs to use glasses. Wilfredo is the only source of income in his home, therefore he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy glasses.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos quien aparece en la foto con su pareja y socia, es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Carlos tiene 26 años y vive en la delegación de Tlalpan en la ciudad de México. Vive en unión libre con su pareja y no tiene hijos. Hace 5 años, decidió con su pareja iniciar un negocio de materias primas y abarrotes en el cual venden productos como chiles secos, moles, dulces, productos desechables, etc. 

Pide este préstamo para completar la apertura de un segundo negocio que está abriendo, del mismo giro pero en otra calle; y cualquier restante lo invertiría en mercancía para su negocio. Para Carlos es un gran logro que empezó con muy poco y gracias a su esfuerzo lo ha hecho crecer; abriendo un segundo local.
texts.en:
Carlos, who appears in the photo with his wife, is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Carlos is 26 years old and lives in Tlalpan in Mexico. He has a common law marriage and does not have children. Five years ago, he decided with his wife to start a business of basic ingredients and groceries in which they sell products like dried chiles, moles (sauce), candy, plastic plates, etc. 

He is asking for this loan to complete the opening of a second business that he is opening, of the same type but on a different street. He will invest anything remaining in merchandise for his business. For Carlos, it is a big achievement that he started with very little, and thanks to his efforts, he has made it grow (opening a second location).

loans.use: to open a new grocery store.

loans.name: Victor
