texts.es: Victor es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz Victor trabaja en el área de sistemas en una entidad pública por más de 8 horas Necesita credito para hacer una remodelacion y arreglos en su cocina. Victor es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Victor es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz Victor trabaja en el área de sistemas en una entidad pública por más de 8 horas Necesita credito para hacer una remodelacion y arreglos en su cocina. Victor es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda

loans.use: Remodelacion y arreglos de cocina

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 41-year-old married woman who is the mother of seven children.  For three years, Safia has been running a business selling milk with the support of her husband. She has two buffaloes and one cow. Her husband assists her by supplying the milk for their locality. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. 

Safia helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is in her fifth loan cycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Çelebije

texts.en: Celebije is 58 years old, widowed, and lives in a Roma minority community. Her husband passed away, and she now lives with her son and his family. For many years she had been working and earning some income by making handicrafts, such as things for girls who are going to be married as well as for recently married women. Her son is a musician and performs during weddings and other celebrations. Celebije is now in need of a loan in order to purchase materials for her handicrafts business so that she can sustain and continue her business and therefore contribute to her family. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her handicrafts business so that she can sustain and continue her business

loans.name: Women In Progress Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 27-year-old Sandra from Harare. She is married with three children, and two are attending school. She also cares for three other dependents. Sandra runs a business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge she faces is on credit sales, as debtors sometimes fail to pay on time. Sandra has requested a loan of $375.00 to buy clothes for resale and boost her business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future Sandra plans to open a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy stock for resale

loans.name: Mourice

texts.en: Mourice is a 28-year-old married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest and determined. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy and friendly place and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy tools for repairing motor vehicles. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing motor vehicles

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Nargis’ husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nargis has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services for his passengers. Nargis is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Zivana

texts.en:
Zivana, 64 years old, lives in one of the minority communities in Kosovo with her son, her husband and their grandchildren. Her son is the main source of income, but has a low salary at his place of employment. Because her husband worked for a railway in the past, he receives a monthly pension. 

Zivana is a hard workingwoman; she and her husband have worked together in agriculture for many years now in order to provide additional income for their family. They have land where they plant wheat, corn and different vegetables for their family to consume and to sell. Now, they are in need of some new tractor tools in order to make their work more effective and efficient. This loan will be a great help to them, as it will help to continue decreasing family expenses and bring additional income into the house. Zivana wants to thank all for the lending.

loans.use: To buy a new tractor tools in order to make their work more effective and efficient

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es electricista, tiene dos hijos, vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe. Necesita el credito para cubrir los gastos de educación de sus 2 hijos que van a la escuela. Oscar tiene que comprar útiles escolares y pagar pensiones. Oscar es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Oscar is an electrician. He has two children, he lives in El Alto in an adobe house. He needs a loan to cover the education expenses of his two children that go to school. Oscar has to buy school supplies and pay for other expenses. Oscar is the only source of income in the home, therefore he needs your help.

loans.use: to cover the school expenses of his children, buy school supplies, and pay for other expenses.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es: Amercio trabaja todo el dia como chofer de taxi en la ciudad de La Paz, Americo es casado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en La Paz Americo necesita credito para pagar un mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en: Amercio works every day as a taxi driver in the city of La Paz. Americo is married and has two children, with whom he lives in La Paz. Americo needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.use: to do car maintenance.

loans.name: Lizeth Margarita

texts.es: Lizeth es una joven que llego hasta el tercer año de secundaria, se dedica a la actividad comercial de perfumes ropa y cosméticos, es madre soltera que busca como salir adelante con su pequeño negocio, solicita el crédito para invertir en variedades de ropa, perfumes y un poco de calzado. Lizeth tiene mucha ilusión de que en un futuro pueda poner una venta de comida en el parque de la comarca donde habita, para apoyar a sus hijos quienes más adelante desea que cursen una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Lizeth is a young woman who completed her junior year of high school.  She is in the business of selling perfume, clothes and cosmetics.  She is a single mother looking to succeed with her small business.

She is requesting a loan to invest in a variety of clothes, perfumes and some footwear.

Lizeth has high hopes that in the future she may add the sale of food in the park of the region where she lives to support her children who later want to pursue a professional career.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is 30 years old, a married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Nazia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to cover the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nazia has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Nazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some spare auto parts

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. She has a business manufacturing "waan," which is a thread-like material used in making bedsteads of wooden frames on four legs. She offers various types of waan in different colors and has become famous for providing good-quality material in her community. Nasreen operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. They are contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy another good machine to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy another good machine

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 44 -year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last five years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Parveen makes a good income to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As Parveen wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Parveen is in her ninth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Granit

texts.en:
Granit lives in the southern part of Kosovo. He is single and 25 years old. For more than two years now, he has been running his own café in order to earn a living. He is very ambitious and enjoys working a lot and very hard. Usually his customers are from the younger generation, who have a good time getting together at the café and drinking coffee and other drinks. 

Granit is now in need of a loan to purchase some inventory to satisfy his customers' demands and expectations. By doing this, he will be able to continue to serve his current clients and get repeat business as well as new clients. Granit hopes he will be able to get married in the near future, have children and save money for their future. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to satisfy his customers' demands and expectations.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 46-year-old married woman. Three years ago, she started her own business selling cloth in her locality to contribute to the family income. Her husband is a welder by profession and earns a low income to support the needs of the family members alone. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. 

Nargis requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en:
Kishwer, aged 41, is a married woman. She has been operating a milk selling business for a period of about six years, and she has two milk buffaloes. She sells milk to many of her neighbours, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

Kishwer has five children, and she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support for it. 

Now Kishwer has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She is expecting a boost in her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y por los cuales se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante. Antonia es de condiciona humilde económicamente, por ello sus trabajo como agricultora es muy importante ya que con el fruto de sus cosechas puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante; Antonia actualmente ha sembrado maíz y yuca, asimismo vende animales como gallinas, patos, entre otros, con los cuales tiene un ingreso extra para poder salir adelante.

Antonia esta agradecida por el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a esa ayuda ella podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, asimismo dar mantenimiento al cultivo, solventar los gastos de regadío, entre otros; de esta manera podrá mejorar su cultivo y tener una buena cosecha y de esta manera seguir esforzándose para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir esforzándose para hacer su sueño realidad:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Antonia lives in the city of Aguaytia with her husband and their two children, whom she loves and for whom she strives every day to get by. Antonia is in poor economic conditions, so her work as a farmer is very important because with the fruit of her crops she can have income to get ahead; Antonia has now planted corn and cassava and also sell animals like chickens, ducks, among others, which produce extra income to get by.

Antonia is grateful for the support given by the Kiva lenders and thanks to this help she can buy plant food, fertilizer, also maintain the crop, meet the cost of irrigation, among others.  This way she can enhance her crops and have a good harvest and thus continue to strive to give a better quality of life to her family and continue efforts to realize her dream: "Give a profession to the children."

loans.use: to purchase of plant food, fertilizer, maintenance, etc.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 42-year-old married woman. She is doing business by selling milk. She has five calves and two cows to milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has four children: all go to school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet their day-to-day life expenses. 

This is Shahida's fifth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with the support of it. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves that she already has. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk that will ultimately  increase her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for her calves.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is 46 years old, married and the mother of five children.  One of her sons is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Suriya has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 for her son. He wants to buy new tires and some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Suriya is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some tools for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar, a 41-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it and then sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection on offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Kousar has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy bundles of cloth and spools of thread, laces and ribbons in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfil the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Kousar's fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth and spools of thread, laces and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en:
Kaniz is 40 years old, a married woman and the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Kaniz’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Kaniz has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Kaniz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Benkady Group

texts.fr:
Benkady  est un regroupement de femmes du village M’pessoba, Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que du Riz, Condiments, Pâte d’arachide, Tissus, Fil, Pain, Légumes,  Fruits, etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois.      
Kadiatou   assise en deuxième position de la gauche vers la  droite au premier rang, est une vendeuse de tissus et pièces de pagnes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de tissus et des  pièces de pagnes à M’pessoba et les vend à la maison à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkady comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadiatou compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Benkady group gathers women from the M'pessoba village of Koutiala.  All the members of the group are married.  They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  They are, on average, 36 years old and also have an average of at least four children each.  

This group of women buys and sells various goods such as rice, condiments, groundnut paste, fabrics, thread, bread, vegetables, fruits etc.  In order to boost their businesses, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first loan.

Kadiatou, the featured borrower, sells fabrics and "pagnes" sets (colorful West African fabrics).  In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy some fabrics and "pagnes" sets in M'pessoba in order to resell them from home to a diverse group of customers.

While the other members of the Benkady group are each expecting to make an average profit of 100,000 CFA francs during this loan cycle, Kadiatou is expecting to make a profit of 105,000 CFA francs.

The members of the group will use their earnings to repay their loans and also to cover their personal expenses and increase their businesses.  They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to prevent a shortage of stocks.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail is a proud beneficiary of UGAFODE Kiva loans and thanks the lenders for the opportunity to partner with Kiva. He is hard up and urgently needs money to pay for his children's tuition just in time to sit for their examinations. He is hard working and thanks Ugafode for answering all his financial needs. He is hard working.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 56-year-old married woman with eight children. She describes herself to be sincere and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy and friendly place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough products to sell. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 48-year-old widow. She has been selling milk for many years. She has one cow and one buffalo in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has five children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, good food, health and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with their support. Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Diana Janeth

texts.es:
Ella  se llama Diana Janeth, tiene 19 años, ella viven  con el padre  Jairo y Ana y el hermano  Nicolás Julián y Yadira, ella término los estudios en 2012 y se puso a estudiar contabilidad en el Sena, pero se salió a mitad de año 2013, ya que no el gusto, después se puso a trabajar  para comprarse las cosas que ella necesitaba. 
 
Después de poco tiempo toma la deserción de empezar  a estudiar hotelería y turismo  en un instituto llamado campo alto, ella está muy feliz  porque  desde muy    chiquita quería  estudiar hotelería y turismo, ella ya empieza a estudiar y este es el  primer semestre, ella  le  llama muchos  la  atención esa carrera, porque tiene mucho en el  campo laboral y muchas cosas por aprender,  ella dice que cuando acabe quiere tener el propio hotel, y también quiere ir a conocer muchos países, ella  es una  persona colaboradora, amigable, feliz, sobre  todo respetuosa y colaboradora con la familia, espera que siga adelante con el sueño y meta. 

Ella necesita del convenio con kiva ya es una estudiante que no cuenta con los mejores recursos económicos, y no tiene la posibilidad de todos los meses pagar el valor completo de la mensualidad, es por eso que siente interés por el convenio de kiva y la ayuda que a ella le puedan dar, para poder terminar la carrera que es una de las que mas le gusta.
texts.en:
This is Diana Janeth. She is 19 years old. She lives with her parents, Jairo and Ana, and her siblings, Nicolás Julián and Yadira. She finished her schooling in 2012 and began to study accounting in El Sena, but she left in the middle of the year 2013 because she didn't like it. Afterwards she began to work to buy the things that she needed.

After a little while, she decided to begin studying the hotel business and tourism at an institute called Campo Alto. She is very happy, because she has wanted to study the hotel business and tourism ever since she was very little. She has already begun to study, and this is her first semester. This program called her attention a lot, because it has a lot of practical work and many things to learn. She says that when she finishes, she would like to have her own hotel, and she also wants to learn about many countries. She is a co-operative, friendly, and happy person, and above all, respectful and co-operative with her family. She hopes that she can continue forward with her dream and goal.

She needs the agreement with Kiva since she is a student who doesn't have the best economic resources, and she doesn't have the possibility of paying the complete monthly amount every month. It is for this reason that she feels interested in the agreement with Kiva and the help that they can give her to be able to finish the program that is one of those that she likes most.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school fees

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo  est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala,  village M’pessoba qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Riz, Condiments, Sucre  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Chata assise au bout et à  droite est une vendeuse de Riz et des divers condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de sacs de riz et de condiments au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure de ces sacs de riz et condiments au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Chata compte réaliser  140 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group gathers women from the M'pessoba village of Koutiala. All the members of the group are married and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are, on average, 38 years old and also have an average of at least five children each.

This group of women buys and sells various goods such as rice, condiments, sugar and various other goods.  In order to boost their businesses, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their fourth solidarity loan.

Chata, the featured borrower, sells rice and various condiments.  In the photo, she is seated first from the right. She is planning to use her loan to buy bags of rice and condiments which she will resell little by little, from home and at the market, to a diverse group of customers.  She buys rice and condiments at the Grand Market.  

While the other members of the Djekafo group are each expecting to make an average profit of 120,000 CFA francs during this loan cycle, Chata is expecting to make a profit of 140,000 CFA francs.

The members of the group will use their earnings to repay their loans and also to cover their personal expenses and increase their businesses.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is a 36-year-old, married woman and the mother of three children. Her husband is a laborer but his income is not enough for their household expenditures so she started a business selling cloth a year ago. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Currently, Uzma requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Asghari

texts.en: Asghari is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Asghari’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Asghari has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Asghari is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some tools.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-years-old married man who has two children.  His oldest child is two years old and the youngest one is one month. He lives with his family in a rented house in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Ali faces many challenges in his life, but he doesn't surrender to these challenges.  He has the ambition to change his miserable conditions, but he doesn't have enough financial support for that.  Ali has a small amount of money, but it is not enough to begin his own business. 

For this reason, he is applying for  300,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to become a taxi driver and purchase a taxi.  This will enable  him to improve the living standards of his family. 

Ali aspires to have a minibus in addition to the taxi to gain more of profits, so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family. His dreams in the future are buying a piece of land and building a house.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi and begin his business as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiseme  est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala,  village M’pessoba qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Condiments, fil, Tissus, Huile, Farine, Légume, Fruits et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Sanata assise au bout et à gauche est une vendeuse de produits cosmétiques (Pommade, Crèmes, Parfums, Déodorants). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter ces produits  au grand marché et vend en détail  à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiseme comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sanata compte réaliser  130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The Djiguiseme group gathers women from the M'pessoba village of Koutiala. All the members of the group are married and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are, on average, 36 years old and also have an average of at least four children each.

This group of women buys and sells various goods such as condiments, thread, fabrics, oil, flour, vegetables, fruits and other various products. In order to boost their businesses, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their fourth solidarity loan.

Sanata, the featured borrower, sells cosmetic products (ointments, creams, perfumes, deodorants).  In the photo, she is seated first from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy some cosmetic products at the Grand Market, and will resell them on a retail basis from home and at the market to a diverse group of customers.

While the other members of the Djiguiseme group are each expecting to make an average profit of 125,000 CFA francs during this loan cycle, Sanata is expecting to make a profit of 130,000 CFA francs.

The members of the group will use part of their earnings to repay their loans and also to cover their personal expenses and increase their businesses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en: Nebojsa is a 48-year-old divorced father of two children who are 12 and 14 years old. He is employed by a water system company as a driver and makes only enough to pay for his daily expenses.  Although the children live with their mother, he visits them often and currently is living alone. The house that he lives in is very old and because of the lack of money, he has never managed to renovate the toilette, which is in very bad condition. Now, he is requesting a loan in order to do general renovations to the toilette so that he can improve his living environment and standards. He is very grateful to the lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: To do general renovations to the toilette

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 20-year-old woman from Khashuri. She has a young daughter and lives with her husband.  He works at the workshop and earns 250 GEL monthly. Maia is not currently working. She married at an early age and wasn’t able to receive an education.  She does not have a university degree, which is one of the main reasons she is unemployed. 

The current income isn't enough for the 3-member family to meet everyday expenses, so Maia has decided to start her own business. She  couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institution because they require that the applicant have business experience or a stable income. 

The Start Up program is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poor applicants like Maia,  to start a business. With the 300 USD, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and resell them locally for a profit.
 
She is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure that her daughter will receive a good education and be successful.  This loan will be a great support for the family. Maia is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to earn an income.

loans.use: to start a clothing business.

loans.name: Luis Horacio

texts.es:
La majestuosa plaza de los leones, llena de historia y belleza arquitectónica de sus estructuras coloniales llenan de belleza a la ciudad de Granada así también su humilde gente que trabaja en el campo como lo hace el joven Luis de 26 años, casado y padre de 1 hijo que aún tiene a su cargo. Se dedica  a la siembra de melón, fruta tropical que llena de colorido el mercado local de la ciudad, hace 8 años inicio esta actividad en un pequeño terreno. Sus próximas metas son incursionar nuevos cultivos tales como: sandia, papaya, piña en su área trabajo. 

Solicitando un crédito para la culminación de la cosecha de melón y de igual forma para la compra de nuevas hectáreas para trabajar; estimando que será de gran ayuda el crédito a solicitud porque lograra incrementar el tamaño de su negocio y obtener más rubros para cosechar y comercializar en el mercado local de la ciudad y municipios cercanos; obteniendo como planes a futuro la implementación de nuevos sistemas de riegos para obtener productos de excelentes calidad.
texts.en:
The majestic plaza of the lions, full of the history and architectural beauty of its colonial structures, fills the city of Granada with beauty, as do its humble people who work in the fields, like this young man, Luís, who is 26 years old. He is married and is the father of one son, for whom he is responsible. He raises melons, a tropical fruit that fills the local market of the city with color. He began this work 8 years ago on a little plot of land. His next goals are to explore new crops such as watermelons, papayas, and pineapples in his area of his work.

He is applying for a loan to finish the melon harvest and likewise to purchase new hectares of land to work. He judges that the loan will be a great help to him because he will be able to increase the size of his business and obtain more crops to harvest and sell in the local market of the city and in nearby towns. His plans for the future are to implement new systems of irrigation to obtain products of excellent quality.

loans.use: to finish harvesting the melon crop and likewise to buy new hectares to farm

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Emily; she is from Masvingo, a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. She is married with four children, three of whom are attending school.  

Emily runs a business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenge that she faces is that of suppliers selling chicks which have stunted growth. Emily has requested a loan of $350 to buy stock feed. She says that the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. 

In the future, Emily plans to have a plot of land where she can keep over a thousand birds.

loans.use: to buy stock feed.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 22-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be good. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, beauty products, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are reliable customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of washing soap, beauty products and other household items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved business and life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more washing soap, beauty products and other household items

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 40-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a construction business building houses. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are estate developers. He describes his biggest business challenge as security.

Albert will use this 50,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy building equipment. His business goal is to have a construction firm within 5 years. He hopes that he will economically sustain his business in the future. This is his second loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy building equipment for his construction business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: Narcisa es una señora viuda, sus hijos que procreo hoy en día son mayores de edad e independientes, ella se mantiene gracias a su negocio de pulpería que ha venido laborando por muchos años, medio con el que ha sacado adelante a su familia. Solicita de este crédito para invertir en granos básicos, aceite, productos lácteos, pollo verduras, para abastecer a su clientela.
texts.en: Narcisa is a widow. Her children are now adults and independent. She supports herself thanks to the grocery business that she has been working in for many years and through which she has raised her family. She is applying for this loan to invest in basic grains, oil, dairy products, chicken, and vegetables to supply her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, dairy products, chicken, and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives with her husband and three children in Ajarkut village, in the Tavush region. She is a teacher working at the local village school. 

Together with her husband, Narine also cultivates field crops. In addition, they have been raising animals for many years. Narine uses the milk for cheese production and sells the dairy products locally. Income from agribusiness is very important for Narine and her family; so they decided to ask this loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge support for the family, and enable them to purchase five oxen and enrich the livestock that they own.

As this is Narine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase five oxen.

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en:
Arevhat is a divorced woman who lives with her two children who are 11 and 12 years old.
 
Arevhat is a lawyer  but is currently unemployed. She owns a plot of land but because of financial difficulties, is unable to cultivate it. She requests 1,200 USD to purchase seeds, fertilizer and hire workers. 

She will be very grateful to lenders if they support the development of her agribusiness.
 
Arevhat has previously taken a loan from local financial institutions but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her agribusiness is successful and making monthly payments, Arevhat has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and hire workers.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 49-year-old Adam, who is from Murehwa. He is married with four children, one of whom is attending school.  

Adam runs a retail business selling clothes and spare bicycle parts. The business has been in operation for nine years. He says the main challenge he is facing is a shortage of capital. Adam has requested a loan of $400 to buy spare bicycle parts to re-sell. He says that the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve his family's general welfare. In the future, Adam plans to build a shop of his own.

loans.use: to buy spare bicycle parts to re-sell.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 60-year-old, hard-working woman, living in the village of Algeti, in the Marneuli district. She lives with her daughter and son, who are temporarily unemployed. 

Khalida works hard on the family owned vineyard, and also rents a plot of agricultural land. However, the income isn't stable and her business needs some investment for further development. After several unsuccessful attempts, Khalida applied for a loan from MFO Credo. Her request was approved within the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

With the requested money, she will cultivate the land, plant alfalfa and sell it locally. She will be able to generate more income and make a better life for her children. 
The family's living conditions will improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products that are available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Khalida awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and plant alfalfa.

loans.name: Tasangana

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Tasangana from Murehwa. He is married with three children who are all attending school.  

Tasangana runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for four years. He says the main challenge that he faces is that of a shortage of goods. Tasangana has requested a loan of $250 to buy groceries to re-sell. He says that the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the general welfare of his family. In the future Tasangana plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries to re-sell, such as cooking oil, sugar, salt and other basic commodities.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush lives in Argavand village with her three children and husband. Her elder son is an army officer and her little one is currently a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Hranush's daughter is a teacher at the local village school and the family's father works at the local post office.

Hranush runs a farm. She keeps 30 chickens and is mostly involved in land cultivation. In particular, Hranush cultivates tomatoes, onions, peppers, and watermelon and grows cherry and plum trees. She works hard to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring a stable income from agribusiness. As this is Hranush's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 

Hranush will wait for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and seeds

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a peasant farmer in rural Lyantonde. He is involved in a  small-scale agriculture farm and raises goats and sheep.

He needs a loan to buy goats to raise and sell. He thanks Kiva lenders and believes that his business will grow. 

Thank you!  Charles and the Ugafode credit officer are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Lazaro Gabriel

texts.es: Lázaro Gabriel 22 años de edad soltero, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, producción y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, se caracteriza por ser un joven trabajador, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, es un microempresario quien es propietario y administrador de un taller de ebanistería en cual trabaja con varios ayudantes el cual les paga quincenal, ofrecen todo tipo de muebles como: roperos, puertas, ventanas, camas, cunas, cómodas, muebles de pantris, juegos de sillas mecedoras, comedores y todo tipo de muebles comerciales y de catálogos por encargos, entre otros todos de gran calidad, sus compras las realiza en aserradores y a comerciantes de  comarcas aledañas a su  localidad, inicia su negocio con ayuda de su papa quien lo incentivo a este negocio y luego fue dándose a conocer su trabajo, uno de sus sueños es poder edificar su propia casa con mejores condiciones, y el de crecer en su negocio, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital e trabajo en la compra de madera, clavos, tornillos, zener, lacas, pega, lanillas, visagras, cerraduras, entre otros, para suplir varios pedidos de clientes que le encargaron muebles.
texts.en:
Lázaro Gabriel is single, 22 years old, and a native of one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the west of the country in a predominantly commercial sector and where there is one of the nation's largest refineries.

He is characterized as a young worker, responsible, eager to improve himself.  He is a micro-entrepreneur who owns and operates a carpentry workshop where he works with several assistants who are paid biweekly.  He offers all kinds of furniture such as armoirs, doors, windows, beds, cribs, dressers, pantries, sets of rocking chairs, dining sets and all types of commercial furniture  as well as catalogs for special orders.  All his work is of high quality.

His sales are made to merchants and dealers in the surrounding area.  He started his business with the help of his father who encouraged him in this business and later he became well-known for his work.

One of his dreams is to build his own home with better conditions, and to grow his business.  The purpose of this loan is to invest in capital and the work by purchasing wood, nails, screws, veneers, lacquers, glue, steel wool, hinges, locks, etc. in order to meet the demands of customers ordering furniture.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as wood, screws, glue, veneer, cane, nails, steel wool, hinges and other items.

loans.name: Nashon

texts.en:
Nashon is a 33-year-old man from Kakamega.  He is  married to Judith who is a small scale farmer and they have a four-year-old child.

He has had a shoe repair business for nine years and earns 28,000 KES monthly. This is his second loan with Vision fund Kenya and he will use it to buy shoe soles, glue, and thread to repair shoes.

The profits will be used to pay fees and repay the loan.  His dream is to open a workshop to make new shoes.

loans.use: to purchase thread and glue to repair shoes and buy new shoe soles.

loans.name: Sabahat

texts.en:
Sebahat is married and has three children.  

She began her career when her children grew up and married.  She  knits and sells her creations to her friends.  She makes many things and opened a stand to sell them and contribute to her family's income.   

With the loan from Maya, she will buy supplies to make more products and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Un conjunto de pequeñas islas en la superficie del Lago Cocibolca hacen la construcción natural y más atractiva de la Ciudad de Granada así de igual forma lo hacen las joyas que elabora manualmente la Joven María Luisa residente actual de la Ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de una pequeña hija; propietaria de un  pequeño negocio de venta de bisutería, ropa y cosméticos; los inicios de su negocio los tuvo cuando era una niña que vendía manzanilla luego una crisis la obligo a elaborar joyas manualmente, atractivas para cada persona que visita su local; obteniendo como metas próximas la rentabilidad, sostenibilidad y crecimiento continuo de su negocio.

 Solicita un crédito para la compra de nueva mercadería como ropa, cosméticos y materiales para la elaboración de las joyas que elabora manualmente (bisutería); estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá abastecer a todos sus clientes que le realizan pedidos y también para la inversión de un nuevo local; sus planes a futuros es la exportación de sus productos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su bebe y de igual manera la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
A group of little islands on the surface of Lake Cocibolca forms the natural and most attractive shape of the city of Granada, and so it is with the jewelry that the young woman Maria Luisa makes by hand. She is now a resident of the city of Granada. She is married and is the mother of a little daughter. She is the owner of a small business where she sells jewelry, clothing, and cosmetics. This business had its beginnings when she was a girl who sold chamomile. Then a crisis obliged her to make jewelry by hand, and it was attractive to everyone who visited her shop. Her next goals are profitability, sustainability, and continual growth for her business.

She is applying for a loan to purchase new merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, and materials to make the jewelry that she makes by hand. She feels that the loan she has applied for will be a great help to her, since she will be able to supply all her customers who place orders with her and also invest in a new shop. Her plans for the future are to export her products to improve her living conditions and those of her baby, and in the same way, to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, and materials for the jewelry that she makes by hand.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and has three children.  Two of her children are in school and one is in the military.  

Three years ago, what started as a project of her children became a business.  Everyone liked her hand-made cardboard clocks.  With the loan, she will buy supplies to make a greater variety of clocks.  

Emine is hardworking, productive and enterprising and wants to ensure a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Al- Fager Rim Group

texts.en:
Al- Fager Rim is a group consisting of four women, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Rim is a 26-year-old single woman, living with her family in their own house in the capital. She is an educated woman with a Secondary certificate. 

She is employed by Yemen Mobile Company in the private sector but her salary is not enough to cover the family's expenses. Rim's father bought a piece of land and started to build his home but has stopped because there is not enough money to complete the building. For this reason, Rim decided to help her father in that work but she doesn't have enough money.  She requests 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to complete the building of the first floor of the house.

Rim looks forward to building the second floor and furnishing it as a rental.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials .

loans.name: Neema 'b' Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late 30s, is a single mother with one school-aged child. She has  a beauty salon and a cosmetics business.  She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy salon equipment and cosmetics to sell at the salon.  She dreams of having a big business. 

Mariam will share this loan with her loan "NEEMA 'B'" which has five members who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and  cosmetics to resell at the salon.

loans.name: Lydia Del Socorro

texts.es: Lydia del Socorro, 44 años de edad, casada  con tres hijos el cual solo uno está bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser turística, comercial, sus hermosas playas, Lydia es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar u una carrera por lo que se vio obligada a trabajar desde muy joven  para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Hoy en día  lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo. Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, es por lo que decide ser propietaria de una hermosa pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, fósforos, jugos, huevos, cuajadas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, leña, Cosméticos, pan, bananos, detergentes, papel higiénicos,  sal, shampoo, tomates, cebollas, plátanos, entre otros más,  ubicado en su casa de habitación. Sus compras son al contado en mercados y distribuidoras de la zona, sus ventas son al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Lydia abre las puertas de su pulpería desde muy temprano, para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, El objetivo de este financiamiento  es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de consumo para el hogar, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lydia del Socorro is 44 years old and is married with three children of which only one is under her care.  She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the west of the country, an area that is known for tourism, industry and beautiful beaches.

Lydia is a hardworking, responsible woman, with many hopes for self-improvement. Due to the lack of financial resources she could not pursue a career so she was obliged to work from a young age to help with household expenses. Today she struggles every day to provide a better future for her child.

Thanks to her effort and desire to succeed, she decided to start a beautiful grocery store which offers consumer products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, matches, juices, eggs, curds, soda, fruit drinks, fire wood, cosmetics, bread, bananas, detergents, toilet paper, salt, shampoo, tomatoes, onions, plantains, among other things, and is located in her home.

Her purchases are made in cash at markets and distributors in the area, and her sales are in cash. She has permanent and temporary customers. Lydia opens the doors of her store very early to better serve its customers. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and her business in the buying and selling of consumer products for the home so that in the near future she can get a better income.

loans.use: to purchase consumer products for her grocery store: basic grains, frozen food, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Ararat region with her husband, three sons, daughter-in-law and young granddaughter.  The family members are kind and outgoing. Gayane's elder son is army officer and her youngest son is a teacher who works at the local village school. 

Gayane grows crops and has operated a grape orchard for 10 years. The harvest is sold locally for additional income.
 
Now, by applying for this loan, Gayane asks lenders to help with the farm. She will use 3,000 USD to purchase wires, fertilizer, watering, and workers for the grape orchard. 

Gayane has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her agribusiness is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Gayane has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products

loans.use: to pay for wires, fertilizer, water and workers.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia, who is 41 years old, lives and works in Accra-Teshie. Felicia is married and has children. 

Felicia received a little money from her husband to establish her business to sell cosmetics, drinks, cooking utensils, corn and cassava dough. She works 10 hours per day, Monday to Saturday. She faces no major problems except earning only a small income. 

She requests a loan to purchase cosmetics, drinks, cooking utensils, cassava and corn dough to sell to customers. Her plan is to one day build a house. She appreciates the lenders of Kiva for supporting ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, drinks, cooking utensils, cassava and corn dough.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-year-old Stephen from Murehwa. He is married with three children, all attend school. He also cares for three other dependents. 

Stephen runs an agriculture business to sell chickens. The business has been in operation for 1 year. He says the main challenges faced are shortage of money to buy feed and a high mortality rate in winter. 

Stephen has requested 300 USD to buy feed. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve his family's standard of living. In the future Stephen plans to have 1,000 chickens.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Clinic

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 49-year-old Clinic from Gokwe. He is married with four children and three attend school. He also cares for one other dependent. 

Clinic runs a retail business to sell  sugar, flour, washing soap, bathing soap, rice, and other basic commodities to surrounding villages. The business has been in operation for 5 years. He says the main challenges faced are lack of capital and low sales during the beginning of the year. 

Clinic has requested a loan of 700 USD to purchase grocery products. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the social status of his family. In the future Clinic plans to increase the number of his shops.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for groceries.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a single mother of six children. All her children go school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house. The family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Maria has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 7 years. She generates additional income by selling firewood. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders customers reaching out to her. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also wants a delivery van to ease transportation. 

Maria has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Forty-seven year old Caroline is a single woman residing in the Teshie-Accra, Ghana. She has been selling shoes, slippers, and materials through hawking to her customers who are children, women and men. This is her eighth loan with ID-Ghana and second with Kiva. She has repaid all her previous loan without trouble and she is requesting for GHS 2,200 to buy and sell shoes, slippers and materials.

loans.use: to buy and sell shoes, slippers and materials for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour and sugar.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea de 54 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato en la ciudad, es casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como jornalero, tienen un hijo que estudia 1er año de bachillerato , con ella solo vive su esposo y su hijo.

     La señora tiene una venta de comida. Ella lleva dos meses de haber iniciado con esta actividad, por iniciativa propia decidió vender comida, ya que en el pueblo no hay comedores formales; es decir donde poder consumir alimentos sólidos, a parte que siempre le ha gustado cocinar ya que su madre le enseño cuando era joven.

 Antes se dedicaba a trabajar como sastre,  pero le ocasionaba un dolor en la espalda estar tanto sentada a la máquina y decidió dejar ese oficio. El negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa y en él se involucra su esposo y su hijo cuando está en casa.


El  préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 1 plancha para elaborar pupusas, una licuadora, los víveres para hacer la comida, 5 rollos de papel aluminio,  un quintal de maíz , cincuenta libras de frijoles. Obtendrá más ingresos con los cuales podrá cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
 
Andrea con las ganancias pretende ampliar su negocio y lo hará comprando una mesa térmica donde tener caliente la comida a sus clientes, también pretende que su hijo se convierta en un profesional que puedan valerse por sí solo y que sea un  elemento importante dentro de la sociedad
texts.en:
Andrea is 54 years old and completed her high school education in the city. She is married and her husband works as a day laborer. They have a son who is in his first year of high school. Her husband and son are the only ones living with her.

Sra. Andrea has a business in which she sells food. She started this venture two months ago and came up with the idea of selling food on her own since there are no formal eateries in her town where people can enjoy a hearty meal. Andrea has always enjoyed cooking since being taught by her mother at a young age.

She previously worked as a tailor, but she occasionally experienced back pain whenever she was seated at a sewing machine. For this reason, she decided to pursue another line of work. Her business is set up in her house and she involves her husband and her son whenever they are at home.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy one flat top grill for making “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas), a blender, ingredients for preparing food, five rolls of aluminum foil, one quintal (100 kg) of corn, and 50 pounds of beans. This will enable her to generate more income so that she can cover her household needs.

Andrea intends to expand her business with her earnings as well as purchase a heated buffet table so that she can serve hot food to her customers. She also intends for her son to become a professional so that he can make it on his own, which is an important part of integrating into society.

loans.use: to buy a flat top grill, a blender, ingredients for preparing food, aluminum foil, corn, and beans.

loans.name: Noemy Guadalupe

texts.es: Nohemy tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Nohemy se dedica a la venta de joyería enchapada por catalogo. Nohemy  es una joven emprendedora quien recorre las principales zonas de su localidad para ofrecer sus productos y cada día son más las personas que la prefieren.  Ella desea reparar el techo de su vivienda dado que se encuentra en mal estado. Ademas, desea construir una pila para almacenar el agua. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y ladrillo.
texts.en:
Nohemy is 20 years old and resides in her own home along with her two-year-old son. She sells plated jewelry through catalogs. Nohemy is an enterprising young woman who travels through the main areas of her town in order to offer her products. Each day there are more people who prefer to do business with her.

Nohemy wants to repair the roof of her house since it is in bad condition. In addition, she wants to build a trough for storing water. For these reasons, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wood, cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair the roof of her house and build a water storage trough.

loans.name: Dúo Unidos Lucharemos Group

texts.es:
Dúo Unidos Lucharemos
Dúo formado por Lilian Elizabeth se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la crianza de pollos y gallinas es originaria de san Martin Jilotepeque, agradece a Fape y Kiva el apoyo que le han brindando ya que por medio de eso está cumpliendo sus sueños de ayudar a sus familias y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Solicita el crédito para la compra animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
“Unidos Lucharemos” (We Strive Together) Group

This group includes Lilian Elizabeth, who has been raising chickens and hens for more than three years. She is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. Lilian is grateful to FAPE and Kiva for the support they have provided. This will enable her to fulfill her dreams of helping her family and having a better quality of life.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité San Francisco se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, son de una zona bastante alejada de la zona céntrica, donde todas las integrantes luchan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Viven en una zona que aún está en crecimiento, y donde no tienen un buen acceso a  seguridad y educación.
Elisa, es una de ellas, quien tiene un copetín, donde vende todo tipo de productos a la venta, ella vende golosinas, comestibles, jugos, y demás tipo de productos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que con gran sacrificio está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Elisa pide este préstamo para la compra de golosinas, jugos, bebidas, y demás productos, para que de esa forma siga vendiendo y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Francisco” consists of several neighbors from the city of Santaní who joined together to form a group. They are from an area that is located far away from the central part of town. All of the members strive to improve their living conditions and those of their families. They live in an area that is still growing, but does not have decent access to security and education.

Elisa is one of the members who has a snack bar where she sells all types of products. She offers candies, snack foods, juices, and other types of products. Elisa is a hardworking and determined woman who has made great sacrifices in order to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy snack foods, juices, beverages, and other products. This will enable her to continue selling and striving toward better living conditions. She appreciates getting the opportunity to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, juices, beverages, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes du village de M’pessoba qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Riz, Condiments, Tissus, Fil, Huile, Beignet, Fruits  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quinzième cycle de prêt solidaire. 
Djénébou assise au bout à  droite est une vendeuse de tomates. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des paniers de tomates au fur et à mesure qu’elle  vend à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure de ces tomates au grand marché  de M’pessoba. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 135 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djénébou compte réaliser  155 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women from the village of M’pessoba. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 44 years old, married, and have at least four children. 

This group of women sells miscellaneous items like rice, condiments, fabric, thread, oil, beignets (donut-like pastries), fruits, and more. In order to grow their business, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. This is their 15th group loan. 

Djénébou, who is seated all the way to the right, sells tomatoes. She would like to use her loan to buy baskets of tomatoes gradually as she sells to a diverse clientele both out of her home and at the market. She buys her tomatoes in M’pessoba's main market.

While the other members of the Djiguiya group would like to earn an average monthly profit of 135,000 FCFA each loan cycle, Madame Djénébou would like to earn 155,000 FCFA. 

Beyond the reimbursement of the loan, they will use a part of their revenue to pay for personal expenses and to grow their business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Sendero De Luz Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Sendero de Luz”, meaning “Path of Light”, is starting its second loan cycle. The group is located in San Francisco El Alto in the state of Totonicapán in the highlands of Guatemala. There are 10 women in the Trust Bank, which is run by a Board of Directors. Many of the ladies are involved with textile production and tailoring. Several work with their husbands and the businesses have become family enterprises. 

The requested loans will benefit small micro entrepreneurs like Irma who is the President of the “Sendero de Luz” Trust Bank. She is 35 years of age and has five children who range in age from four to twelve. Along with her husband, Irma is a tailor and the couple makes children’s clothing ranging in size from 2-8. She will use her loan to purchase good quality fabric from wholesalers and transform it into pants, sweatpants, shirts and other apparel. Irma sells her products by the dozen in two nearby markets. She is pleased that she is able to provide good support for her family.

In addition to receiving loans, Irma and the rest of the ladies receive monthly training from a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer on topics like business administration, budgeting and marketing, accounting and customer service. Other subjects presented include health, nutrition and medicinal plants, women’s and children’s rights, and self-esteem. As many of the women have had little or no education, this training is quite valuable and relevant.

On behalf of her fellow Trust Bank members, Irma thanks Kiva investors for their confidence and generosity in providing these much-needed loans. Empowered by the training from Friendship Bridge and the loans from Kiva investors, the 10 women of the “Sendero de Luz” Trust Bank can step more confidently into a brighter tomorrow. They, along with their families and community, will benefit!

loans.use: to buy fabric to make children's clothing

loans.name: David

texts.en: David would like the loan to buy young cattle that he will graze and later sell. He is optimistic that the loan will help him to improve his financial status and adequately meet his family's needs. He is excited about the partnership and he hopes to maintain it by paying well. He is hard working.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe Confiance sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur vingt-unième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme FATOUMATA debout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Confiance, fait la vente des friperies. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 balles de friperies à Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle. Elle effectue ses  ventes en détail sur place et au marché et à Ouayerma I à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The eight members of the "Confiance" group are married. On average, they are 34 years old and have four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma, a working-class neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is the 21st group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso that they’ve used to satisfy the needs of their clients.

Madame Faoutmata, standing second from the left in the Confiance group photo, sells second-hand clothing. With her loan, she would like to buy two bales of second-hand clothes in Sikasso where she is sought after by her clients. She sells for retail and at the Ouayerma market to men and women for cash and credit. 

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA. Part of this will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 52 years old, married and has four children who are in school.  

She is in the poultry business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy chicks and feed for her poultry.

Wilma has been in the poultry business for one year now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Mizpha

texts.en:
Mizpha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, etc.

Mizpha has been in this business for one year now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, so she is taking out a bridge loan to restart her buy and sell of lumber business.

Evangeline has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her business and is using the new loan to stock up on lumber to sell.

Evangeline is committed to rebuilding and in future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende Productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. Vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus dos hijos, el esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Ella busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, azúcar, leches, sopas, etc. lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Our client is 27-years old and has a small corner shop where she sells groceries and other merchandise.  She says the income from the business has improved her family's standard of living.  She lives with her husband and two children.  Her husband works and shoulders part of the household expenses.  Our client wants to increase her income and is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her store with the products--grains, soft drinks, snacks, sugar, dairy, soups, etc.--that she sells.  The investment will allow her to grow the business and build a better life for her family.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Edwin Noe

texts.es: Edwin de 37 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad. El posee una panadería en el cual elabora pan francés, posee mucha clientela por su amabilidad a la hora de vender y los precios muy accesibles. Edwin es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre esta en busca de darle lo mejor a su familia, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, latas, levaduras, manteca, etc. y todo lo necesario para su panadería para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos, el tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edwin, 37, lives with his wife and two children, 13- and 4-years old, respectively.  He owns a bakery where he makes bread.
