He has lots of customers who value his friendly service and fair pricing.  Edwin is a hard-working man always on the lookout for ways to better provide for his family.  That's why he's applying to INTEGRAL for a loan.  He wants to use it to buy bulk supplies of everything he needs--tins, yeast, butter, etc.--to carry on his business.  The business is his sole source of income and he hopes the loan will ultimately deliver a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27  años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de la suegra desde hace 5 años, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos del  hogar. La clienta  solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, esmaltes para uñas, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Our client is 27-years old.  She and her husband have one child and the family has lived with her mother-in-law for 5 years.  Our client has a beauty salon that she set up in a space at her house.  She works from 9:00am to 7:00pm and has a good customer base because she delivers good work.  Her income, combined with her husband's, covers the family's expenses.  Our client is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--creams, shampoos, hairpins, scissors, nail polish, etc.--to carry on her business.  The investment will help her to grow her business and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock her beauty salon.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella posee un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras ubicado en las afueras de su casa, posee mucha clientela porque es un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Carmen está solicitando un crédito para la compra de piñas, papayas, melón, sandias, jocotes, mangos, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen, 57, lives in her own home with her family; she owns a fruit and vegetable business located outside her home. She has a lot of customers as her product sells very well, with what she earns from the sales she manages to cover some of the household costs.

Carmen is seeking a loan to buy pineapples, papayas, melons, watermelons, jocotes, mangoes and so on in bulk to continue with her work as it is her own source of income and therein have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, papayas, melons, watermelons, jocotes, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Prospero Javier

texts.es: Prospero de 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los alrededores de la zona donde reside. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Prospero, 31, and his family live in a house that they own.  He's a farmer and grows maize and beans for a living.  He's worked at farming for several years and it's his means for putting food on the table.  Prospero is a responsible, hard-working man, known in the area for his warm heart and good nature.  His most recent harvest is in now and stored in the silos that are pictured in the photo.  All that's left to do with the last harvest, he says, is sell it and now it's time to think about the next crop.  That's why he's applying for a new INTEGRAL loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.--to carry on his business.  What he wants most, he says, is to bring in a bumper crop, bigger than any he's brought in before because the better the result, the better he can provide for his family.  He trusts God's help and his own hard work will ultimately lead to a better life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, breeze blocks, sand and iron.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose de 41 años de edad desde hace varios años se dedica a la comercialización de jabones y detergentes, lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios,  con loque obtiene de sus ventas ha logrado solventar algunos gatos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo. Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas jabones y detergentes por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y asi el podrá seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jose, 41, has made a living for several years selling soaps and detergents.  He works as a street vendor, peddling his merchandise from place to place and in the markets near his house.  He has lots of customers because he delivers good products at fair prices.  He lives in a house that he owns with his wife and son and says his income from the business covers the family's expenses.  Jose is applying for a loan that he will use to buy bulk supplies of soaps and detergents that he will resell.  The business is his sole source of income and the loan will allow him to carry on the business and better provide for his family.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Haydee Cecilia

texts.es: Haydee de 56 años de edad vive n casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella tiene un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. La cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Haydee, 56, lives in her own home with her husband and son; she has been running a food stall in her place of residence for the last 10 years. Using the profits that she makes from the sales, she is able to cover her household's expenditure. She is a fighter whose dream is to give the best of herself so that her family does not want for the essentials in life to get by. She tells of the satisfaction she has of having a fixed customer base as she is based in a highly frequented area. 

Haydee wants to extend her stall, i.e. to buy tables, seats and other raw goods such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit and vegetables and so on to vary her menu and have a little more money coming in, but she doesn't have enough income to make this investment. As a result, she contacted Integral to seek a loan to buy the items listed above and therein obtain better profits to have improved financial stability.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit and vegetables, and so on.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 46 years old and married, with three children who are in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. Marilou is using this loan for building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Marilou is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 61 años de edad desde hace 20 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita en casa familiar con esposa y su hija.  Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra asi como muestra la fotografia. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 61, has been making his living for the last 20 years working the land. With a lot of dedication he grows corn which enables him to bring him the daily bread to his home. He describes himself as a hardworking, honorable and responsible man. He lives with his wife and daughter in the family home. Together with his wife they work very hard to get their family ahead and give themselves the best living conditions that they had. 

It is thanks to his knowledge in agriculture that Juan is able to provide for the household, given that it is the only manner that he knows of making his living in an honorable way. With a keen desire to succeed, he approached this communal bank to seek a loan as the season for sowing has started and he needs to start sowing as soon as possible. It is for this reason that he is seeking the loan as he needs to invest in the purchase of the agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and so on for sowing, as you can see in the photograph. He trusts in God and in his work with which he will succeed in having an abundant harvest that will allow him to have a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and so on.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 38 years old and has seven children.  She is married, and has three children who are in school.

Adelfa and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Adelfa has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her buying and selling fish.

With your help, Adelfa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. 

In future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family, and to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en:
Yeang is a villager from Kampong Cham province, and a mother of three kids. Currently, only two of them rely on her. 

To feed the family, she is has been growing cassava for ages, and it has returned a decent income to her. 

Yeang, whose past loans have been fully repaid with a positive improvement of her lifestyle, is a third-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, she is a leader of a big group consisting of nine borrowers. The total amount of her entire group loan is 15,400,000 KHR, of which 2,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. 

As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for plowing and labor fees. 

She hopes to expand her business, and that her cassava will produce a good yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Nun's Group

texts.en:
Nun is a married mother blessed with three kids, two of whom are in school. Originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, and she is 38 years old. 

The only source of her income is cassava farming, which she has been involved in for 20 years. She is in her second cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is leading a group of four. 

She has completely repaid her past loan, and it has enabled her to provide sufficient food in her household. 

Now, she and her joint-borrowers are requesting a loan in the total amount of 4,700,000 KHR, of which 1,500,000 KHR is her loan portion. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for land plowing and labor fees, fertilizer, and insecticide for her farmland. 

She wants to expand her farmland in order to grow more cassava than before.

loans.use: To pay for land plowing and labor fees, and to purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer living in the rich banana growing area of Kisii. She is married and has seven children and has been farming for the past 18 years where her primary source of income is milk, tea, bananas, and maize. In farming she loves dairy farming the most because she gets more income out of the milk produced. Her biggest challenge is lack of enough funds for buying farm inputs.

Esther chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give lower interest rates on their loans. During the training, she learnt about how she can be able to improve her farming activities. Through this loan,she will increase her income and therefore be able to improve her farming projects.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. Angela is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Angela requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Angela has been in this business for five years now. With your help Angela will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Angela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 19 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. La clienta vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en casa de un familiar. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios  años, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, peñas, tomates, papas, etc. ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, para darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en: This borrower is 19 years old and is very hard-working. She works at her business with full dedication and the only thing she wants is to get ahead and to offer her family a better life.  The borrower lives with her husband and son at a relative's house. The borrower has had a fruit and vegetable stall at a local market for a number of years. The borrower's husband helps with the business. The borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy papayas, bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, and more. With this loan, the borrower will be able to sell more - which is her priority - so that she can offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy papayas, bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, and more.

loans.name: Jose Elmer

texts.es: José Elmer, se dedica a la actividad comercial de venta de queso y crema de comer por mayor junto a su esposa, sus hijos ya son independientes, el se preocupa por mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, es por eso que solicita de este crédito para levantar parte del muro y cambiar el techo que ya está en malas condiciones, gracias al financiamiento podrá avanzar con esta obra comprando los materiales como cemento arena, hierro laminas de zinc y perlines.
texts.en: José Elmer makes a living selling cheese and cream in bulk. He works with his wife; his children are now independent adults. José wants to improve his living conditions and so is applying for a loan in order to replace his roof, which is currently in bad condition, and build a wall. Thanks to this loan, José will be able to move forward with this work by buying materials such as cement, sand, zinc laminate sheeting and purlins.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, zinc laminate sheeting and purlins.

loans.name: Llapallanchis Purisunchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHIS PURISUNCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio José Antonio es soltero tiene 01 hijo y tiene 31 años de edad, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja durante el dia, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
La socia que sale adjunta en la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, carpintería y negocio de venta de comida.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Llapanchis Purisunchis" communal bank, in the Cusco district of the Cusco province and department.

Member José Antonio is 31 years old. He is single and has one son. This member, as well as carrying out his daily duties at home, works as a taxi driver. He has been doing this work for quite some time and it is going well thanks to his daily efforts. José works during the day, and he wants to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.

José is applying for a loan in order to buy tyres for his car.

In the image, the woman in the small photo was unable to be at the meeting because of her work commitments.

The other members of the communal bank have businesses selling clothes, selling handicrafts, selling groceries, a carpentry workshop, and a business selling meals. 

José is grateful to those helping him to achieve his dream through these loans and promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tyres for her car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to re-invest in her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Hortencia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Hortencia, continúa con su actividad comercial, la venta de tortillas que ella misma realiza en su casa de habitación, sus hijos son independientes, ella lucha al lado de su esposo para salir adelante con sus gastos quien le brinda su apoyo económico a través de su jubilación que recibe mensualmente. Hortencia requiere del crédito para comprar materiales como laminas de zinc y perlines para poder realizar el cambio de techo de su vivienda, el cual no presta las condiciones necesarias de habitar.
texts.en: Hortencia continues to work in her commercial activity, selling tortillas. She makes these herself in her home. Her children are on their own and she and her husband fight to get ahead with the expenses. He helps with the financial support of his pension, which he receives monthly. Hortencia requires the loan to buy materials such as zinc sheeting and beams to be able to change the roof on her house. It doesn't have the conditions necessary for living there.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and beams.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren, 47, is a villager residing in Kampong Cham province and a mother of seven children. To struggle for a living, she grows cassava as a single source of income. It is the business that she has occupied for years, and it has returned her about 22,200 KHR per day. 

This is the second-time loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader. The first loan, which she has repaid, has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,600,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. As a leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees. She hopes to expand her farmland as well as her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 45 years old. He did not have the financial resources to finish school. He is married and his wife helps him on their farm, which helps him with the household expenses. 

Rudy raises pigs for sale, work that he has done since he was very young. His father taught him this work since it earns a better income for the family.  When he finishes his work, he comes home to help his wife with the daily chores.

Rudy is requesting this loan from GDMPC to buy feeds.  In the future, he wants to have a better house than he has now and to be able to give his family a better future. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase feeds

loans.name: David

texts.es: David es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propiedad de sus padres, su casa cuenta con todos los servicios básicos David es carpintero y el manejo de las máquinas podría ocasionarle heridas e incluso dejarlo discapacitado. David es la única fuente de ingresos en su hogar y pide un prestamo para reponer el motor de una maquina circular y comprar madera para su taller
texts.en: David is single. He has no children. He lives in El Alto in a house made of brick and cement. His house has all of the basic services. David is a carpenter and operating the machines occasionally cause injuries and can even leave him incapacitated. David is the only source of income in his home and he is asking for a loan to repair the motor of a circular saw and buy wood for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy a motor for a circular saw and by wood for his workshop.

loans.name: Melbina

texts.en:
Melbina is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melbina has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Melbina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is 28 years old and a married mother blessed with one dependent daughter who remains in school. Her entire family resides in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where her cash crop is grown. Growing cassava has generated almost 28,000 KHR per day for her. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three past loans with successful repayment. The positive impact of this loan has enabled her to provide decent meals for her family. Now, she is teaming up with a group. The total requested amount of the entire group is 3,300,000 KHR. Mao, whose loan portion is 1,600,000 KHR, will spend it wisely on her cash crop to pay for plowing, labor, and reaping fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes to expand her business to a larger scale than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, labor, and reaping fee and to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Rezeil

texts.en:
Rezeil is 38 years old, married and has three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Rezeil has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old mother of four kids and a villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Eng is a local farmer who does cassava and rice farming as the main source of income to support her three dependent kids who remain in school. Apart from this business, she can earn extra income via a paid working job.

For Eng, she has been involved with this current business for five years and it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the three past loans, which she has completely repaid, and this has enabled her to support her kids at school.

Now she is seeking a new loan and she formed a group of three. She and one of her joint borrowers are seeking 2,000,000 KHR each whereas a remaining borrower is seeking 1,400,000 KHR. As a leader, Eng will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and labor fees. She hopes to collect a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim is 49 years old and the mother of six children. She struggles for a living via rice farming on one hectare of farmland and has a paid working job for extra income.

The business that she has had for 30 years has earned her a decent income. This is not the first loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For the past loan, she fully paid back with success and it has promptly supported her business as well as progressing her lifestyle.

Now she is a leader of a group of three borrowers (including her) to get a new loan.  The total amount of her entire group is 3,300,000 KHR, of which 1,300,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she will have enough financial aid for supporting her business on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish like tilapia, lapu-lapu, milk fish, etc., to sell in her fish vending business. Aileen has been in this business for 20 years, and she earns more income from food vending.

Aileen successfully paid back her previous loan and now requested a new loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish like tilapia, lapu-lapu, bangus, etc., to sell

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 44 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, eggs, rice, charcoal, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Diosdada has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, eggs, rice, charcoal, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Dolores is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, charcoal, sugar, eggs, shampoo and groceries to sell for her general store business.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through the past 34 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, charcoal, sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella vive en El ALto. Nelly vive en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propiedad de sus abuelos. Nelly es la única fuente de ingresos en su hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de señoras de pollera (mujeres nativas conocidas como cholas en Bolivia), la pollera es una falda  (parte de la vestimenta típica de la chola boliviana). Nelly necesita crédito para incrementar la compra de polleras que ella vende en El Alto
texts.en: Nelly is single and has one son. She lives in El Alto in a house made of bricks and cement, which belongs to her grandparents. She brings in the only source of income in her household. She makes a living selling women's clothing, namely polleras for native Bolivian women, who are known in Bolivia as cholas. Polleras are skirts which make up part of the traditional Bolivian women's dress. Nelly needs this loan to increase her purchase of polleras, which she sells in El Alto.

loans.use: to buy more polleras (traditional native Bolivian skirts) for her business.

loans.name: Idelfonso

texts.es: Idelfonso es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Idelfonso vive en El Alto en casa propia que es de ladrillo y cemento. Idelfonso se dedica a la venta de fruta. Idelfonso necesita credito para compra de mayor fruta para incrementar sus ganancias. Idelfonso es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda. En la foto Idelfonso aparece junto a su esposa que le ayuda en el negocio de venta de fruta
texts.en:
Idelfonso is married with three children. He lives in El Alto in his own home, which is made of bricks and cement. 

Idelfonso makes a living selling fruit. He needs this loan to buy more fruit to increase his earnings. His work represents the only source of income in his household, so he needs this help. In the photo, Idelfonso is accompanied by his wife, who helps him with his fruit business.

loans.use: to buy fruit for his business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan vive en concubinato desde hace dos años, no tiene hijos y comparte su vivienda con sus abuelos. Juan es de la comunidad de Casamaya, su casa es de adobe pero tiene luz y agua, la construcción es antigua por lo que corre riesgo de desplomarse. Juan se gana la vida como ayudante de albañil y puede sufrir un accidente, por eso, Juan ha decidido dedicarse a la venta de leche por lo que necesita credito para comprar una vaca Juan necesita su ayuda, es la única fuente de ingresos en su hogar. Juan aparece en la foto con su concubina
texts.en:
Juan has lived with his partner for two years. He does not have any children and he shares his home with his grandparents. He is from the community of Casamaya. His house is made of adobe, but it has light and water. The house is old and is at risk of falling down.

Juan makes a living as an assistant bricklayer and could have an accident at work. Therefore, he has decided to start selling milk. He needs this loan to buy a cow. Juan needs this help because he represents the only source of income in his household. Juan is accompanied by his partner in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start his milk business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to be able to nurse and cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres en El Alto, la casa es de ladrillo y cemento y le pertenece a sus padres. Cesar se gana la vida conduciendo un taxi, pero ese negocio tiene mucha competencia y la posibilidad de que sea asaltado es muy alta. Por eso, Cesar necesita credito para comprar máquinas de cocer, puesto que también tiene experiencia en ese campo, por lo que puede mejorar su calidad de vida si ustedes le brindan ayuda. Cesar es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar
texts.en:
Cesar is single and does not have any children. He lives with his parents in El Alto. His house is made of bricks and cement and belongs to his parents. 

Cesar makes a living driving a taxi, but there is a lot of competition in this business and the risk of being attacked is very high. Therefore, Cesar needs a loan to buy sewing machines because he also has experience in this field. He can improve his quality of life if he receives this help. Cesar represents the only source of income in his household.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines to start a clothing business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es casado, tiene un hijo. Daniel vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad. Daniel se dedica al transporte, necesita dinero para reparación de su vehiculo. Aunque la esposa es cocinera, la situación económica de la familia no  es muy holgada, por eso Daniel necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Daniel is married with one son. He lives in La Paz in his own house, which is made of brick and cement. Daniel makes a living in transportation services. He needs money to repair his vehicle. Although his wife is a cook, the family's financial situation is not very comfortable, so Daniel needs your help.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor es divorciado pero tiene 2 hijos Aunque los hijos viven con su madre pues Victor vive solo en La Paz Victor se gana la vida como arquitecto, tiene que viajar muchas veces y levantarse de madrugada para hacer avaluos. Victor necesita credito para compra de papel resma para hacer avaluos. Victor es un padre que apoya a sus hijos y es la única fuente de ingresos para ellos, por eso necesita su ayuda.
texts.en: Victor is divorced and has two children. His children live with their mother, so Victor lives alone in La Paz. He makes a living as an architect. He has to travel often and wake up early to carry out appraisals. Victor needs this loan to buy reams of paper for appraisals. He is a father who supports his children, and he is the only source of income for them. Therefore, he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper for appraisals.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana es soltera pero tiene un hijo. Ella vive con su hijo y su madre. Eliana vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propiedad de su madre. Eliana tiene la profesion de Bioquímica, las desventajas que ella tiene son que debe levantarse muy temprano y puede sufrir asaltos. Eliana necesita dinero para pagar un tratamiento de ovarios  para su madre. Ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita ayuda.
texts.en: Eliana is single but has a son. She lives with her son and her mother. Eliana lives in La Paz, in a brick and cement house that is the property of her mother. Eliana has a Biochemistry profession, the disadvantages that she has are that she must wake up very early and she can be mugged. Eliana needs money to pay for an ovary treatment for her mother. She is the only source of income in her home, therefore she needs help.

loans.use: to pay for a treatment for her mother.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy edible products like vegetables, cereals, and food.

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
Edralyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Edralyn has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from fishing.

Edralyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Edralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Ella es Camila,  una persona muy activa, trabajadora que en el poco tiempo libre trata de hacer algo de deporte como: patinar al lado de la  bella y hermosa hija, es madre de una pequeña menor de edad, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y crecer tanto como persona y a nivel profesional, gracias a que siempre ha estado al nivel o en el  entorno de la belleza y todo lo relacionado con ello. 
Estudió Peluquería hace algunos años, lo ha ejercido desde entonces pero a veces el trabajo y las necesidades la absorben de tal manera que ha tenido que aplazar dos veces los estudios de estética por dificultades de dinero y tiempo, ella es luchadora y perseverante, tiene un espíritu joven y no se rinde cuando de alcanzar las metas se trata, por eso una vez más se lanza a dar el todo por el todo para finalizar la carrera, que en este momento es muy necesario capacitarse, actualizarse y aprender lo que más se pueda para lograrlo. 
Tantas metas que tiene por ella y por la hija a la que le quiere, necesita y merece un presente y un mejor futuro, no queda duda que en el momento que una vieja amiga la lleva a las instalaciones de campo alto que hoy día asiste con un horario un poco flexible y aparte que puede financiar y ser beneficiada por el convenio de kiva, para que el pago sea más económico, es evidente las ganas de salir adelante, con lo propuesto están más notables y la alientan para que siga en marcha con el propósito.
texts.en:
Camila is a very active, hardworking person. In her limited free time, she tries to do something sporty, such as skating with her beautiful young daughter. She is a mother who wishes to succeed and grow on a personal and professional level. She has always worked in the beauty field and related occupations.

She studied hairdressing several years ago and has worked in this field since then. However, sometimes her work and her needs have absorbed her so much that she has had to abandon her beauty school studies twice due to financial difficulties and time issues. She is hardworking and persevering. She has a young spirit and does not give up on her goals. Therefore, she is throwing herself into her studies once again so that she can finish her degree. In this moment, it is very important to earn a degree, to get up to speed, and to learn as much as possible to achieve this.

She has many goals for herself and for her daughter. She loves her daughter, who needs and deserves a better future. An old friend brought her to Campo Alto, where she is now attending classes with a slightly flexible schedule and which she can also finance with a Kiva loan so that the payment is more affordable for her. Her desire to succeed is evident, and she is motivated to continue working towards her goal.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition fees.

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en:
Hoy, 59, is a villager from the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province and the widowed mother of nine children. To cover her family’s expenses, she grows rice as her main source of income and can earn extra income as a factory worker in a spare-time job. 

This business, which Hoy has had for ages, has earned good income. She is in her second cycle with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid the loan from her first cycle with success and good improvement to her household. 

As the leader of a big group, consisting of seven members, she is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 Cambodian riels. She will use her entire loan portion to pay for land-plowing fees and buy rice seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes that her business will improve and that she will able to expand her farmland more than before.

loans.use: To pay for land-plowing fees and rice seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elena works hard to support her family.

Elena has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Elena is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as rice, charcoal, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as rice, charcoal, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a buy and sell fruit business in the Philippines.

Erilinda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell such as bananas, jackfruit, etc.

Erlinda has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell such as bananas, jackfruit, etc

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор 57 лет. Она уроженка района Кубодиён и живет там с мужем, детьми, невестками и внуками. Гулбахор трудолюбивая, отзывчивая и доброжелательная сельская женщина. Она трудится во благо семьи. У нее имеется маленький торговый бизнес. Гулбахор на протяжении 2 лет занимается продажей продуктов питания. Семья помогает и поддерживает ее. Сейчас в ее лавке совсем закончились запасы продуктов. Она нуждается в средствах, чтобы закупить новые продукты. Кредит поможет ей увеличить ассортимент товара и таким образом за счет продажи увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Gulbahor is 57. She is a native of the Qubadiyon region and lives there with her husband, her children, their wives and her grandchildren. Gulbahor is a hardworking, responsible and kind village woman who works for the good of her family. She has a small retail business where for two years she has been selling groceries. Her family helps and supports her. Recently she has completely run out of storage inventory and needs money to buy new products for sale. A loan will help her increase the variety of goods in her shop and, therefore, sales, which will increase the family budget.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale in her shop

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb is 44 years old and married with six children, two of whom are too young for schooling and still depend on her. For the past 11 years, she has struggled to make a living farming oranges and working as a paid laborer. Chreb earns about 39,000 KHR per day. She has borrowed four previous loans and this will be her second joint loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Her previous loans have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle. 

Chreb is the leader of a two-person group loan. She is requesting a 1,200,000 KHR loan and her joint borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. Chreb will use her portion of their loan to buy good orange seedlings, insecticide, and fertilizer for her plantation. She hopes to increase her income so she can improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy orange seedlings, insecticide, and fertilizer for her plantation

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, estudio solamente sexto grado, ya no pudo estudiar más por la situación económica de sus padres,  se dedica a la agricultura, él es acompañado, la esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa, han procreado solamente una hija, ellos viven con la  mamá y la abuela de él; pero solo la esposa y la hija dependen directamente de sus ingresos; tiene quince años de trabajar en un vivero de café de la cooperativa de cafetaleros, pero también de dedica a cultiva maíz y frijol, desde pequeño siempre ha viajado a pie de su casa a su trabajo del cual camina unos diez minutos para llegar.

 El crédito lo necesita para construir una casa y comprar madera y lamina, puesto que está acompañado y quiere tener un hogar propio para su esposa y su hija, sus planes para el futuro en bien de su familia, son que las condiciones mejoren para poder darles una vida digna, piensa en poner un negocio para generar mejores ingresos para la familia, él quiere seguir luchando para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
José, 28, only studied up to the sixth grade. He could not study more due to his parents' financial situation. He makes a living in agriculture. He lives with his wife, who is dedicated to the household duties. They have one daughter. They live with his mother and grandmother, but only his daughter and wife depend directly on his income. 

For fifteen years, he has worked in a coffee greenhouse which belongs to the coffee union. He also grows corn and beans. Since he was young, he has always walked to work. He walks for about ten minutes to reach his work.

He needs this loan to build his house and to buy wood and metal sheets, because he would like to have his own house for his wife and daughter. His plans for his family's well-being in the future are to improve their living conditions and to give them a decent life. He is thinking about starting his own business to earn a higher income for his family. He wants to continue fighting so that they do not lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy wood and metal sheets to construct his home.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 59 years old and married with five children. For the past two years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Rosenda works very hard to provide for her family. 

Rosenda is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional products such as rice, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, and other items

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 41 years old and married with two children. For the past seven years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. With two children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresita is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, and other items. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, sugar, coffee, and other items

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 48 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

Imelda has been in this business for five years.

In the future Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Proeung

texts.en:
Residing in Kandal province where his rice is growing, Proeung is a married father of five children and he is 58 years old. Apart from rice farming, he can earn extra income via his job as a taxi driver. 

Proeung is a fourth-cycled borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has managed his past three loans wisely to upgrade his lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for his crop. He hopes to gain a good yield that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Vali

texts.ru:
Вали позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Вали домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. 

Сам Вали работает мастером по ремонту домов. Этим делом он занимается уже много лет и знает все тонкости этой работы. От своей работы он получает приемлемую заработную плату. Этого дохода хватает Вали на проживание. Но у него есть мечта, Вали хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Вали обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Вали надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Vali is a positive and responsible man of 35. He is married with two children and lives with his family in a small village. But the house they live in is on the small side and not built quite well enough to live in comfortably. Vali's wife is a homemaker and a very hardworking and caring mother.

Vali himself works in home construction. He has been working in this field for many years and knows all the intricacies of this work. He receives an acceptable income from his occupation, enough to cover the costs of living. But he has a dream - Vali wants to build a big house for his family. For this, however, he needs money, since his earnings aren't enough to cover building expenses. Therefore Vali has turned to Arvand to receive a loan to purchase construction materials to build a new home. Vali hopes for a favourable result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María era una niña que vivía en Boyacá con los padres y los hermanos pero debido a que los papas no tenían recursos para que ella estudiara ella se fue a vivir a Bogotá donde la tía Carmen ella le colabora en los quehaceres de la casa y estudiaba en la noche, pero ella se dio cuenta que hay  recibía maltrato físico y otro tipo de maltrato, tomo la decisión de alejarse y buscar un trabajo, se puso a trabajar en casas de familia pero el padre la visitaba en las quincenas y le quitaba lo poco que ganaba haciéndola convencer que era para un ahorro para el beneficio.
Tiempo después ella consiguió un novio y se fue a vivir con él pero de igual seguía trabajando en casas de familia y al poco tiempo quedo en embarazo y se dio cuenta que la persona con la que estaba no le convenía, ya que era desjuiciado, ella le tocaba luchar por el hijo que venía en camino, pero siempre soñó con estudiar y terminar el bachiller, al poco tiempo la relación de pareja cambio y la mentalidad de los dos era de salir adelante,  buscaron la oportunidad de estudiar, se apoyaban mutuamente  para que lo hiciera y se dirigieron al instituto campo alto y se matricularon para terminar el bachiller en horario de la nocturna, ya que trabajaban, luego se informaron de que ahí se podía estudiar auxiliar de enfermería y ella se matriculo con el apoyo del esposo, al ver que no le alcanzaban los gastos el esposo de él se retiró y decidió darle la oportunidad a ella.
Actualmente ella va en segundo semestre, en la tarde trabaja en un salón de belleza y en la noche termina el bachiller y en el poco tiempo que tiene se lo dedica al hogar, al hijo y a las tareas, pero se da cuenta que al esposo que es el que le da apoyo económico le está quedando pesado y ella ve que los sueños se están quedando frustrados, pero ella dice que quiere seguir adelante y hacer todo lo que esté al alcance para lograrlo y poder graduarse y ser poder ayudar a los demás, es por eso que ella se entero de la ayuda económica que le puede brindar kiva y se intereso por poder hacer parte de esta ayuda y no desfallecer en la búsqueda y logro de los sueños.
texts.en:
As a child, María lived in Boyacá with her parents and siblings. Since her parents did not have financial resources for her to study, she went to live in Bogotá with her aunt Carmen, who involved her in the household duties. She studied at night, but she was physically abused and otherwise mistreated, so she decided to leave and look for work. She started working in family homes, but her father visited her every two weeks and took away what little money she made, convincing her that it was for savings.

Some time later, she found a boyfriend and moved in with him. She continued to work in family homes. Shortly afterwards, she got pregnant and realized the man she was with was crazy and not good for her. She fought for her son, but she always dreamed of studying and finishing high school. A short time later, the relationship changed and the mentality of both partners was to move forward. They looked for opportunities to study and supported each other. They came to Campo Alto and signed up to finish high school with night classes, since they were working. Later, they found out that there was an opportunity to study a degree to become a nursing assistant there. María signed up for this degree with her husband's support. Since there was not enough money for both, he decided to withdraw and give her the opportunity to study.

She is currently in her second semester. In the afternoons, she works in a beauty salon, and at night she finishes her school studies. During what little free time she has, she takes care of the household, her son, and the chores. However, she realizes that her husband is the one who gives her financial support and that this is a burden for him. She sees that his dreams are being frustrated, but she says that she wants to move forward and do everything she can to achieve her goal and graduate so that she can be the one who helps others. She then found out about the financial support which Kiva could offer her, and she became interested in receiving this financial help so that she does not falter on her path and so that she can achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition fees.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
Хасан трудолюбивый и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 46 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка.  Вместе со своей семьёй Хасан живёт в небольшой деревне.  Хасан очень любит своего своего сына и делает всё, чтобы он был счастлив и создал свою семью. Сейчас они копят деньги, чтобы вскоре женить своего сына.

Сам Хасан сотрудничает с Аврнад с 2013 года. Он является добросовестным клиентом, который своевременно выплачивает свои обязательства по кредиту. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход в семье Хасан занимается  животноводством. Этим делом он занимается вот уже как 26 лет, начал он свой бизнес с юного возраста. Сейчас сын Хасана изъявил желание поехать на заработки за пределы Таджикистана, чтобы самостоятельно работать и зарабатывать на свою свадьбу. Этим самым он хочет помочь своему отцу приносить в дом доход. Но сейчас у них не хватает денежных средств для покупки билетов на поездку. Поэтому Хасан обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку билета для своего сына. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hasan is a hardworking and responsible man of 46. He is married with one child and lives with his family in a small village. Hasan loves his son very much and does everything he can so he will be happy and be able to start his own family. Right now they're saving money so that his son can get married soon.

Hasan himself has been working with Arvand since 2013. He is a conscientious client who makes his loan payments on time. Hasan works in animal husbandry as a source of income for his family. He started this business at a young age and has been working in it for 26 years. Now Hasan's son has expressed a wish to go abroad to work, in order to earn money for his wedding and help his father by bringing in additional income. But they don't have enough money to buy a ticket for the trip. Therefore Hasan has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy a ticket for his son. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket

loans.name: Nelson Billy

texts.es: El señor Nelson, su negocio le ha permito salir adelante con su familia, su espasa siempre apoyandolo en todo lo necesario, el sueña con darle a sus hijos las mejores condiciones se le dificuta un poco el recaudar de una sola vez el dinero ya que el siempre invierte en su negocio para subir asi sus ganancias. este credito lo esta solicitando para comprar materiales como bloques, cemento, arena, hierro, etc. para poder completar su vivienda. muy agredecido el señor Nelson con Kiva y Afodenic por esta nueva oportunidad que le estan brindando.
texts.en:
Nelson's business has allowed him to provide for his family. His wife always supports him in everything. He dreams of giving his children better living conditions. It has been difficult for him to collect the necessary money all at once, because he is constantly investing in his business to raise his earnings. 

He is applying for a loan to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, iron, etc. to complete his house. Nelson is very grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for this new opportunity which they are offering him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Loun's Group

texts.en:
Loun is 60 years old and a married mother with eight children. She works as a farmer and also catches fish to provide income for her family. She is in her third loan cycle and her partner is in her fourth loan cycle. Loun has repaid her previous loans which have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle in a good progress. 

Loun is the leader of a group loan. She is requesting a 1,400,000 KHR loan and her partner applying for an 800,000 KHR loan. Loun will use her portion of their loan to dig a well so that she can pump water to irrigate her paddy rice. She hopes that her loan will enable her to provide sufficient water for her crop.

loans.use: to dig a well to irrigate her paddy rice

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en:
Thai is a citizen who resides in Siem Reap province and is a mother of four kids. One of her kids is still in school and relying on Thai. To make a living, Thai grows rice on a hectare of farmland. She earns additional income as a policewoman and can earn up to 20,000 KHR per day. She has repaid a previous microloan and this will be her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Thai used her previous loan to gradually uplift her living conditions.

Thai is the leader of a group loan. She and her partner are each requesting a 500,000 KHR loan. Thai will use her portion of their loan to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes her rice will produce a better yield for her.

loans.use: to by fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and catalog products.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 34, is from a rural village located in the Phnom Proek district of Bovel province. She is married with five children, three of whom are in school while another two are too young for school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava. She and her husband have been in this business for 10 years. The current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day.

Kong has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she fully repaid the loan. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more from her crops so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en: Vuthy is 32 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district of Cambodia. He is a rice farmer; he has been in this business for 10 years. To supplement his income, he also catches fish in the village. His current business earns about 30,000 KHR per day; he manages to save about 14,000 KHR each day. This is the fifth loan for Vuthy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to increase his family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Sophat is 38 years old and lives in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province. She is married with two children; one who is school age. 

To support their family, Sophat works for labor wages at a local rice mill while her husband works as a motor taxi driver. These are their primary sources of income. The couple also farm rice on their one-hectare field to make additional income. 

Not having sufficient working capital for their rice farming business, Sophat led a group of three female members to request for their first loan from VisionFund. She used her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers hoping that the crops will have high yields, which will enable her to make more profit to better support her family and the children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kek's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Kek is 35 years old and a married mother blessed with three dependent kids who remain in school. Kek strives for a living via selling bus tickets and grocery items as her main source of income. She has been involved with this business for 17 years, and it has earned her a decent income. 

This is the seventh loan cycle for her and the fifth loan cycle for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans with success, and the positive impact of the past loan has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. 

Now, she and her joint borrower are requesting a loan with the same amount of 1,400,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each. As a leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items for reselling. She hopes to increase her income more than before.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Maany's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province, Maany is a married mother blessed with three children.  She struggles to support her family’s hardship, therefore she operates a junk items trading business on a small scale. She has been involved in the current business for ten years, earning about 41,700 KHR per day. 

Maany and her co-borrower are third cycle borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful repayment of her past loan has enabled her to earn a decent income to cover the daily food consumption in her household. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking for 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to ship more junk items for resale.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to support her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is a 46-year-old mother of seven children living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 10 years, and her husband supplements the family’s income by selling coffee in her village. The current business earns her about 36,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the sixth microloan for Ny with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Ny will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ek Phnom district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Savy is a 43-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. Rice farming and growing cassava are the main sources of the family’s income, which she and her husband have been doing for 10 years. Her husband supplements their income by catching fish for sale. 

This is the seventh microloan for Savy’s group with Kiva’s partner, and they completely paid back the past loans. Savy has successfully used the loans to better support the family. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan, Savy will use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of family income so as to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a local villager residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 45 years old and a mother of five kids. To earn a living, she does rice farming as the main source of income, and she can earn extra income via working at a paid job during her spare time. She has been involved in this business for 20 years with decent income in return. 

She is a repeat borrower who has repaid her past loan completely with a positive impact on her living conditions at a good pace. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a leader of a group consisting of three members. Now, she and her group members are in the same loan cycle with the same requested loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes that her family's conditions of living will improve, as well as her business.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille, a hardworking entrepreneur, has an egg vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 23,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy eggs to sell through her egg vending business.

Leonille has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from farming rice. She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Phalla is 43 years and widowed with two children, one of whom is still in school. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and selling grocery items. She and her mother have been doing this for 10 years to make a living. 
Phalla has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has completely paid back her past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phalla is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Angie Lorena

texts.es:
Mi nombre es Angie Lorena, tiene 18 años nació el 07 de febrero, bueno le gusta mucho la cocina, los padres la impulsaron y cuando se matriculo y fue aprendiendo mas sobre la cocina le pareció una carrera muy interesante. Esta en 2 semestre y no la familia no está muy bien económicamente y ya que campo alto le ofrece este convenio de kiva quiere seguir estudiando para llegar a hacer profesional en lo que le gusta. 
Ha pensado a futuro poder tener el propio negocio como un restaurante y ayudar a los padres.
texts.en:
Angie Lorena, 18, was born on February 7. She likes cooking very much. Her parents motivated her, and when she enrolled in classes and started learning more about cooking, it seemed like a very interesting career for her. 

She is in her second semester and her family is not in a good financial position. Since Campo Alto has this agreement with Kiva, she wants to continue studying to become a professional in a field she likes. She has thought about having her own business in the future, such as a restaurant, and helping her parents.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition fees.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This 600 USD loan is offered to Elsa to improve her business. She is married and she has four children and she has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. With this loan, she will buy some additional supplies such as sugar, salt, coffee, noodles, fish, eggs, bread, Fanta, Coca-Cola and water. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Elsa independent because she can be responsible for herself and her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, coffee, noodles, fish, eggs, bread, Fanta, Coca-Cola and water.

loans.name: Bercy Milena

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de una joven la cual vivía con los padres, con ellos no le faltaba nada pero como todo en la vida las cosas fueron cambiando y en el momento menos esperado los padres se separaron, fue muy difícil al comienzo ya que la madre era quien ahora respondía por ella y los demás hermanos, y por obvias razones no contaba con las mismas comodidades, pero con el paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que debía  seguir luchando por lo que quería, ya que  siempre fue una joven con ideales y muy optimista.

Al pasar los años se graduó de bachiller, un logro muy importante para ella y así fue como comenzó a hacer realidad los sueños, consiguió un trabajo el cual le permitió tener ingresos propios y con el decidió seguir surgiendo y empezó a pagar los estudios en un centro educativo, se enfocó en el área administrativa y aunque tenía un ingreso económico no le permitían costear la totalidad de los estudios, por eso recurrió a la ayuda que le brinda kiva  en convenio con Campo Alto donde estudia, porque  así podía seguir estudiando y llegar a tener la propia empresa y  así lo ha hecho hasta el momento. 
Cursa segundo semestre de administración empresarial en el instituto campo alto el cual le abrió las puertas a una joven llena de sueños, ilusiones y que piensa que para obtener lo que quiere debe luchar y pasar por momentos muy difíciles en la vida, Sin dejar de lado las ganas de estudiar y realizarse como persona.
texts.en:
This is the story of a young girl who lived with her parents. She did not lack anything with them, but things started to change and her parents separated unexpectedly. It was very difficult at the beginning, because her mother was now responsible for her and her siblings. For obvious reasons, they no longer had the same comforts. However, with time, she realized that she had to keep fighting for what she wanted, because she was always an optimistic girl with ideals.

Some years went by, and she graduated from high school. This was a very important achievement for her, and it was then when her dreams began to come true. She found a job which allowed her to earn her own income. She decided to continue developing, and she started to pay for studies at an educational center, focusing on administration. 

Although she had a financial income, this did not allow her to pay her studies in full. Therefore, she came to Kiva through an agreement with CampoAlto, where she studies. She can then continue studying so that she can have her own company one day. She still continues to study. She is in her second semester of a Business Administration degree at CampoAlto, which is opening doors to a young woman who is full of hopes and dreams. She believes that she needs to fight and go through very difficult moments in life to get what she wants, without giving up her desire to study and grow as a person.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition fees.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap is 59 years old and a married mother of 11 children, two of whom are in school. The main source of her income is from farming rice and seling vegetables. She has been involved in her current business for 15 years and it has generated her about 40,000 KHR a day. This is the eighth cycle for Sopheap and sixth cycle for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to improve her livelihood better than before. For this cycle, she is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, while her joint-borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more vegetable to resell. She highly believes that she can restock her business on time so as she can make more income better than before.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable to resell.

loans.name: Vet's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural village located in the Kandal province, Vet is 41 years old and a married father of three children. One of his children still relies on him. To cover his family’s expenses, he grows edible arum (type of plant) as his main source of income. He also earns additional income as a construction worker. The business that he has had for eight years has enabled him to earn almost 38,000 KHR per day. He is a former borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three past loans, which he has fully repaid. The loans have helped him to improve his family’s situation. Now, he is seeking a new loan, and he is the leader of a group consisting of seven members. He and the other group members are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Vet will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seedlings for his crop. He hopes that his business will earn more income so that he can renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seedlings for his crop

loans.name: Moern's Group

texts.en:
Moern is 56 years old, living with four children in a rural village of Kandal Stoeng district. Rice farming, raising pigs and selling grocery items are the only main sources for her family’s income. The current businesses earn her family a daily income of about 60,000 KHR and she is able to save 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is the third loan for Moern with VisionFund and she has completely paid back the past loans. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Moern will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio se dedica al negocio de transporte,el socio realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member works in the transport business, carrying out taxi services in different streets. He works from 8:00 a.m until 10:00 p.m and has already worked in this business for several years. His dream is to have a new car. 

He is asking for the loan to buy tires for his car. He is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
A 46-year-old mother of three children, Vanny has been farming rice to support her family for about ten years. She has one son who is still under her support. Rice farming is the only source of income. 

Not having sufficient working capital, Vanny decided to request another loan; this is her ninth loan with VisionFund. She used the loan to buy fertilizers and will keep the remaining money to pay for necessary expenses. 

She hopes to see her family living in a better condition with sufficient and nutritious food to eat.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is a 46-year-old mother of six children and a villager from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province. 

To feed her family, she grows rice as her main source of income. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years and earns 22,200 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

She is seeking a loan from Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) as the leader of a group of two. This is the sixth-cycle loan for San and the first for her joint borrower. San is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. Her co-borrower is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. 

San will use her portion of the loan to pay plowing fees and buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she will plant the rice on time and gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and buy fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie, 55, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Wilfred, a master cutter, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Elsie maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.
