Elsie dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Residing in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province, Phally is 19 years old and single. To make a living, he has been teaching English for one year. The current job earns him about US $7 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Phally has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, he is applying for a loan to pay for his tuition fee at university to study Information Technology. Phally hopes that the loan will enable him to stay in university to pursue the degree so as to find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee at university.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme JAKILINE assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Danaya, fait la vente des friperies. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son pret  2 balles de friperies au grand marché.Elle vend en détail sur place et au marché au quartier  Ouayerma I à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The seven members of the group named Danaya are married women who on average are 39 years old with five children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma l, one of the popular quarters of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their 17th solidarity loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele.
Mrs. Jakiline is the first person sitting in the photo of the Danaya women looking from left to right and she sells secondhand clothing.
She plans to buy two bales of secondhand clothes at the grand market. She sells the merchandise retail at the grand market and also at the market in the Ouayerma I quarter to her clientele made up of men and women for cash and for credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 32 000 francs CFA, part of which she will use to repay the loan and the interests and she will save the remainder

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Margareth

texts.es: Margareth vive en concubinato desde hace 7años y tiene 3 hijos. Margareth vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios basicos. Margareth se dedica a la artesanía. Una condición dura de trabajo es que ha empezado a sentir dolor en las manos por tejer chalinas o bufandas. Margareth necesita dinero para invertir en grandes cantidades de lana e hilo para hacer chalinas. POr el momento ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda.
texts.en:
Margareth has been married for seven years and has three children.  Margareth lives in La Paz in a house made from brick and cement that has all of the basic utilities.  She works making handicrafts.  One hard part of her work is that her hands have started to hurt from knitting scarves.  

Margareth needs money to invest in large quantities of wool and thread to make scarves.  At the moment, she is the only source of income in her household, so she needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase wool and thread in large quantities for her business making scarves.

loans.name: Reynelin

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Reynelin works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Reynelin is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She has sustained her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Kimsan's Group

texts.en:
Kimsan is a 19-year-old married mother of one dependent son. To endure her family’s hardship, she does rice farming on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income, and she can earn more income via her spare-time job as a paid worker. She has been involved in the current business for one year, and she can earn a decent income to support the family. 

Kimsan has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is the leader of a group consisting of two. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, and her co-borrower is applying loan for 800,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she is planning to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Sey's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old widowed mother of three kids and a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sey is a local farmer who does rice farming as the main source of income. Apart from this business, she can earn extra income via a paid-working job. 

Sey has involved with this current business for thirty years. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the four past loans, which she has repaid completely. The loans have enabled her to uplift her living better. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan, and she formed a group of three. She and her joint borrowers are seeking a loan for the same amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice cropping. 

She hopes her business will improve and that she will collect a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice cropping.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline no tiene hijos y vive en La Paz junto con sus padres. Jackeline sobrevive vendiendo ropa usada y trabajando como ayudante de cocina. Ella necesita crédito para pagar estudios superiores y compra de textos de estudio.
texts.en: Jackeline does not have children and she lives in La Paz together with her parents.  She survives selling used clothing and working as a kitchen assistant.  She needs a loan in order to pay for her education and to buy textbooks for her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies and to purchase textbooks

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more vegetables and fish needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 37,000 PHP, to buy more vegetables and fish needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Brenda dreams of expanding her business more and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  

Rosemarie is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy onions, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, ampalaya (bitter melon) and other vegetables to sell through her vegetable vending business.

Rosemarie has sustained her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy onions, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, ampalaya (bitter melon) and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gaston

texts.es: Gaston es casadp y padre de dos hijos se dedica a la venta de bebidas y cigarrillos. Gastón tambien vende ropa usada. Gaston vive en La Paz en domicilio propio en la ciudad de La Paz. El cliente necesita credito para comprar bebidas y cigarrillos en mayor cantidad para su negocio. Gaston es la unica fuente de ingresos por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Gaston is married and is a father of two children.  He works selling drinks and cigarettes.  Gastón also sells used clothing.  He lives in La Paz in his own home in the city.  He needs a loan in order to buy drinks and cigarettes in larger quantities for his business.  Gastón is the only source of income for his family, which is why he needs assistance.

loans.use: to buy drinks and cigarettes in larger quantities for his business.

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.es:
José de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo  grado de nivel académico, está acompañado la esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar,  en esta relación han procreado 2 hijos de los cuales uno vive con él y está estudiando,   con José vive un hijo, la esposa y un nieto por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de él.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad,  este trabajo se lo enseño el papá ya que desde pequeño les enseño este trabajo para que en un futuro se pudieran defender,  este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 25 minutos y él viaja  a pie.   José solo a esto se dedica y solo él trabaja de la agricultura y el hijo que en ocasiones le ayuda a trabajar como él está estudiando y no quiere que el trabajo le perjudique en los estudios y preparación académica, su  horario de trabajo es  de 6 am a las 11 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra  para limpiar la tierra y preparar los cultivos, esto le ayudara mucho porque pagara a 5 personas que le ayuden a chapodar  el terreno y saldrá más rápido y se ahorra tiempo y sembrara iniciando el invierno y tener las cosechas muy luego. 

Los sueños que tiene es que siempre Dios le de vida,  para seguir trabajando en la tierra,  ya que menciona que como agricultor es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene cuando venden  los cultivos y de eso es que tienen el sustento de la casa y que a la familia no le falte los alimentos.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old and studied through the second grade. He lives with his wife who works in the home.  They have two children, one of whom still lives with them and is a student.  So José cares for one child, his wife, and also a grandchild who lives with them and they all depend on him.  

José is dedicated to agriculture and has been working in this field since he was 15.  His father taught him this work from the time he was young so that in the future he would be able to survive.  This work takes place about 25 minutes walking from where José lives.  José dedicates himself entirely to this work in agriculture, and his son occasionally helps him, but not always since he is a student and they don't want anything to disrupt his education.  His schedule is from 6am to 11pm each day. 

The loan that he is requesting from Credicampo is to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for manual labor in order to prepare the land for planting.  This will help him pay five people who will help prepare the land and it will go faster and he will save time and be able to plant earlier, as winter just begins, and thus have a better harvest.

José's dream is to always have God care for his life, to continue working the land.  His work in agriculture is the only source of income for his household and family, which they only receive when he sells his crops, so he does not want his family to want for food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for manual labor in order to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Loeurt's Group

texts.en:
Loeurt, 38, is blessed with five kids, two of whom are in school. She lives in the Srey Snom District of Siem Reap Province. Her main source of income is from rice farming, which she has done for 15 years. She earns 19,400 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to feed her family. 

Including this cycle, she is a third-cycle borrower with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) and the leader of a group of two. She has used her past loans wisely to upgrade her lifestyle. 

She and her co-borrower are requesting loans of 1,400,000 KHR each. Loeurt will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees. She hopes for a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Dembagnouma sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANOUBOUGOU I  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme AMINATA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Dembagnouma, fait la vente des condiments. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  des quantités importantes de condiments ( tomates, oignons, ails) à Sikasso et effectue ses ventes en détail   au marché et à SANOUBOUGOU I à une clientèle composée de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son Intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Dembagnouma group are married women of an average age of 36 years and with on average, four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Sanoubougou l, one of the popular quarters of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their 11th solidarity loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele.
Mrs. Aminata, who is sitting first on the right in this photo of the women of the Dembagnouma group, sells condiments. With her loan she plans to buy large quantities of condiments (tomatoes, onions, garlic) in Sikasso. She sells her products retail at the market in Sanoubougou to her female customers for cash or for credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 55 000 francs CFA, part of which she will use to repay the loan and the interests, and the remainder of which she will save.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yesenia de 30 años de edad,  es bachiller, está acompañada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura; son padres de tres hijos, uno de ellos asiste a la escuela y los otros dos están pequeños y no asisten a la escuela.

Yesenia por el momento se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos, anteriormente trabajaba como promotora de un programa social llamado Red solidaria; pero hicieron corte de personal en el municipio y así quedo fuera del programa, hoy ha decidido echarle una ayudadita al esposo en la agricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semilla, pesticidas para cultivar y la otra parte para comprar una novilla que ya este apunto de tener la ternera; esto con el objetivo que le de leche para tener los ingresos y queso fresco esto le ayudara mucho, ya que con los ingresos que tendrá le ayudara al esposo con el sostén de la casa.

Los sueños que tiene es que siempre Dios le de vida,  para seguir ayudándole a su esposo y poder encontrar un trabajo que tenga más ingresos y ayudarle a su esposo en el sostén de la casa y así aportar para que sus hijos se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 30 years old and a high school graduate. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They are the parents of three children, one of whom attends school and the other two are young and do not attend school. 

At the moment, Yesenia works as a housekeeper. Previously she worked as a promoter for a social program called Red Solidaria (Solidarity Network), but they laid off employees in the city, and so she is no longer with the program. Now she has decided to lend herself as a helper to her husband in farming. 


The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for planting, and the other part is to buy a heifer that will soon have a calf. This is for the goal of it giving milk so they can make money and have fresh cheese. This will help her a lot because, with the earnings she will have, she will help her husband with household expenses. 


Her dreams are for God to continue giving her life, to continue helping her husband, to be able to find a job with better pay, and to help her husband with household expenses so she can support her children in improving academically.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for planting, and the rest to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling accessories. 

Rowena is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has successfully paid back previous loans and requests this new loan to further build her furniture-making business. She will use this loan to purchase wood, paint, nails and other materials for her business.

Rowena has sustained her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint, nails and other materials

loans.name: Charles Denicherts

texts.es:
Charles es un hombre que estudia Educación Mención Matemáticas, él necesita un préstamo para poder terminar su carrera, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Charles, tengo 38 años de edad, nací en la ciudad de Azua, municipio de  Padre las Casas, al sur de República Dominicana. Resido actualmente en el Seíbo al este de República Dominicana, soy Casado, tengo 5 hijos 2 niños y 3 niñas.  Soy el primero de 4 hermanos; mis padres se  esforzaron  para darme una buena  educación dentro de sus posibilidades,  mi padre es agricultor y  mi madre es enfermera.
Inicie mis estudios en la universidad O&M, una licenciatura en Matemáticas, desde niño me di cuenta que poseo habilidades con los números, pero no puedo costearlos me ha sido difícil pagar las mensualidades; en estos momentos  no puedo seguir pagando mi carrera ya que no poseo recursos suficientes y sin una aprobación de este préstamo sería imposible finalizarlo, en caso de ser aprobado, sería muy significativo para mí ya que  cambiaría mi vida y la de mi familia y  podría darles una mejor calidad de vida a mis hijos.
 Sueño con ser profesor de matemáticas en mi ciudad, para dejar un legado a mis hijos y estudiantes, después me seguiré preparando para seguir mejorando la metodología de enseñanza de las matemáticas en las aulas, que los estudiantes vean las matemáticas como un juego y no como un problema.
texts.en:
Charles is studying Education with a concentration in Mathematics, and he needs a loan in order to be able to complete his degree. 

Here is his story: My name is Charles, and I’m 38 years old. I was born in the city of Azua in the municipality of Padre de las Casas, in the southern part of the Dominican Republic, and currently l live in El Seíbo, which is in the East. I am married and I have 5 children—2 boys and 3 girls. I’m the oldest of 4 brothers, and my parents worked very hard to give me the best education that they were able. My father is a farmer and my mother is a nurse. 

I began my studies at O&M University with a degree in Mathematics—I realize that I have had numerical abilities since I was young—but I am unable to pay for them. It has been difficult for me to make the monthly payments, and at this time I cannot continue paying for my program, as I do not have sufficient resources; and without approval for this loan it will be impossible for me to complete my degree. If it is approved, it would be very important for me, as it would change my life and that of my family, and I would be able to give my children a better quality of life. 

I dream of being a mathematics professor in my city, in order to leave a legacy to my children and to my students. Then, I will continue preparing myself in order to keep improving the methodology for the teaching of mathematics in the classroom, so that students will look at math as a game instead of a problem.

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Samen

texts.en:
Aged 59 years old, Samen is a married mother of four children living in a rural village of the Kam Reing district of Battambang. Rice farming and cassava growing are the main sources of the family’s income, and her husband supplements the income by selling snacks. Having been in these businesses for 15 years, she is able to earn about US $20 per day. 

Samen has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Belinda Maria

texts.es:
Belinda de 33 años de edad se graduó de enfermera, además de ser bachiller en ciencias y letras pero la mayor fuente de ingresos para los miembros de su familia depende del café. Ella tiene una pareja, con la cual aún no se ha casado pero tienen varios años de estar juntos quien se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales naturales y hace cinco meses tuvieron su primer bebe. Actualmente Doña Belinda vive con su madre porque le ayuda con el cuidado de su bebe y su pareja viaja la mayoría del tiempo. Además de trabajar como enfermera auxiliar en una clínica privada de la ciudad el oficio del cultivo de café lo aprendió a temprana edad viendo a sus padres mientras le ayudaba con las tareas en la propiedad donde creció pero hace cuatro años que su padre le heredo una propiedad y desde ese entonces se dedica al cultivo del café. Sus clientes son persona intermediarias que en ocasiones le prestan dinero o abono para asistir sus cultivos a cambio de vender a ellos toda su cosecha. Su finca está alejada de su casa a casi una hora caminando y en tiempo de corta transita mucho carro pero la mayor parte del año tienen que caminar. Cuando llega la temporada de corta sus hermanos le ayudan con esta tarea pero también tiene que pagar mozos.
Belinda tiene dos manzanas de tierra cultivada pero media manzana se vio afectada por la roya y necesita replantar esta parcela además de abonarla así como también la parte sana por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para atender sus cultivos y aprovechar este nuevo año. Por lo momentos Belinda tiene como meta ampliar el terreno para que cuando su hijo crezca poder darle una muy buena educación.
texts.en:
Belinda is 33 years old and graduated with a degree in nursing.  She also has her high school diploma in science and letters, but the main source of income for her family is in coffee production.  She has a partner with whom she is not married but they have been together for several years and her partner works selling medicinal and natural products.   Together they have a five month old child. Currently Belinda lives with her mother because she helps with the baby and her partner travels most of the time.  Besides working as a nurse in a private clinic in the city, Belinda also learned to plant coffee from a very young age by watching her parents.  She used to help them with the work on the property where she grew up. Four years ago her father gave her a plot of land and since that time she has been growing coffee.  Her customers are intermediaries who at times lend money or fertilizers in order to help with her crops in exchange for her selling them all of her crop.  Her land is far from her home, almost an hour away walking, and at certain times there is a great deal of car traffic, but during most of the year they cannot get rides and must walk.  When harvest time comes her brothers help her with the harvest but she also has to pay other laborers.  

Belinda has two blocks of cultivated land but half a block has been affected by disease and needs to be replanted. She also has to re-fertilize that section and also the healthy sections.  For that reason she is asking for a loan in order to buy agricultural products in order to attend to her crops and take advantage of this new season.  Belinda has as a goal at this moment increasing her land so that when he son grows up she will be able to provide him with a good education.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products in order to replant and fertilize her coffee crop.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est née en juin 1972, mariée et mère 5 enfants,  elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Madame Fatoumata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initiée depuis plus de 10 ans aux activités d’achat et de vente d’habillements (des pagnes Wax, des Tissus brodés, légers, etc) et de chaussures. Elle achete ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) et mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq  ans et avec laquelle elle a bénéficié de plusieurs prêts solidaires dans une association des femmes de son quartier. Elle est actuellement  à son douzième prêt individuel, ses prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 5 pièces de pagnes Wax, 10 complets de tissus brodés et 15 paires de chaussures différentes. Ses marchandises sont vendues en détail de façon ambulante au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata was born in June 1972 and is married with five children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large, extended, traditional family in Bougoula Ville, the centre of Sikasso in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali.
Mrs. Fatoumata worked in many business ventures without success, then ten years ago she started a commerce of clothing (wax traditional dress, embroidered fabrics and light textiles, etc.) and shoes. She buys her merchandise in Bobo Dioulasso (republic of Burkina Faso) and does business from home and as an itinerant saleswoman in Sikasso where she is much in demand because of the high quality of her merchandise. To satisfy her growing clientele, five years ago she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with which she has enjoyed several solidarity loans within a group of women from her neighbourhood. This is her 12th individual loan, all her previous loans have been repaid.
With this loan she plans to buy five wax pagnes, 10 embroidered suits and 15 pairs of different shoes. She sells her merchandise retail, as an itinerant saleswoman for cash and for credit to an essentially female clientele.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 55 000 FCFA which she will use to contribute to the family expenses, to pay the interests of her loan, and to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various articles.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adán tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad de clima variado, que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al alquiler de su equipo de sonido para eventos tales como quinceañeros, matrimonios, fiestas infantiles y otras actividades, además trabaja como locutor en una radio de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para mantenimiento de sus equipos de esta forma poder brindar menor servicio a su clientela y así poder tener mejores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adán is 39 years old and lives together with is wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a community with a varied climate. The region is dedicated to agriculture, sales, and livestock.  It is located in the Province of Chiclayo which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.

Adán works renting sound equipment for events such as quinciañeras (15th birthday parties), weddings, children's birthday parties, and other activities.  He also works as a radio announcer in his district.  He is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) in order to maintain his equipment and in this way to bring better service to his clients and thus be able to improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his sound equipment and in this way to bring better service to his clients.

loans.name: Margielina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Margielina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell native products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling cashew nuts. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.
Margielina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of native products to sell.

Margielina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of native products to sell.

loans.name: Chhuon's Group

texts.en:
Chhuon is 37 years old and a married mother of four kids. She is a resident of Bovel district of Battambang province, where her cash crop is grown. Her four hectares of rice crop and her paid-working job are the main sources of income. She has done these jobs for ten years. 

This is the seventh-cycle loan for Chhuon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan wisely, and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle with good progress. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan with a total amount of 4,000,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. 

Chhuon , the representative of her entire group, will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the land preparation fee. She hopes to prepare her farmland on time so she can start replanting her crop.

loans.use: to pay for the land preparation fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy toothpaste and vegetable based brushes.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
Ma. Teresita previously accessed a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products for her business. Her earnings were a big help to her children’s education and to the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Ma. Teresita would like to apply for another loan of 7,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. 

Ma. Teresita looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She dreams that her business will flourish and hopes to give her children a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sangke district, Samnang is 37 years old and married. She has five children, one child still in school. 

To make a living, she has been buying and selling rice in her village. To supplement the family's income, her husband works for others for a fee. Having been in the rice-selling business for almost 11 years, Samnang can earn about 44,000 Cambodian riels per day. 

She is now leading her group of two to apply for a loan with Vision Fund. This is Samnang’s ninth loan with Vision Fund. Her past loans have helped her better support her family. 
 
She will use her portion of the loan to buy more rice to sell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income and make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 41 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for three years and also earns income from fishing and charcoal retailing.

Juditha has requested a loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has previously borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF. 

She will use this loan to buy soap, canned goods, eggs, spices and other items to sell. She aspires to building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, canned goods, eggs, spices and other items to sell

loans.name: Candy

texts.es: Candy, de 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Candy es la venta de productos comestibles, para eso cuenta con un puesto instalado en el frontis de su vivienda, ahí atiende de manera amable y muy cordial a cada uno de los clientes que llegan a su establecimiento. Trabaja sola y realiza esta labor desde hace 6 meses. Considera rentable a su negocio pues le ha permitido salir de muchos apuros económicos, así como poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. Complementa su labor con la venta de repuestos vehiculares.  Le gusta su actividad porque le permite estar en su casa y cuidar a sus hijos pequeños. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando algunas veces no consigue vender todos sus productos en el tiempo establecido, tiene planes de continuar y hacer crecer su negocio buscando incrementar sus ventas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 800, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado comprará plátanos, arroz, huevos, aceites y azúcar que son los principales productos que vende diariamente.
texts.en:
Candy, age 30, is married with 3 children. She lives with her whole family in her own home. Candy sells groceries from a small store that she has in front of her home, where she provides friendly and courteous service to every customer that comes to her establishment.

She works alone, and she has been doing this work for six months. She considers her business to be profitable, as it has allowed her to meet many financial challenges, such as how to help her husband with the household expenses. She supplements her work by selling replacement parts for vehicles. She likes her occupation because it allows her to be at home and care for her small children. On the other hand, she does not like that sometimes she is not able to sell all of her products within the established time frame.

She plans to continue, and to grow her business, looking to increase her sales. On this occasion she is seeking a loan of 800 Nuevos Soles, and she is very thankful for the opportunity that she has been given, and for the financial backing that she needs to move forward. With the requested amount she will purchase plantains, rice, eggs, oil, and sugar, as these are the principal products that she sells every day.

loans.use: to purchase edible goods such as plantains, rice, eggs, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-vending  business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell for her rice-vending business.

Meriam has been in this business for 35 years. Meriam earns more income from a buy and sell rice barn.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets for her fishing business.

She has been in this business for three years. Rosario earns more income from pig fattening.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Seyha's Group

texts.en: Seyha is a villager from the Bovel district of the Battambang province.  She strives for a living via rice cropping and pig-raising businesses. This is the sixth-cycled loan for Seyha and third cycle for her joint borrowers in the same group of three with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans wisely and now her living conditions are getting better than before.  For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more pigs for raising and pig’s feed. She highly believes that she can raise her pigs healthily so as she can gain more income to keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for raising and pig’s feed

loans.name: Sovoan's Group

texts.en: A young mother of two children who are in school, Sovoan lives with her family in the Sangke district's Battambang province. Sovoan and her husband support the family by contracting small construction works in the village. They have been in this business for about eight years. To do the work faster, Sovoan applied for a loan from VisionFund to buy more construction tools like rock drills, concrete saws, and blades. She hopes to make more money so as to keep both of her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Oeam's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province, Oeam is 48 years old and a mother of five children. Currently, three of them are under her responsibility and they are in school. She feeds her family via rice farming on three hectares of farmland and her other job. Having been in current business for 19 years, she is able to earn up to 39,400 KHR per day. This is the sixth-cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a group leader.  She has fully paid back her past loans with success, which have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. Now, she and her joint-borrower are requesting a loan for the same amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay the plowing fees for her crop. She hopes that she will gain a good yield as well as make her income better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay plowing fees for her crop

loans.name: Vit's Group

texts.en:
Vit, 34, lives with his wife and three children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Vit and his wife earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having in this business for 11 years, he is able to earn about 37,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Vit has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. As the leader, he is leading his group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Vit is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his family’s business and he hopes to increase his crop yields so as to generate more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his family’s business

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 22 and mother of one child, is a rural villager from Battambang province. For her family, rice farming is the main source for her to earn income which she has done for around five years. 

Now, she is a group leader of two. She and her co-borrower have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three past loans. Sokhorn has fully repaid the past loans which have upgraded the living conditions of her family at a gradual pace. 

Now, they are seeking for the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay  plowing fees for her cropping. She hopes to collect good yield, better than before, and to earn increase income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees for her cropping

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and also helped in her personal household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Analyn dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have better living conditions. She meets up weekly with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Magdalena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Magdalena is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fish net for her fishing business.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fish net for her business

loans.name: Celma

texts.en:
Celma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell in her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Celma has been in this business for 10 years. Celma earns more income from buy-and-sell bamboo split.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is a rural villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 45 years old and a mother of one kid. To feed the family, she grows rice and pineapple as the main source of income and she works as a paid worker for additionally of income. 

Sok has engaged in this business for 18 years and it has returned her 27,700 KHR per day. This is not the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Now, her living condition is getting better than before and she has managed to repay back her past loan completely. For this cycle, she leads a group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her pineapple farm. She hopes to gain a triple yield, better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her pineapple farm

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is 57 years old and a married mother of four kids. Nowadays, only two of whom are under her responsibility and they are too young for schooling. She lives in a rural villager in Battambang province. 

To feed her entire household, rice farming and pineapple planting are the primary source of income, and paid-working job is the secondary one. Ny has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, but her joint borrower was. 

Ny is applying for 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is seeking 1,200,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her pineapple’s field. She hopes to gain an increased yield than last years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her pineapple field.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Sangke district's Battambang province, Phea lives in a wooden house with her family. She is married and 42 years old. To survive with the family, Phea and her husband have been farming rice for over ten years. This is their primary business. They also raise cows. 

To grow good quality of rice, Phea requested a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizers, rice seeds, pesticides, and gasoline for the water pump. She hopes to make more profit out of this business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seeds, pesticides, and gasoline.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en: Phon is a local villager from Battambang province and she is 51 years old. To support her family’s needs, she is growing rice as the main source of income. She also can earn additional income via her small grocery shop and her paid working job. The business that she has had for 25 years has returned her 21,600 KHR per day. Including this cycle, she is in her fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the leader. Now, her living condition is getting better than before, resulting from the positive impact of the past loans which she has repaid completely. Now, she and her co-borrower are requesting the same amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer and to pay for the smoothed land fee. She hopes that her business will improve.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and to pay the smoothed land fee.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret is 43 years of age and married. She has four children, only two of whom are dependent on the family and are now still in school. Living in a village of the Moung Russey district, Saret has been growing rice, and her husband is working as a teacher to earn additional income. Having been in this business for several years, she manages to earn about 67,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children.
 
This is the fifth loan for Saret with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past four loans, which have enabled her family with enough food. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Vet's Group

texts.en:
Vet, 46, is married and has six children, two of whom are still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been running her business for 15 years, earning about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Vet received her first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund a cycle ago. She effectively used it to sustain her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province, Sy is a 57-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are in school. The main sources of her family income are from rice and maize farming, with which she has engaged for 18 years. 

Now, she is a team leader of two to get a new loan. She is in her third-cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment of her past loans, that has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. 

Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying loan for 300,000 KHR. As a leader, she will use her loan portion to buy corn seeds and pay for plowing fee. She hopes to gain better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is a young mother, age 30, and lives with her family in Kampong Cham province. The family earns income by rice farming. They have been in this business for about ten years, and this is their primary source of income. 

In free time, Kunthea works for others for labor wage to make additional income to feed her children and support their schooling expenses. The current house is old, hence, Kunthea decided to request a loan from VisionFund to build a new decent house for her small family.

loans.use: to build a new house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: An older, widowed mother of four, Pich supports the family by farming rice. She is 59 years old and still has one daughter she supports. Having insufficient working capital, Pich decided to apply for a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. She hopes that the crops will grow well and bring a higher price when she is ready to sell them.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Ang, 43, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district. She has three daughters to take care of and now they are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working as a paid worker for 15 years and the current business earns her family about 15,000 KHR per day. 

There are three members in Ang’s group and she is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Ang, who is the leader, is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Phoeurn is 41 years old and a married mother blessed with three children. She struggles for a living via rice farming and pig raising. Her supplementary source of income is a fish-catching business.  

She has been involved in her current business for 15 years, earning about 41,300 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Phoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan fully and it has enabled her to provide sufficient food for her family. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy pig feed. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before, so as she can expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
This is Precilla, 37, resident of Batasan, Quezon city, Philippines. She is married to Joselito, and a they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Precilla operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan with her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Precilla dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net, gasoline, and bamboo for her fishing business.

Josephine has been in this business for three years. Josephine earns more income from pig fattening.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, gasoline, and bamboo for her fishing business.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lenie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Lenie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional gallon of gasoline for her fishing business.

Lenie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Esther works hard to support her family.

Esther has a buy and sell rice bran business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling both rice grains and rice. Esther is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice bran to sell.

Esther successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice bran to sell

loans.name: Jhesica

texts.es: Jhesica no tiene hijos y se dedica a la venta al por menor de productos farmaceuticos y medicinales. Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo junto a su madre. Jhesica necesita credito para abastecerse de mercaderia (medicinas) si bien su madre tambien contribuye a la economia familiar, lo que gana no alcanza para apoyarla, por eso, Jhesica necesita ayuda
texts.en: Jhesica has no children and works in retail sales of pharmaceutical and medicinal products. She lives in La Paz in a brick house with her mother. Jhesica needs a loan to stock up on merchandise (medicines). Although her mother also contributes to the family economy, what she earns is not enough to support her, so Jhesica needs help.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her pharmaceutical products business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie, 35, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Mardy, a driver and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rosalie operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell the materials to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her currently revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors.
 
Rosalie hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God she studies.* 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Fellowship groups are composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Miguela has been in this business for 25 years. Miguela earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Miguela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 36 years old and has three children. Rowena is married and three of her children are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Sokhorm

texts.en:
Aged 62 years old, Sokhorm is a married mother of seven children living in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district, Cambodia. 

To support her family, Sokhorm has been farming rice and selling grocery items for 42 years in the village. The current business earns her about US $13 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sokhorm has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She has successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her family and business. Now requesting a new loan, she will use her portion to buy a decent motorbike for her commuting in her family. She hopes to have a decent motorbike so as to reduce some expenses on motor-taxis.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her commuting in her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 56 years old and married with eight children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Yolanda has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, 35, is a resident from Battambang province and a father of three dependent children. He has been a farmer growing rice and corn as his main source of income for more than ten years. This current business has returned him about 37,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first-cycle loan for Thy and third loan for his joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); they are each seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to pay the plowing fee and to buy corn seeds. He strongly hopes that he will gain a good yield.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee and to buy corn seeds

loans.name: Sokhey

texts.en:
A widowed mother of six, Sokhey lives with her children in a wooden house in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming is the family's primary source of income. During spare time, Sokhey works for others for a wage. She has been farming rice for thirty years. 

Sokhey used her savings to buy necessary home appliances and a horse to help with her farming business. Sokhey hopes to buy another plot of land for farming in order to make more income. Therefore, she applied for a third loan from VisionFund of KHR 2,000,000.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Inocensia

texts.en:
Inocensia is 67 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like biscuits, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Inocensia has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like biscuits, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: Kim, 26, is a citizen from Battambang province and a mother of two dependent kids. For the sake of her family’s living, rice and cassava farming are the main source of her income. She has engaged in this business for seven years, and it has generated about 31,400 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a third-cycled borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of a group consisting of two borrowers. She and her group member are requesting loans of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to increase her income as well as to gain better yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en:
Sarorn is a villager of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 28 years old and a married mother of two kids. To make a living for her family, she does rice farming as the main source of income and she works as a paid worker in order to earn more income. She has been involved with this business for ten years and she can earn a profit of about 33,600 KHR per day. 

In a group of two, Sarorn and her joint borrower are in a second-cycled loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Resulting from the past loans, which she has fully repaid, her lifestyle is getting better than before. Now, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR and her group member is seeking loan of 100,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticides, fertilizer and to pay a land plowing fee.  She strongly believes that she can gain a triple yield over last years.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer and to pay a land plowing fee

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: A widowed mother of two, Sina, lives with her two kids in a wooden house located in Tbaung Khmum distict's Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Sina supports her children by farming rice. To save money for one of her kids to continue university studies, Sina is now short of funds to build new stairs for her home. After learning about VisionFund, Sina decided to request a loan of US $1,000 to build new stairs.

loans.use: to build stairs for her home

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 40 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 10 años y vive junto a ellos y otros miembros de su familia en su casa propia. Rosa se dedica a la venta de bebidas energizantes y gaseosas. Tiene una refrigeradora y una congeladora que surte a diario desde muy temprano para que se encuentre en su punto ideal de congelación al momento que empiezan a llegar sus clientes. Realiza la venta directa a personas mayores de edad. Trabaja en esta actividad generalmente por las tardes, durante las mañanas recibe el apoyo de su cuñada o su hijo en la atención mientras ella trabaja brindando servicio de lavandería en un conocido hospedaje de la ciudad. Lleva en esta actividad más de 10 años y la rentabilidad que le brinda le ha servido para obtener algunas cosas materiales que siempre anheló además de que le ha permitido hasta ahora solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar colaborando de esta forma con su cónyuge. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste financiamiento, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará más gaseosas y bebidas energizantes para continuar con sus ventas. Y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40, is married and has a ten-year-old son. She lives with her husband, son and other family members in her own house.

Rosa makes a living selling energy drinks and soft drinks. She has a refrigerator and a freezer which she stocks daily from the early morning so that the drinks will be at their ideal temperature when her clients start to arrive. She sells directly to her clients, who are adults. She usually works in the afternoons. In the mornings, she has the support of her sister-in-law or her son who serve clients while she works for the laundry service of a well-known guesthouse in the city. She has had this business for more than ten years, and her profits have allowed her to obtain some material things which she always desired. She has also been able to cover her household's basic expenses in collaboration with her husband. 

She has applied for a loan of 3,800 Peruvian nuevo soles. She is grateful for this opportunity and the trust which has been placed in her by receiving this financing. On the other hand, she promises to pay her installments on time. With the requested amount, she will buy more soft drinks and energy drinks to continue with her sales and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy wholesale drinks.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is 33 years old and is married with two children. To make a living, she has been working as a paid worker and catching fish. Having been in this business for 13 years, she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Sophorn has been with VisionFund for four cycles and successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a sugarcane crusher in order to squeeze sugar cane juice for selling in her village. She hopes to earn more income to support her family members.

loans.use: to buy a sugarcane crusher in order to squeeze sugar cane juice to sell in her village.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a 32,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elsa dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that they study.*

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner previously acquired an 30,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle, and also to buy some equipment in his repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Abner dreams that his business will grow bigger and hopes to make a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar).

loans.name: Pan's Group

texts.en:
Pan is a rural villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province and a married mother of three kids, two of whom are in school and one who is too young for schooling. 

Her only source of income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for 12 years. 

The lack of financial aid to continue in supporting her business is her main challenge. To overcome this problem, she is seeking a first-time loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader. She is requesting 300,000 KHR and her joint-borrower is seeking 500,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy insecticide and fertilizer, and also to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she will gain better yields than before and to increase her income as well.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and fertilizer, and also to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erminda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Erminda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and bamboo for her fishing business.

Erminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and bamboo for her fishing business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Nanchoc, una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de San Miguel, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y animales menores, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, también brinda servicio de albañilería, son una familia emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Edwin, age 47, lives with his wife and children in the Nanchoc district.  He lives in a peaceful community.  The population there devotes itself to farming, commerce, and livestock.  It is in the San Miguel province in the Cajamarca Región on the northern highlands of Peru.

He and his wife raise pigs and small animals in the area behind his house.  He also provides bricklaying services.  They are an enterprising family.

He has requested a loan for 3,500 soles to buy small animals, which he will later sell for a larger price.

loans.use: to buy small animals, which he will later sell for a larger price.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: Chea is 44 years old and is a married mother blessed with seven kids. She can make a living via cassava farming, and her husband's occupation is as a soldier. She has been occupied in this business for ages. Chea is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She can improve her living condition in a gradual pace, especially with three decent meals. This is the result of the past loan which she has fully repaid back. For this cycle, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to purchase seedlings for farming and to pay the plowing fee. She highly believes that she can gain a better income than before.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings for farming and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Dania Imelda

texts.es:
Dania de 30 años de edad se graduó de bachiller en ciencias y letras en un colegio de La Libertad. Después ella se fue para Villanueva debido que tuvo la oportunidad de un trabajo en una maquila en donde estuvo laborando 13 años. Con el tiempo ella conoció a su hoy en día esposo con quien no tuvo buena suerte ya que hace 6 años se murió por problemas de salud quedando ella con 2 meses de embarazo de su hija Nelsy quien ahora tiene 5 años de edad y está en primer grado de la escuela de su comunidad. Desde hace 3 años vive con sus padres y ahora se dedica a la agricultura junto a ellos ya que además es maestra voluntaria del kínder de su comunidad. Estando en Villanueva ella estudio un curso de belleza y ahora es estilista y hace cualquier tipo de peinado ganados la vida también de esta forma. El terreno que ella cultiva lo adquirió por medio de su padre quien le dio una parte y otra la cambio por un vehículo con el de la cual una parte esta cultivada de café y media manzana la está sembrando involucrándose su padre y su hermano menor quienes se van desde la maña a trabajar y ella se queda y les lleva desayuno y almuerzo. Una vez recolectado el grano ella le vende a una persona de su comunidad quien compra, procesa y a su vez revende el producto a bodegas que se dedican exclusivamente a la compra-venta de café ubicadas en la ciudad.
Ella solicita financiamiento el cual invertirá en abonar y foliar sus cultivos de café para hacer de ella más productora y pagar mano de obra para darle un buen mantenimiento a la misma teniendo como resultado una mejor producción en esta nueva temporada. Sus metas tener su propia casa en su comunidad, establecerse bien y poder llevar a cabo un pequeño proyecto que tiene en mente como la cría de pollos, cultivo de peces, un huerto familiar.
texts.en:
30-year old Dania graduated from a college in La Libertad with an arts and sciences diploma. Afterwards she went to Villanueva as she had an opportunity to work on an assembly line. She worked there for thirteen years. Later she met her future husband but unfortunately he died six years ago from health problems. At the time she was two months pregnant with her daughter Nelsy who is now 5 years old and attending first grade at a local school.
