Alpha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetable to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

She has been in this business for eight years. Alpha earns more income from raising pigs and a general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Alpha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Istamoy

texts.ru:
Истамой профессиональный семейный врач, проживающий в городе Кайракум. Ей 50, она разведена. У Истамой одна дочь в возрасте 20 лет. Она студентка и учится в университете прилежно. Истамой в течение 20 лет работает в клинике и лечит больных, как взрослых так и детей с различными по характеру заболеваниями. У нее очень большой опыт. Истамой обладает высоким профессионализмом, но при этом она знает границы своих возможностей и в нужный момент предлагает пациентам обратиться к другим специалистам.
Сейчас Истамой хочет купить оборудование в свою клинику. Но у нее нет большой суммы на руках и поэтому она решила получить кредит. Истамой собирается приобрести терапевтический аппарат, который ей очень необходим. Она надеется, что с вашей поддержки она сможет купить этот аппарат для диагностики и лечения своих больных, ведь мир не без добрых людей.
texts.en:
Istamoy is a professional family doctor who lives in the city of Kayrakum. She is 50 years old and divorced. Istamoy has one daughter who is 20 years old. She is a student and studies diligently at university. For the past 20 years, Istamoy has worked in a clinic and treats both adults and children with varying types of illnesses. She has a lot of experience in this field. Istamoy possesses the highest level of professionalism; that being said, she knows the limits of her abilities and suggests that her patients go to other specialists when needed.

Now Istamoy wants to buy equipment for her clinic. However, she does not have a lot of money on hand which is why she decided to take out a loan. Istamoy is planning to buy a therapeutic apparatus which she really needs. She hopes that, with your support, she will be able to buy this apparatus for diagnosing and treating her ill patients. Indeed, the world is not without good people.

loans.use: to buy a therapeutic apparatus.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marialyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish-vending.  Marialyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Shen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman who has been blessed with five children, two of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mbeyu operates a business selling charcoal. She sells from her home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. Mbeyu joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Srey Snom district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Sin is aged 31 years and married.  She has two children, one of whom is in school two while another one is too young for school. She has struggled to feed her children by farming rice. Having been in the business for 10 years, she currently earns approximately 13,000 KHR per day from  the current business. 

Sin has never been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, before. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets for raising in order to earn more income from her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy piglets for raising

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Irene works hard to support her family. She has a rice-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Irene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice-vending business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan David:
Juan David tiene 24 años y nació en Medellín, Antioquia, población ubicada en el nororiente de Colombia. Es hijo único y vive con su madre, quien es profesora del Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje (SENA). Gracias a su excelencia académica y a los logros que tuvo, Juan David estuvo becado durante todo el tiempo que estudio su carrera, logrando el título de Ingeniero de Sonido de la Universidad de San Buenaventura en febrero de 2013. 
Juan David tiene el sueño de realizar una Maestría en Acústica en una de las mejores universidades de Francia, la Universidad de Maine. Para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de certificación de francés. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Juan David anhela trabajar como docente e investigador, para poder compartir su conocimiento  para apoyar el desarrollo de esta área del conocimiento en el país, además de impulsar proyectos que tengan en cuenta el problema de la contaminación acústica en las ciudades y buscar soluciones para mejor el entorno de la población.
Aquí está su historia: 
En el año 2004, mientras estaba en clase de historia en el colegio, llegamos a la antigua Grecia y a sus magníficos teatros, teatros que podrían albergar desde 5000 hasta 18000 personas al mismo tiempo, en una época en la que no existía nada que pudiera amplificar la voz, lo que me llevo a preguntar ¿cómo hacían esas 5000 personas para escuchar la obra?, una pregunta que nadie en el colegio supo responderme, pero que no dejaba de darme vueltas en la cabeza hasta que alguien me dijo que ese era uno de los misterios de la acústica.
Desde entonces, me ha fascinado la acústica y decidí que quería comprender todos los fenómenos acústicos para revelar sus misterios; realice mi pregrado en ingeniería de sonido convirtiéndome en uno de los primeros profesionales en este campo de mi ciudad y de los pocos del país, a lo largo de este pregrado descubrí que los alcances de la acústica van desde algo tan complejo como la medicina con los eco-gramas, hasta la inteligibilidad de la palabra en una simple conversación, sin embargo ya que en Colombia la acústica es un campo que apenas se está empezando a estudiar, no existe ningún postgrado enfocado en este tema en el país y aunque ya una investigación revelo el misterio de los teatros griegos, mi meta ahora es poder realizar una maestría en acústica en una de las mejores universidades de Francia y traer ese conocimiento a mi país para compartirlo con todos aquellos que alguna vez se preguntaron lo mismo que yo y para apoyar el desarrollo de esta área del conocimiento en mi país.
A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mi madre no puede llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica. Actualmente,  estoy trabajando de manera independiente, llevando a cabo proyectos de consultoría en el área de sonido, sin embargo este trabajo es inestable y mis ingresos no alcanzan a cubrir los gastos que conlleva cumplir con los requisitos para hacer un proceso de admisión exitoso en la Universidad de Maine y así cumplir mi sueño. Kiva sería el apoyo que necesito para superar los primeros pasos de este largo camino y el impulso para poder realizar esta maestría en el exterior, dado que gracias a Kiva podría realizar los estudios que necesito para certificar mi segundo idioma y aplicar a la universidad.
Estoy seguro que gracias a mi excelencia académica y un gran esfuerzo puedo lograr cumplir las metas que me he trazado para ser mejor persona y poder contribuir a mejor la calidad de vida, no solo de las personas de mi ciudad, sino de todos los colombianos.
texts.en:
Juan David:

Juan David is 24 years old, and he was born in Medellín, Antioquia, which is located in Northeastern Colombia. He is an only child and he lives with his mother who is a professor with the National Learning Service (SENA). Thanks to his academic excellence and his accomplishments, Juan David was awarded a scholarship for his entire undergraduate program, earning a degree in Sound Engineering from the University of San Buenaventura in February of 2013.

Juan David’s dream is to earn a Masters of Acoustics degree at one of the best universities in France, The University of Maine. In order to accomplish this he needs to seek Kiva’s support, as it is the only way that he will be able to cover the costs of French certification. Once he earns his Master’s degree and returns to Colombia, Juan David looks forward to working as a professor and researcher, in order to share his expertise and support the development of this area of knowledge in the country, in addition to implementing projects that take into account the problems of noise pollution in the cities, and seek solutions in order to improve the environment for the population.

Here is his story:

In the year 2004, when in my high school History class we came to Ancient Greece and its magnificent theaters, that could hold from five to eight thousand people in an age in which nothing existed for amplifying the voice, I asked: How were some five thousand people able to hear the performance?  This was a question that no one in the high school was able to answer for me, but I did not stop going over and over it in my mind until someone told me that this was one of the mysteries of acoustics. 

Since then, I have been fascinated by Acoustics, and I decided that I wanted to understand all acoustic phenomena, in order to reveal its mysteries. I completed my undergraduate work in Sound Engineering, becoming one of the first professionals in this field in my city, and one of few in the country.

As an undergraduate I discovered that the scope of Acoustics ranges from things as complicated as echograms in medicine to the intelligibility of the word in a simple conversation. However, as Acoustics is a field that is just beginning to be studied in Colombia, no post-graduate programs exist in the country in this area. Although an investigation has revealed the mystery of the Greek theaters, my goal now is to earn a Masters of Acoustics at one of the best universities in France, and bring my knowledge home in order to share it with all those who at one time have asked the same question I asked, and support the development of this area of knowledge in my country.  

Although I have the support of my family in achieving this dream, my mother cannot cover costs as high as these, as her economic situation is limited. I am currently working independently as a consultant on projects in the area of sound, however this is not steady work, and my income does not cover the costs of meeting the requirements for a successful admissions process to the University of Maine, and thus achieving my dream. Kiva would be the support that I need in order to take these first steps of this long journey, and the impetus for this Masters study abroad, as thanks to Kiva I will be able to complete the studies that I need to certify my second language and apply to the University.

I feel sure that thanks to my academic excellence and hard work, I will be able to accomplish the goals that I have set for myself—to be a better person, and to be able to contribute to a better quality of life, not only for the people of my city but for all Colombians.

loans.use: to cover the application expenses to a Masters program at a university abroad.

loans.name: Fausto Eduardo

texts.es:
Fausto Eduardo es un señor de 65 años, actualmente vive junto a su esposa Mariela y tres nietos que están a su cargo, a quienes les está dando la educación ya que su madre los abandonó. Viven en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un sector muy productivo y comercial.
Fausto hace 14 años atrás tuvo que emigrar al exterior ya que por falta de trabajo se vio en la necesidad de hacerlo ya que en ese entonces había adquirido una finca en producción, a la que debía pagarla, estuvo 12 años trabajando como jardinero y podador de plantas.
Hace 2 años terminó de pagar la deuda y regresó a su país para estar junto a su familia, ahora en su finca cuenta con producción de cacao, plátano, maracuyá y malanga, le ha ido muy bien, pero algunas de sus plantas de cacao están enfermas a la que le está dando un tratamiento. 
Fausto necesita dinero para sembrar una hectárea más de cacao y maracuyá para que no le afecte mucho la perdida de unas plantas ya en producción, por ello acudió a Fundación Alternativas ya que ha escuchado hablar muy bien de la institución. Se siente agradecido por la ayuda brindada por Fundación Alternativa y Kiva, ya que así podrá mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fausto Eduardo is 65 years old and lives together with his wife and three grandchildren who are dependent on him. He provides for their education as their mother abandoned them. He lives in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a very productive and commercial place.

Fourteen years ago Fausto had to emigrate to another country due to a lack of work. At that time he had bought a working farm and he had to pay for it. He worked for 12 years as a gardener and pruning plants. Two years ago he finished paying his debt and returned to his country to be with his family.

Today his farm produces cocoa, bananas, passion fruit, and malanga (a tropical edible plant). Things are going well although some of his plants are diseased and he is treating them.

Fausto needs money to plant another hectare of cocoa and passion fruit so that the loss of his plants will not affect his production. So he has come to Fundación Alternativa as he has heard good things about the institution. He is grateful for the support offered by Fundación Alternativa and Kiva as he can improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds to be able to plant another hectare of cocoa.

loans.name: Lissette Elena

texts.es:
Son las 6 am, Lissette, una mujer con estatura promedio, cabello claro y ojos obscurecidos, prepara a su hijo de 10 años para ir a la escuela. Al mismo tiempo, termina de alistarse para poder ayudarle a su madre con las ventas, pues ella junto a su padre, la han apoyado para salir adelante y así asegurarle un futuro profesional a su pequeño.
Lissette nació hace 35 primaveras en la capital de Nicaragua, por lo tanto se califica como una mujer con sueños de superación, quien está encaminándose hasta llegar a coronar su carrera y así conseguir su curso de titulación gracias a su esfuerzo, perseverancia y por supuesto, al préstamo MiCrédito-KIVA. Ahora, debe dejar a su hijo en el colegio, pues sabe que en un futuro no muy lejano, tocará despedirse de él cuando logré concluir su carrera como lo hará ella.  Solicita el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación.
texts.en:
It's 6 am, and Lissette, a woman of medium stature, blond hair and dark eyes prepares her 10 year old son for school. At the same time she gets herself ready to go and help her mother with her sales. Her mother and father have supported her to get ahead and thus be able to provide a future as a professional for her son.

Lissette was born 35 springs ago in the capital of Nicaragua and as such qualifies as a woman who wants to get ahead. She is working toward crowning her studies and get her diploma thanks to her perseverance, efforts and of course the loan from MiCrédito and Kiva.

Right now she has to leave her son at the school as she knows that in the not too distant future she will have to say good-bye to him when he manages to finish his studies as she is doing. She is requesting a loan to pay for her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her studies.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима пожилая, но деятельная женщина в возрасте 59 лет. Она планирует начать свой торговый бизнес. Салима давно хотела заняться торговлей одежды и считала этот бизнес прибыльным. Ее девиз никогда не поздно начать. Салима с помощью средств сына, высланных ей с России, приобрела торговую точку на рынке своего района Кубадиён. Теперь для купли товара она просит кредит. Салима собирается привести оптом коллекцию сезонной женской одежды с оптового рынка Душанбе и продавать их по розничной цене в своем районе. Она верит на успешность бизнеса и хочет таким образом увеличить семейный бюджет и улучшить условия жизни семьи.
texts.en: Salima is an elderly yet active 59-year-old woman. She plans to start her own retail business. Salima has wanted to take up selling clothes for a long time now and considers this business to be profitable. Her motto is that it's never too late to start. With the help of the money that her son sends her from Russia, Salima bought a selling stall at the market in her district of Qubadiyon. Now she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. Salima is planning to bring in a wholesale collection of seasonal women's clothing from the wholesale market in Dushanbe and sell them at a markup in her district. She believes in the success of her business and wants to consequently increase her family's budget and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a seasonal collection of women's clothing to start her retail business.

loans.name: Shallet

texts.en:
Shallet is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school and one is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, Shallet has operated a business selling water. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality–especially during the rainy season. With this loan, she wants to purchase water pipes and to repair a leaking tap. Shallet decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and to repair a leaking tap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Norma De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Entre pinzas, anestesia, equipo de succión y taladro, se encuentra Norma de 37 años de edad, una mujer que deja de ejemplo su sonrisa, un gesto radiante y envidiable en la clínica de odontología donde ella es asistente. Pasado los 16 años ha sido participe de la reparación de la sonrisa de cientos de nicaragüenses. Ahora ya está próxima a  terminar su carrera, pues considera que además de ser una meta más en su vida, quiere convertirse en una odontóloga con título y de corazón.
Madre de dos hijos y esposa de un hombre que la apoya a progresar, sabe que tiene un futuro por delante, el cual quiere llevar prospero y que ella pueda permitirle a sus hijos tener una vida mejor, inculcarle valores y servir de principal ejemplo que a sus 37 años está terminando su carrera con la ayuda de MiCredito-KIVA. Ahora sabe que no falta mucho para cumplir su sueño de su propia clínica.  Solicita el préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación.
texts.en: Norma, 37 years of age can be found among tweezers, suction equipment, anesthesia and drilling. She is a woman who leaves her smile as an example: a bright and enviable gesture, in the dental clinic where she is an assistant. For more than 16 years she has taken part in repairing the smile of hundreds of Nicaraguans. Now she is almost ready with her career. Besides being one of her goals in life, she wants to become a dentist with a certification and wholeheartedly. Mother of two children and wife of a man who supports her in progressing, she knows she has a future. She hopes it will be a good one and will allow her to help her children have a better life, instill values in them and serve as main example, since at 37 years of age she is finishing her career with the help of a MiCredito-KIVA loan. Now she knows that her dream of having her own clinic is not far. She is requesting the loan to pay for her certification course.

loans.use: To pay for her certification course.

loans.name: Yizeth Paola

texts.es:
Ella es Yizeth Paola y quiere contarles por  qué  escogió  lo que  hoy está estudiando y lo maravilloso que ha sido esta experiencia. 

El entusiasmo  por ayudar, saber que puede compartir y brindar un apoyo a las personas que se encuentran con alguna dificultad con respecto a  la  salud es muy importante, saber que cada vez  que se está brindando un servicio a cada uno de estos pacientes están sintiendo la  compañía.
Ella se encuentra en tercer semestre, en las practicas ha sido muy lindo trabajar en especial con niños y adultos de la tercera edad, porque  de  ellos recibe mucho más que experiencias, como el agradecimiento y otros  tantos sentimientos hermosos  que  se  pueden  cruzar, como  ver  en  las   caras  esa   alegría  y  entusiasmo que  día  a  día lo hacen  más  fuerte. 
Es  una  persona  muy  feliz, dedicando el tiempo a  el  trabajo como auxiliar de  enfermería, porque  cree que  es una de  las profesiones mas bellas, ya que al compartir e interactuar  con personas diferentes se puede aprender mucho de cada una de ellas.
Este subsidio con kiva es más que una  ayuda para ella, es una oportunidad extraordinaria para seguir haciendo lo que le gusta y lo cual hace parte del proyecto de vida el cual ha estado en la mente y que quisiera poder cumplir.
Sabe que terminando el técnico como auxiliar de  enfermería los planes para un futuro con la familia seria excelente, ya que  mejoraría los ingresos económicos, si pudiera contar con este subsidio y sabe que va a  aprovechar a  el  máximo la oportunidad obtenida.
texts.en:
This is Yizeth Paola and she wants to tell you why she chose her field of studies and how wonderful this experience has been.

The enthusiasm for helping and for knowing that she can share and provide support to people who find themselves with any health-related difficulty is very important. Knowing that every time that you provide a service to every one of these patients, they are feeling your company. 

She is in third semester. During her internship, it has been very beautiful to work, especially with children and elderly people, as she receives a lot more than mere practice. She also receives gratitude and many other beautiful feelings, like seeing happiness and enthusiasm in the patient's faces, which makes them stronger every day.
 
Yizeth Paola is a very happy person. She spends her time working as a nursing assistant, as she believes that this is one of the most beautiful professions. By sharing and interacting with different people she can learn a lot about every single one of them. 

This Kiva loan is more than an aid for her -- it is an extraordinary opportunity to continue doing what she likes and what makes part of the life project, which has been on her mind and she would like to achieve. 

Yizeth Paola knows that after finishing her technical diploma as a nursing assistant, her future family plans will be excellent. If she could have this loan, her income would improve. She knows she will make the most of this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Эту доброжелательную и отзывчивую женщину зовут Гулсара. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и у нее есть сын и дочь. Гулсара как и многие сельские женщины не имеет высшего образования. Она всю жизнь занималась сельским и домашним хозяйством. Три года назад Гулсара стала заниматься откормом и продажей скота, чтобы помогать супругу в обеспечении семьи. Однако эта деятельность ей очень понравилась, так как оно не требует много времени и силы. Сейчас весна и везде растет свежая трава - лучший корм для скота. Для Гулсары это благоприятное время, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. С такой целью она обратилась за кредитом для купли нескольких телят и надеется, что ее поддержат.
texts.en: This considerate and kind-hearted woman's name is Gulsara. She is 47 years old. She is married has has one son and one daughter. Like many country women, Gulsara does not have a higher education. She has been doing farming and household duties her entire life. Three years ago, Gulsara started fattening up and selling cattle in order to help her husband provide for their family. However, she really likes this business as it does not require a lot of time or physical effort. It's now spring and fresh grass is growing everywhere, which is the best feed for cattle. In Gulsara's opinion, this is an advantageous time to increase her herd. With this goal, she applied for a loan to buy several calves. She hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to buy several calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Beogo Nere De Boulmiougou Group

texts.fr:
Mr RASMANE est le responsable du groupe BEOGO NERE DE BOULMIOUGOU. Marié, il est père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Un(01) va à l’école et il a 04personnes en charge.
Mr vend des habits (prêt à porter masculin)  depuis 09ans. Il s’approvisionne dans différents marchés en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes.
Il veut s’acheter 20chemises et 20chaussures. 
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne voyager dans les pays limitrophes pour s’approvisionner.
texts.en:
Rasmané is the representative for the Beogo Nere De Boulmiougou Group. He is married and is the father of two children. His oldest is nine years old and his youngest is four. One of the children attends school and Rasmané has four dependents. Rasmané has been selling ready-to wear men's clothes for the past nine years. He purchases his merchandise from different markets in the city, and his clientele is made up of men. 

Will his loan, Rasmané wants to purchase 20 shirts and 20 pairs of shoes. Rasmané wants to use his income to reinvest in his business. He aims to travel to neighboring countries to purchase his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase 20 shirts and 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school and one who is too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over three years, Mwanajuma has operated a fruit and vegetable stall, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: A hardworking mother of four, Nat supports her family by farming rice. She is married and 42 years old. Because her current business does not provide a stable income, Nat is struggling to afford her son's school fees. Knowing that VisionFund offers education loans, Nat decided to request a loan of US $1,700 to pay school fees for her son, who is studying civil engineering. Nat wishes to see her son graduate and find a good job.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university fees

loans.name: Srean's Group

texts.en: A villager from Dambae district's Kampong Cham province, Srean has been growing cassava to support her family for over twenty years. The family also farms rice to earn additional income. Srean is 41 years old and married with four children; three of them are in school and the youngest one is under school age. This is Srean's second loan with VisionFund. The first loan enabled her to better support her family by having sufficient food to eat and clean clothes to wear. To improve her cassava yield, Srean has requested a second loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She will also reserve a portion of her loan to pay for labor fees such as plowing, harvesting, and grass clearing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies in order to care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.ru: Норинисо в этом году исполнится 60 лет. Она вместе со своей дружной семьей живет на районе Спитамен вблизи городка Худжанд. Норинисо как и большинство жителей Таджикистана хочет заняться животноводством. Норинисо намерена на заёмные деньги добавить накопленную сумму денег и купить телят и бычков. Она будет выращивать скотин и после длительного откорма продаст их на скотном рынке. Норинисо верит, что ей удастся начать и продолжить бизнес. Поддержите Норинисо. Она настойчивая и целеустремленная она верит в семя и старается сделать мир лучше. Помогите Норинисо начать бизнес.
texts.en: Noriniso is 60 years old this year. She lives with her close-knit family in the Spitamen District, close to the town of Khujand. Like the majority of the residents of Tajikistan, Noriniso wants to take up livestock breeding. Noriniso is determined to add the borrowed money to her saved funds and buy calves and bull calves. She will raise the cattle and then after fattening them up for a while, sell them at the cattle market. Noriniso believes that that she will successfully start and continue this business. Please support Noriniso. She is tenacious and goal-driven. She believes in her family and tries to make the work a better place. Please help Noriniso start her business.

loans.use: to start a business in the field of livestock breeding and buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de marcos para fotos y cuadros decorativos hechos de madera, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de madera, clavos, pinturas, barniz, etc. para poder segur con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poderle dar a sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client is 27 years old, and she is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children. She makes and sells photo frames and decorative wooden frames; and with what she earns from her sales she manages to pay for some of her household expenses. 

The client is requesting a loan for the purchase of wood, nails, paint, varnish, etc., in order to be able to continue with her work, as this is her only source of income. Thus, she will be able to give her children what they need, without any limitation.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, paint, varnish, etc.

loans.name: Luis Andres

texts.es: Luis de 65 años de edad desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su esposa y su madre. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 65, has been a farmer for many years.  He works hard to grow corn so he can put food on his table every day.  He's known for being a hardworking, honorable, and responsible man.  He lives with his wife and his mother.  He and his wife work hard to get the family ahead.

Luis approached the institution to ask for a loan so he could improve himself.  The planting season has begun and he needs to start planting as soon as possible, so he's requesting the loan to buy seeds, soil amendments, insecticides, and the agricultural inputs he needs.

He has faith in God and in his job that this way he'll manage to have an abundant harvest, which will allow him to have a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, soil amendments, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Parate Yande Group

texts.fr:
Mme OUANGO est responsable du groupe PARATE YANDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. Tous vont à l’école. Elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend du couscous de manioc (attiéké) depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne en côte d’Ivoire.
Elle veut s’acheter 50sacs de couscous de manioc.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut scolariser ses enfants. Elle ambitionne acquérir un camion pour son activité.
texts.en:
Ouango is the representative for the Parate Yande Group. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is 17 years old. They are all attending school. Ouango has five dependents in her care.

Ouango has been selling cassava couscous (called "attiéké") for the past seven years. She purchases her supplies in Ivory Coast. Ouango wants to buy 50 sacks of cassava couscous. With her income, she wants to pay for her children's education. She also aims to acquire a truck for her business.

loans.use: to purchase 50 sacks of cassava couscous

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

Glenda has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  est majoritairement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier  Kalaban-coulouba dans le district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax, brodés, bazins), des chaussures plastiques, du lait en poudre, d’ustensiles et de produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Koro (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax, brodés, basins) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 90 pièces de pagnes wax, 30m de basins (riches et moins riches)  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail dans le quartier  Kalaban-coulouba  et en ambulant à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Koro espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is mainly composed of monogamous women with an average age of 34 years and an average of three children. They all live in the Kalaban-Coulouba quarter in the district of Bamako and know one another through ties from the neighborhood. The group members have small trade businesses selling cloth (wax "pagnes" [traditionally dyed West African cloth], embroidery, damask), plastic shoes, powdered milk, utensils, and cosmetics. In order to increase their business capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan.

Koro (shown in the photo on the far right) has a great reputation for selling different types of high- and lower-quality cloths (wax "pagnes" [traditionally dyed West African cloth], embroidery, damask). She intends to use her loan to buy 90 "pagnes", and 30 meters of damask fabric (high-and lower-qualities) in Bamako. She resells her merchandise at retail in the Kalaban-Coulouba area and by travelling to a clientele composed mostly of women. With this loan, Koro hopes to earn an average monthly income of 150,000 Francs CFA that she will use to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy 90 "pagnes" and 30 meters of damask fabric

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Kalaban-coulouba dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban-coulouba. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (tomates, piments, persils, poivrons et choux), produits cosmétiques et du charbon de bois. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nakondié (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (tomates, piments, persils, poivrons et choux); Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de tomates, 1 corbeille de piment, 1corbeille de persil, 3 corbeilles de poivrons et 4 sacs de choux à Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Kalaban-coulouba et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Nakondié espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of group Danaya’s eight women are married in monogamous marriages. They are on average 31 years old with four children. They all live in the Kalaban-Coulouba neighborhood, district of Bamako. They met through neighbor relations and their revenue-generating activities at the Kalaban-Coulouba market.

The group’s members retail vegetables and herbs (tomatoes, hot peppers, parsley, bell peppers, and cabbage), cosmetics, and charcoal. To be able to pay cash for their supplies, the group’s member decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fourth solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Nakondié (the woman sitting in the middle in the picture) has an excellent reputation in the sales of vegetables and herbs (tomatoes, hot peppers, parsley, bell pepper, and cabbage). She is planning on using her loan to purchase five baskets of tomatoes, one basket of hot peppers, one basket of parsley, three baskets of bell peppers, and four bags of cabbage, in Bamako. She retails cash or credit in Kalaban-Coulouba as well as door to door, to a clientele mostly made of women. With this loan, Mrs. Nakondié hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 XOF, which will be reinvested in her business and to provide for the children in her household.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Noveline

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Noveline works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a butcher shop. 

Noveline is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant. Noveline has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widowed mother of five children, four of whom are adults and one who is in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She prepares local brew and sells it to her customers who get it from her pub. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, Mary wants to purchase ingredients such as maize flour and water, as well as chemicals for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as maize flour and water, as well as chemicals for her business

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a widowed woman with seven school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Kadzo has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

With this loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman who has been blessed with four school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Kadzo operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support. She is requesting for a loan to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Peninnah

texts.en:
Peninnah is a married woman. She has four children, three of whom attend school and one who is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Peninnah operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business. With this loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо 43-летняя женщина-фермер, проживающая в районе Шахритус, где сам климат благоприятствует ведению сельского хозяйства. Зебинисо живет в солнечном районе с мужем и четырьмя детьми. Дети ходят в школу, а Зебинисо вместе с мужем занимается дехканским хозяйством. Они арендуют большой участок земли и выращивают на нем арбуз, дыню, пшеницу, рис и т.д. Этой деятельностью они занимаются на протяжении 10 лет и растениеводство единственный источник дохода семьи. Сейчас Зебинисо нуждается в заемных средствах в размере 1500 долларов США. На эту сумму она собирается расплатиться за аренду земельного участка, оплатить за услуги тракториста, купить минеральные удобрения и топливо. Этот кредит очень важен Зебинисо для продолжения ее деятельности.
texts.en: Zebinso is a 43-year-old female farmer. She lives in the Shahrituz District where the climate is advantageous for doing agricultural work. Zebiniso lives in a sunny region with her husband and four children. Her children attend school while Zebiniso and her husband practice farming. They rent a large plot of land on which they grow watermelons, melons, wheat, rice, etc. She has been doing this business for 10 years. Crop farming is the family's only source of income.  Now Zebiniso needs a loan in the amount of 1500 USD. With this money, she is planning to pay back the rent for her plot of land, to pay for tractor operator services and to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel. This loan is very important to Zebiniso in order to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel, as well as to pay for her rented plot of land and tractor operator services.

loans.name: Wendgoudi Du Grand Marche Group

texts.fr:
Mr ALEXIS est le responsable du groupe WENDGOUDI DU GRAND MARCHE. Marié, il est père de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Un va à l’école et il a 08personnes en charge.
Mr vend des appareils électroniques depuis 15ans. Il s’approvisionne dans un établissement en ville. 
Il veut s’acheter 10télévisions et 50ralonges. 
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne construire un maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Alexis is the representative for the Wendgoudi Du Grand Marche Group. He is married and is the father of three children. The oldest is seven, and the youngest is four years old. One child attends school, and Alexis has eight dependents to support. 

Alexis has been selling electronics for 15 years. He purchases his supplies from an establishment in the city. With his loan, Alexis wants to buy ten televisions and 50 extension cords. He wants to reinvest his income into his business, and his aim is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy ten televisions and 50 extension cords

loans.name: Phanith

texts.en:
Phanith, age 44, is a farmer growing rice paddy. She is the mother of five kids, who are still in school. The main source of her income is rice farming on 1 hectare of farmland. She has been involved with this for more than 10 years. Phanith can earn extra income with a pig-raising business.

Including this loan, she is a fourth-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan completely, and it has enabled her to keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more pigs to raise and pig feed. She hopes to earn good income, more than before, from her business.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and and pig feed

loans.name: Incha-La Group

texts.fr:
Mme NADINE est responsable du groupe INCHA-LA. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Tous vont à l’école.
Mme vend des pagnes Bazin depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo et au Mali.
Elle veut s’acheter 30bales de pagnes Bazin.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Nadine is the representative of the Incha-La Group. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 16 years old and the youngest is four. They are all attending school.

Nadine has been selling brocade "pagnes" (traditionally dyed West African cloth) for the past five years. She purchases her supplies in Bobo and Mali. Nadine wants to buy 30 brocade "pagnes". With her income, she wants to reinvest in her business and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase 30 brocade "pagnes" (traditionally dyed West African cloth)

loans.name: Rohatoy

texts.ru:
Рохатой 28-летняя жительница района Шахритус. У нее среднее специальное образование, она закончила педагогический колледж и в течение 8 лет работает по своей специальности. Одновременно Рохатой занимается животноводством. Вот уже 5 лет как она у себя во дворе разводит крупнорогатый скот для продажи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает муж. У них пока нету детей, но они очень хотят, чтобы Бог наградил их этим счастьем.
Рохатой ухаживает за животными сама и делает это с большой заботой. Сейчас она хочет увеличить поголовье скота и для купли нескольких голов быков просит кредит. Она ждет и верит в поддержку.
texts.en:
Rohatoy is a 28-year-old resident of the Shahrituz District. She has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from a pedagogical college and has worked in this profession for 8 years. Rohatoy simultaneously practices livestock breeding. For five years already she has been raising cattle for sale in her yard. Her husband helps her with this business. They do not have any children yet, but they really want God to grant them this happiness.

Rohatoy looks after the livestock herself and does it with great care. Now she wants to increase the size of her herd and is requesting a loan to buy several bull calves. She awaits and believes in your support.

loans.use: to buy several bull calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
This is Hermenia, 53, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Baldrich, a construction worker, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Hermenia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Hermenia dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo de 39 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol  y adicional a eso también se dedica a la crianza de ganando, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Arturo es un hombre activo, entregado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su padre, el desea realizar una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es elq ue muestra la fotografia para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Arturo is 39 years old, and he grows corn and beans. In addition to this, he raises livestock.  He has been working in agriculture for several years; and he has gained valuable experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests. The land he cultivates is located within a major agricultural zone that is very close to his home.  He makes his sales in all of the areas surrounding his community, and he has many customers who prefer him because everything that he sells is first quality at reasonable prices, and with good service. 

Arturo is an active man who is dedicated to his work and very eager to move forward, and he is always looking for opportunities that will allow him to achieve success. He lives in his own home with his wife and his father. 

He would like to make a new investment that will allow him to increase production, for which he is requesting a loan from Integral. With it he will be able to purchase seed, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc., and improve the land that is shown in the photograph, in order to have better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Panteleo

texts.en:
Panteleo is a happy farmer living in the Kisii area of South Nyanza Kenya, which is a banana and sugarcane growing area. He is married and has 4 children all of them school going age. His primary source of income is bananas and maize. In farming, he enjoys crop farming, but his major challenge is a small piece of land and poor soil.

Panteleo chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the low interest rate they offer on their loans.  During the training, he learned that Juhudi Kilimo helps small scale farmers get small loans to improve their livelihoods. He states that with this loan he will buy a dairy cow that will provide milk for his family and for selling in order to get some income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school and two are underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru: Девушка на фотографии Гулчахон. Она из района Вахш. Ей 22 года. Гулчахон замужем и уже имеет девочку. У нее большая семья, состоящая из тестя, свекрови, брата мужа с женой и пятерыми детьми, муж и ее двухлетняя девочка. Гулчахон дома у родителей следила за порядком дома и успевала ухаживала за домашними скотинами. Таким же занятием она занимается в доме у мужа. Гулжахон имеет корову и хочет купить еще телят для того чтобы увеличить поголовья скота. У нее не хватает достаточной суммы чтобы самой совершить покупку и по этой причине она просит вас помочь ей.
texts.en: The girl in the photographs is Guljahon. She is from the Vakhsh District. She is 22 years old. Guljahon is married and already has a little girl. She has a large family consisting of her father-in-law, her mother-in-law, her brother-in-law and his wife and their five children, her husband and her two-year-old daughter. Guljahon looks after the order of her parents house and manages to look after the cattle there. She also does these same tasks at her husband's house. Guljahon has a cow and wants to buy more calves to increase the size of her herd. She does not have enough money to complete this purchase which is why she is requesting your help.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Rowena is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old, married, and has four children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at a public market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom is a local citizen from Kampong Cham province and she is 32 years old. Nowadays, she has three dependent children. Two of them are still in school and one is too young for schooling. To cover her family’s daily basic needs, Sokhom does cassava planting and works as a paid worker in order to earn extra income. She has been with this business for 12 years and it has returned her 25,500 KHR per day. This is the fourth cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The three past loans, which she has repaid, have enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she is the group leader of three borrowers who are requesting a loan. She and her joint-borrowers are seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees for her cassava field. She has high hopes that she will gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She is married with six children, five of whom are in school and one is underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Saumu has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman who has been blessed with four school going children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Gladys has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan  to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 49 year old married mother of five children. Three of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lorelie has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lorelie requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing business.

Lorelie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lorelie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Qurbonoy

texts.ru: Ее зовут Курбоной. Ей 27 лет. Она живет на районе Кубадиен. В Кубадиёне большинство жителей занимаются сельскохозяйственными деятельностями. Не только в Кубадиёне, но и во всей части Таджикистана животноводством и земледелием занимаются многие жители. Таджикистан аграрная страна. Но Курбоной не стала идти по стопам родителей соседей и односельчан и для себя открыла новый бизнес в сфере торговли. Родители ее полностью поддерживают Курбоной занимается продажей канцелярских товаров в том числе ручек, тетрадей, бумаги, разноцветных карандашей, фломастер и многих других вещей. Сейчас ей необходимо привести новый товар, но из-за того чтобы привести и совершить покупку Курбонгул необходимо не большая сумма денег. И она просит Вас помочь ей.
texts.en: This is Qurbonoy.  She is 27 and lives in the Qubadiyon region of Tajikistan.  In Qubadiyon, as well as in most of Tajikistan, most of the people grow crops and raise livestock for a living.  Tajikistan is an agrarian country, but instead of following in the footsteps of her parents and fellow villagers, Qurbonoy has decided to work as a storekeeper and has opened up a shop of her own where she sells stationery and school supplies (pens, notebooks, paper, pencils in various colors, markers, and many other things).  Her parents are behind her 100%.  At the moment, she needs to stock up on these items but lacks the money to do so.  She's seeking your help to get a loan to buy more stationery for her store.

loans.use: stock up on pens, notebooks, paper, pencils of various colors, markers and other stationery.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa de 65 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida  en casa alquilada; Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene varios años con este trabajo y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener los mejores resultados, su  negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y frecuentada por las personas de la comunidad, es muy conocida pues sus tortillas son las mas ricas y siempre están calientitas, tiene mucha clientela y la buscan por su excelente calidad, buenos precios y sobre todo el servicio mas rápido; en estos últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar su inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, etc. Felipa  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de otras instituciones y se hace responsable del pago completo de la deuda, y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Felipa is 65 years old. She lives with her life partner in a rented house. She sells tortillas and has sold them for many years. She has had a lot of experience which leads to her having better results. Her business is located in a very strategic location. It is frequented by people in the community. She is well known since her tortillas are delicious and they are always hot. She has lots of customers and they seek her out for her excellent quality, good prices and more than anything, the quick service. In the last few months, the demand has increased. She wants to make the most of this by increasing her investment but she does not have sufficient funds. She is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that allows her to buy corn in bulk, propane gas, etc. Felipa has good financial references from other institutions. She is responsible for the complete payment of the debt. She also hopes to give her family a better life.

loans.use: purchase corn in bulk, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Rithilia

texts.en: Rithilia appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large. The previous loan was of great help to her life. Here again, she comes to you requesting another loan amounting to 50,000 KES to purchase a variety of vegetables, onions, potatoes and fruits to sell.  She thanks Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables, onions, potatoes and fruits to sell

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Рачабгул обычная швея из района Вахш. Ей 51 год. Она многодетная мать, у нее четверо сыновей и двое дочерей. Два ее старших сыновей находятся на заработках в России, а двое младших сыновей еще учатся в школе. Оба ее дочерей вместе с Рачабгул занимаются шитьем. Рачабгул начала свое швейное дело 8 лет назад. Все эти годы она шила на старой машинке, которую вы видите на фотографии. Сейчас Рачабгул хочет расширить свою деятельность. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения новой модернизированной швейной машинки, с помощью которой она будет справляться с большим количеством заказа и к тому же качество ее шитья улучшится. Она надеется на финансовую помощь.
texts.en: Rajabgul is an ordinary seamstress from the Vakhsh District. She is 51 years old. She is a mother to many children - she has four sons and two daughters. Her two oldest sons work abroad in Russia. Her two youngest sons are still in school. Both of her daughters are in the sewing business along with her. Rajabgul started her own sewing business 8 year ago. All those years she sewed on an old sewing machine, which you can see in the picture. Now Rajabgul wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a new, modernized sewing machine, with whose help she will be able to manage a higher quantity of orders and furthermore, the quality of her work will improve. She relies on your financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Meet Paul, a farmer living in the Kitale area of North rift Kenya, an area where a lot of maize is grown. He is married and has 4 children. He loves farming and has been doing it for 14 years with his primary source of income being milk, eggs, maize, and a retail business. What he loves about farming is oxen ploughing, but his biggest challenge is looking after animals during bad weather especially dry seasons.

Paul chose Juhudi Kilimo because they are very quick in processing client loans and their terms of repayment are quite favorable. During the training, Paul learned more about asset financing. He says that this loan will be a source of income due to increased earnings. This will help him cater well to his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 35 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; three of them go to school. Her husband has been running a restaurant successfully for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been cherished by the whole family for many years. Now, he wants to offer more items on his menu to his valuable customers so that he can increase his income.

Rabia is taking a loan for her husband's restaurant establishment. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. She is hopeful that taking this loan will be helpful in increasing profits and savings as well. Rabia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc., for her husband's  restaurant

loans.name: Sorangie

texts.es:
Ella Sorangie, está viviendo una situación económica muy difícil, ya que es madre cabeza de familia de dos hijas menores, el cual ella  comenta que las cuotas del semestre le quedan muy altas debido a que no tiene un sueldo adecuado, donde a pesar de todo el interés en salir adelante y llegar hacer una gran  profesional, dar lo mejor de ella misma para un mejor futuro para ella y las hijas, ha tenido que pasar por situaciones no deseadas debido a que a veces tiene la plata para el semestre pero no para el sustento de la casa.
Además quiere agregar que el motivo de esta carta es para que  le puedan brindar el subsidio de kiva para que pueda pagar unas cuotas más económicas en el semestre, para que ella pueda seguir estudiando y pagando cumplidamente las cuotas.
Ella hace un gran esfuerzo, ya que ella quiere salir adelante y brindarle a la familia y a  las hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sorangie is living in a very difficult financial situation.  She is the head of her household with two young girls and states that each semester's tuition is a lot of money for her because her salary isn't very high. Nevertheless, she wants to get ahead and have a profession, to give her best so that her daughters will have a better future. 

She has faced tough situations because at times she has had money for tuition but not enough to meet her household expenses. She wants to add that her reason for asking Kiva for support is so that she can pay some of her fees this semester and continue to study while paying the fees on time. She is making a great effort so that she can get ahead and provide her family and her daughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay one semester's tuition.

loans.name: Eva Marisol

texts.es: Desde hace 25 años Eva se dedica a la comercialización de pan dulce y pan francés, las ventas las realiza de lunes a sábado y con mucho sacrificio y espíritu emprendedor va saliendo adelante junto a su familia. Ella habita en casa propia  junto a sus padres, hermana y sobrina. Dadas sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que las paredes de la vivienda se encuentran deterioradas y  en condiciones vulnerables. Con el crédito solicitado comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y pagará la mano de obra para la reconstrucción de las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: For 25 years, Eva has been selling sweet bread and French bread. She makes her sales from Monday to Saturday, and with great sacrifice and entrepreneurial spirit, she is getting ahead, along with her family. She lives in her own house, along with her parents, sister, and niece. Given the conditions of her home, she has made the decision to apply to FUSAI for this loan, since the walls of her house are deteriorated and in vulnerable condition. With the loan that she has applied for, she will buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel and pay for labor to reconstruct the walls of her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel and pay for labor to reconstruct the walls of her home.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a farmer living in the Kitale area of Northrift Kenya, where there is a high regional maize output. He is married and has 4 children, all of school going age.  He has been doing farming for 5 years now and his primary source of income is milk, eggs, maize, vegetables, and a retail business. In farming, he enjoys milking the most, while his biggest challenge is treating sick animals. 

Eric chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give agricultural based loans and they are quick in processing client loans. During the training, he learned proper farm management skills. This loan will help increase his income, as his cows will produce more milk which will be available for both selling and consumption.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Horonya est composé uniquement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Kalaban-coulouba dans le district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits de beauté (boucles d’oreilles, chaines, colliers, rouge à lèvre…), condiments, habits et produits cosmétiques. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nana (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits de beauté (boucles d’oreilles, chaines, colliers, rouge à lèvre…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 boucles d’oreilles, 50 chaines, 80 colliers et 6 cartons de rouge à lèvre en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coulouba et en ambulant à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Nana espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Horonya group is solely made up of monogamous women. On average, the women are 44 years old and have four children. They all live in the neighborhood of Kalaban-coulouba in the Bamako district and know one another through neighborhood ties. The members of the group run small businesses selling beauty products (earrings, chains, necklaces, lipsticks), vegetables for making sauces, clothing, and cosmetic products. With the goal of building up their stocks for sale, the members of the group have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan. Ms. Nana (the woman standing to the far right of the photo) has a major reputation in the sale of beauty products (earrings, chains, necklaces, lipsticks). She expects to use her loan to buy 50 earrings, 50 chains, 80 necklaces and 6 boxes of lipstick at wholesale at the large market. The resales are made at retail in Kalaban-coulouba and by foot to a clientele mostly made up of women. Ms. Nana hopes to make an average monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in the business. As her objective in her relation with Soro Yiriwaso, she wants to buy a lot in which to live.

loans.use: to purchase various articles.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a hardware business. Luzminda is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She operates a food cafe business.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, beans, maize flour, and sugar for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, beans, maize flour, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en: Azra is a 45 year old married woman, who lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling it to the recycling factories. Now due to household expenses he does not have the amount needed to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell in order to get money. Therefore, Azra requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materiale such as scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc., for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies in order to care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a bakery. Jenipher is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenipher has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a married mother with one child, who goes to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Saumu prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

Saumu is requesting a loan. She wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a farmer living with his wife and three children in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya. He loves farming and has been doing it for nine years, with his primary source of income being milk, eggs, and a retail business. In farming, he enjoys looking after his cows, but his biggest challenge is insecurity. When asked, Solomon said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans. During the training, he learned how to do proper dairy farming, which will yield better results. This loan will be a source of extra income, which will improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm equipment.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 35-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for construction sites. In this regard, her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. So that he can generate more income to financially support his family, Bushra is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner.  This will allow her husband to buy soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets. She is thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Hay's Group

texts.en: Hay is a widow who has no children. She lives in Ponhea Krek district's Kampong Cham province. She has been farming rice for more than ten years. Additionally, she also has a cassava plantation. Hay earns to support herself. The crops do not produce good yield as it is usually destroyed by insects. To grow healthy crops, Hay decided to request a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Helen works hard to support her family. She sells ice candy in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling soft drinks. Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, to expand her business, and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more merchandise such as biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar.
