She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks, and sugar

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en: This is Mwanarusi. She previously accessed a loan that she used for her cashew nuts business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.  She also sells groundnuts and prepares snacks.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cashew nuts, and groundnuts for her business. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.  She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts, and groundnuts for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Isidro

texts.es: Oscar de 39 años de edad se dedica a la venta y reparación de relojes, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en un lugar muy transitado, posee mucha clientela por la calidad del trabajo y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa y sus hijos, Oscar esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería y repuestos de relojes para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Oscar is 39 years old, and he works selling and repairing watches.

His business is located near his place of residence, in a place that is very well travelled, and he has many customers because of the quality of his work and the good prices. With what he obtains from his sales he manages to pay for some of his household expenses. He lives in the house of a relative with his wife and his children. 

Oscar is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise and replacement parts for watches in order to continue with his business, as it is his only source of income, and thus give his family what they need without any limitation.

loans.use: to purchase more watches and replacement parts wholesale.

loans.name: Sebesse Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six  membres du groupe Sébèsse ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-Coulouba dans le district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban-Coulouba. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax, bazins et brodés), condiments, boissons et légumes. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marie (femme  debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits (pagnes wax, bazins et brodés). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes wax, 10 pièces de brodés et 20mètres de basins (riches et moins riches) en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Marie compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of group Sebesse’s six members are married in monogamous marriages. They are on average 34 years old with four children. They all live in the Kalaban-Coulouba neighborhood, district of Bamako. They met through neighbor relations and their revenue-generating activities at the Kalaban-Coulouba market.

The group’s members retail cloth (wax-fabric dress, brocades, embroidered fabrics…), vegetables, beverages, and seasonings. To increase their working capital, the group’s member decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fourth solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Marie (the woman standing all the way to the right in the picture) is a major clothes retailer (clothes made of wax fabric, brocades, and embroidered fabric). She is planning on using her loan to purchase thirty pieces of wax fabric, ten embroidered pieces, and twenty meters of brocades (high and medium qualities) wholesale from the market. She retails cash at the market or door-to-door, to a clientele mostly made of women. Mrs. Marie thinks that with this loan, she’ll make a 10,000 XOF monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business and to meet daily needs in her household.

loans.use: to buy wax, a local type of fabric.

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chanthoeun is married and has three children; all of whom are under her support. The family relies on cassava planting. Besides this, they also do rice farming. To improve the quality of her crops, Chanthoeun led a group of two female members including herself to request a loan from VisionFund. 

Chanthoeun will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the tuition fee for her daughter

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy (in the photo), age 28, lives in a village about 22 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and she has one daughter. She sells fast food and Khmer noodles from home. Khmer noodles or Num Banh Chok, are considered the national dish of Cambodia, which can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. Her husband assists her with the business. Savy hopes to expand her business by buying more meat and vegetables needed for her business. So, she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more meat and vegetables needed for her business.

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.ru: Хурматой милая, отзывчивая и духовно верующая женщина. Она мать троих детей. Дети Хурматой находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. Хурматой около 7 лет дома в коровнике выращивает скотин. У нее малое поголовья скота, потому что она не развивала бизнес и не большой доход ей хватило. Но Хурматой решила не останавливаться на достигнутом, и решилась получить кредит и увеличить поголовья скота. Хурматой надеется на деньги от кредита и на сбережения купить достаточное количество скота.
texts.en: Hurmatoy is a kind, responsible and spiritual woman and the mother of three children, who are all migrant workers in Russia. For about seven years, Hurmatoy has been raising cattle in a cow shed at her home. She has just a few cattle because she hasn't yet been able to develop the business enough to bring in a lot of revenue. But Hurmatoy doesn't intend to stop trying, and therefore has decided to get a loan to increase the amount of cattle she has. She hopes to be able to buy a sufficient amount of cattle with the money from the loan.

loans.use: to buy steers to increase the number of cattle she has

loans.name: Soda

texts.en:
Soda lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three daughters, who are in school. 

Soda and her husband are teachers in the same village high school. Besides teaching, Soda also raises cows at home. When the cows are fully grown, she sells her cows to a middleman who comes to buy from her home. 

Soda wants to buys an additional cow to raise, hence she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to raise

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne  44 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des ustensiles, des céréales et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur 14ème  prêt solidaire. AISSATA 3ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 douzaines d’assiette, 20 douzaines de tasse, 10 tasses Inox et  20 douzaines de plateau. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group Djiguisseme are on average 44 years old three four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Yangasso/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women met through family relations. They purchase and sell utensils, cereals, and various items. After paying back their previous loans on time, the women of group Djiguisseme are on their fourteenth solidarity loan. Aissata, the third woman from the left to the right in the photo, is planning on using her loan to purchase five dozens plates, twenty dozen cups, ten stainless cups, and twenty dozens trays. She procures her products in Bamako. She resells to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often extends credit.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 40,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses relative to health and food, with the remainder reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Hakilignouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe HAKILIGNOUMA ont en moyenne 41 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et des poissons.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe HAKILIGNOUMA sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire. BINTOU 2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50Kgs d’oignon, 20Litres d’huile et 5 paquets de Cube Maggi et 20 Kg de poisson séché. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group Hakilignouma are on average 41 years old with two children. They all live in traditional extended families in Yangasso/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women met through family relations. They purchase and sell seasonings, cereals, and fish. After paying back their previous loans on time, the women of group Hakilignouma are on their sixth solidarity loan. Bintou, the second woman from the left to the right in the photo, is planning on using her loan to purchase fifty kilos of onions, twenty liters of oil, and five boxes of Maggi stock cubes as well as twenty kilos of dried fish. She procures her products locally. She resells to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often extends credit.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 11,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses relative to health, food, clothing, and school expenses; the remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy seasonings.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 55 years old, married, and has ten children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susana is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susana has been raising pigs for three years, and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has been blessed with four children, one still underage, one in school, and two adults. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan, to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resalE

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en: A villager from Kampong Cham province, Kunthea age 30, is married and has two dependent children whom are of school age. The family relies on the income from rice farming for which they have been in business for ten years. To earn additional income, Kunthea requested a loan from VisionFund consisting of five female members and she is the leader. Kunthea will use her loan portion to buy piglets for raising as she wants to earn more income for the family, and more importantly to pay for her children to continue schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets for raising

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
Savin, 63, is a villager located in the Battambang province, and she is a mother of nine children. Rice farming and a paid-working job are the main sources of income to support the family. She is an ex-borrower of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven past loans, which she completely repaid. 

Now, she leads a group of three to request a loan. The total amount of her entire group is 5,100,000 KHR, of which 1,600,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a leader, she will use her loan portion to buy land and to pay the land-filling fee for her house. She hopes that her living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy land and to pay the land-filling fee for her house

loans.name: Vandy's Group

texts.en: A resident from a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Vandy, has been farming rice to support her family for over thirty years. Vandy is 50 years old, married, and has two children. To generate more income, Vandy helps the neighbors to pick cashews for a labor wage. To improve the quality of the rice, Vandy applied for a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizers and good rice seeds hoping to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the labor of her copras business

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie works hard to support her family. Anna Marie is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP `loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Anna Marie has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Anna Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 50 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Nelia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers for her coconuts.

Nelia has been farming coconuts for five years and also earns additional income from food vending, video rentals, and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her coconuts

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Besides the fruits and vegetable business, Fatuma operates a kiosk.  She would like to apply for a loan to buy more wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Norma Noemi

texts.es: Noemi de 31 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es una mujer  muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Noemi, 31 years old, has cultivated corn and beans for various years. In this manner, she earns her living and manages to provide the daily bread for her home. She farms year after year; it is the only way she knows to earn a living. Noemi is a hard-working, honorable and responsible woman. Despite the conditions in which she lives, which are very humble, she never tires of working and providing the best she can for her family.

Noemi has decided to request a loan to purchase the principal agricultural inputs; fertilizers, plaguicides, seeds, etc., and to improve the land she sows, which is the terrain shown in the photograph. She hopes to have favorable results since she can't count on any other source of income. 

Noemi has faith that God will help her achieve an abundant harvest, which will permit her to continue providing the daily bread to her home.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, plaguicides, seeds, etc., and to improve this land which she will cultivate.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, 49, is married and has eleven children, four of which are in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a 50,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Leonora would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
A young mother of one, Panha, lives in Takeo province with her family. To support her small family, Panha and her husband do rice farming. The business does not produce stable income as sometimes they lack working capital.  Panha is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy cows to help her with the farming activities such as plowing. 

Panha hopes to generate a stable income.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nida has been in this business for 4 years. Nida earns additional income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 41 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Nida is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nida has been farming corn for eleven years, and also earns additional income from copras, and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Veng's Group

texts.en:
Veng is 46 years old and a rural villager from Sang Ke district of Battambang province. She is widowed and blessed with five children who are still under her responsibility. For her family, rice farming is the only source of income to cover the daily basic needs.  This business earns her about 31,600 KHR per day. 

This is the ninth-cycle microloan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of a group consisting of four members and they are requesting a loan. She has utilized her past loan with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle. The total amount of her entire group loan is 3,000,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing and reaping fees, fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and reaping fees, fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide

loans.name: Eliselda Vanesa

texts.es:
Un casa de bloques sin pintar, una pequeña puerta de madera, una caja de cartón donde guarda los zapatos para comercializar, uno que otro perfume en sus manos que ofrece en las calles de Boaco para brindarle el sustento a su hija de 5 meses de nacida, un bolso de rayas de colores donde guarda la ropa que vende todos los días y un retrato de Eliselda, una joven de 29 años que comercializa diferentes productos para salir adelante, cargando a su bebé.
Eliselda no es una licenciada en mercadeo ni se graduó como administradora de empresas, ella no pudo terminar el colegio debido a problemas económicos, pero de algo estamos seguros, se convirtió en toda una empresaria desde hace 5 años, cuando decidió comenzar con mil córdobas para vender ropa usada a sus familiares, hasta llegar hasta donde está. Pero los sueños no terminan ahí, pues con el préstamo MiCrédito-KIVA, piensa comprar más productos, camisas, zapatos, pantalones, etc. incrementar sus ventas y ahorrar para comprar su tramo en el mercado, de manera que con la ayuda también de su esposo, pueda tener una tienda fija y tener la dicha de proveerle en un futuro una educación estable a su hija.
texts.en:
An unpainted cement block house, a small wooden door, a cardboard box where she stores shoes to sell, two perfumes in her hands that she offers in the streets of Boaco to support her 5-month-old daughter, a striped bag where she keeps the clothing that she sells every day and a portrait of Eliselda, a 29-year-old young woman who sells various products to get ahead, carrying her baby.

Eliselda does not have a college degree in marketing, nor did she get a degree in business administration. She wasn't able to finish high school due to financial problems, but of something we are sure: She became a businesswoman five years ago when she decided to start with a thousand Nicaraguan córdobas to sell used clothing to her family members until she arrived where she is. But her dreams don't end there, as she intends to buy more products with the MiCrédito-Kiva loan: shirts, shoes, pants, etc. to increase her sales and save to buy her stall in the market. In this way, with the help of her husband as well, she may be able to have a store in a fixed location and have the good fortune to provide her daughter with a stable education in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products, shirts, shoes, pants, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganando bovino, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Miguel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y así seguir con la crianza de ganando y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Miguel, who is 40 years old, lives in his own house with his family. He has worked for a number of years raising cattle. He sells his products in the various markets that are near his place of residence. Miguel is applying for a loan to purchase vitamins and concentrated feed for the cattle so that he can thus continue raising livestock and being able to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for livestock.

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es: Silvia tiene 33 años de edad y un gran espíritu emprendedor. Desde hace 4 años posee un pequeño negocio de venta de pan dulce y almuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo va sacando adelante a sus 3 hijos de 9 años, 6 años, y un mes de edad. Con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus hijos ha tomada la decisión de construir un pequeño cuarto para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, hierro y pago de mano de obra para  la construcción del cuarto lo antes posible.
texts.en: Silvia is 33 years old and has a great entrepreneurial spirit. For four years, she has had a little business where she sells sweet bread and breakfasts. With much effort, she is raising her three children, ages 9, 6, and one month. With the goal of improving her living conditions and those of her children, she has made the decision to construct a small room, for which she needs materials such as bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron and to pay for labor for the construction of the room as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron and pay for labor to construct a room

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo de 35 años de edad  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien vive junto a su familia. Gerardo  se dedica a la pesca artesanal, contando con una pequeña lancha y algunas redes para obtener mariscos. Él se ha dedicado desde hace varios años a esta actividad, la cual incluso ahora le permite salir adelante. El solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más redes para pescar, también anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para realizar la pesca diariamente. Gerardo desea darle  una mejor vida a su familia en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Gerardo is 35 years old and is a hardworking and responsible person. He lives with his family. Gerardo earns his living as a traditional fisherman with a small boat and some nets for catching seafood. He has devoted several years to this work which allows him to progress. He has requested this loan from INTEGRAL to have money to invest in fishing nets, hooks, and other instruments he needs for daily fishing. Gerardo wants to give a better life to his family in which they can everything they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 24 años de edad se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de gallinas, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y lo fresco que es el producto, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de gallinas por mayor y asi segur con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias  y poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower is 24 years old. For 6 years she has been selling chickens. She has many customers because of the good prices and the freshness of her products. With the earnings that she obtains and the help of her husband, they manage to pay some household expenses. She lives in the house of a family member with her husband and her son. She is applying for a loan to purchase chickens wholesale and thus continue with her work, which generates good earnings for her and allows her to have a better quality of life, along with her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 46 years old with five children, three of whom are in school.  Eliza works very hard to provide for them.

Eliza's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Eliza has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Eliza has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Eliza is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future, would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ana Azucena

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas sale de la casa de Ana el olor a pan recién horneado, no hay vecino que se resista a comprar las delicias, aunque la elección les resulte difícil. Hornea desde pan simple hasta riquísimas reposterías. Ella es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega, tiene 44 años y dos hijos, está a cargo de uno de ellos. Al morir el papá de Ana, él le dejo a cargo la panadería, la que se convirtió en una fuente económica, ya son 18 años que ella la ha mantenido en función.
Ella solicito el financiamiento para  cumplir uno de sus objetivos, enriquecer su capital de trabajo, es decir la compra de harina y azúcar, puesto que son la materia prima para producir el afrodisiaco pan que cocina. De igual manera, tiene  un plan futuro, lograr la compra de un vehículo con el que pueda distribuir su producto a toda Chinandega y así lograr un incremento en su producción. Definitivamente Ana es una mujer empoderada.
texts.en: Every morning, the smell of freshly baked bread comes from Ana's house. No neighbor can resist buying her products although they find it difficult to make their selections. She bakes simple breads and delicious pastries. She is originally from the city of Chinandega. She is 44 years old and has two children, one of whom she is responsible for. When Ana's father died, he left her in charge of the bakery which has been successful under her direction for 18 years. She has requested a loan to fulfill one of her objectives: to enhance her working capital for the purchase of flour and sugar because they are the basic ingredients to produce her enticing breads. She also has a future goal to achieve: purchasing a vehicle with which she can distribute her product to all of Chinandega and increase her production. Ana is definitely an empowered woman.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar.

loans.name: Thal's Group

texts.en: Thal lives in an urban area of Kandal province. She is 53 years old, married, and has six children; one of whom is under her support and of school age. Thal and her husband have been farming rice to support the family for more than twenty years. Apart from growing rice, they also have a small mango farm which is their secondary source of income. Consisting of three female members, Thal is leading the group to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Thal will use her loan portion to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and gasoline for the water pump.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and gasoline

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren, 49 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an interior decorator for more than thirty years. Using her previous loan, she purchased a car for her son as her son's boss required him to have a car. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floor, and fiberglass for house renovation. In the past years, she only renovated other people's houses and her house deteriorated badly. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants will be released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Maria Igdelia

texts.es: Maria de 61 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo, su hija y un nieto, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia tiene 6 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como golosinas, granos basicos, aceite, arroz, azucar, refrescos, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 61 years old, lives in a rented house with her family which consists of her husband, her daughter, and grandson. She owns a store in her place of residence. She has had this business for 6 years which has given her experience in sales which allows her to make the most money. She is well-known by locals and has a lot of customers. She has the store stocked and wants to increase her business by making a new investment. She needs capital, which is why she is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her store such as treats, basic staple goods, cooking oil, sugar, soda, and more. She ensures that she will pay her debt and trusts that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store with treats, basic staple goods, cooking oil, and more.

loans.name: Claudia Yasmina

texts.es: Claudia de 45 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como panadero, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca, platanitos, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia,  por esa razón posee mucha clientela, Claudia  esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: yuca, papa, plátanos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para la elaboración de estos alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener junto con su esposo una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Claudia, who is 45 years old, lives in her own house with her husband, who works as a baker. She makes and sells snacks such as tostadas of sliced potatoes, yucca, and plantain chips. She sells as a street vendors in the different districts and markets that are located near her place of residence. For this reason, she has many customers. Claudia is applying for a loan to purchase basic supplies such as yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil, etc., all wholesale, for the preparation of these foods so that she can thus obtain better earnings in order to have a better quality of life together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy yuccas, potatoes, plantains, oil, etc., all wholesale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is twenty years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marcelina's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marcelina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marcelina is requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor.

Marcelina is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 3 years and sells.

In the future Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine lives in Yerevan town with her daughter Mariam (in the photo). 

Qristine is a teacher at a special school for children with disabilities.

Her daughter studies at Yerevan State University in the management department. For Qristine, it is very difficult to save money for her daughter's education, so she has applied for this loan. The loan will be very helpful for both of them to pay for the university tuition of Mariam. They wait for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition of her daughter

loans.name: Samuel Arnoldo

texts.es: Samuel de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos  hijas, el trabaja como sastre su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el se encarga de confeccionar ropa formal, uniformes y ropa casual, es  muy detallista quien desarrolla un trabajo muy bueno, lo que le permite contar con la fidelidad de muchos clientes amigos y vecinos. Samuel elabora trabajos por encargo y así mismo elabora prendas de vestir para vender en su casa de habitación, Samuel solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar telas en diferentes colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilo, agujas, botones y todo lo necesario para elaborar la ropa con lo que pueda realizar más trabajos y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Samuel is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters. He works as a tailor. His business is set up in his place of residence. He is responsible for creating formal wear, uniforms, and casual clothing. He is very detail-oriented and does a very good job, allowing him to have the loyalty of many customers, friends, and neighbors. Samuel prepares commissioned work and also produces garments to sell in his home. Samuel is asking for a loan to buy fabrics in different colors and prints, thread, needles, buttons, and everything he needs to make clothing so he can do more work and obtain better profits to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, needles, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hermana y sus tres hijos. Maura se dedica a la venta  de tortillas y productos de belleza. Maura tiene 5 años de contar con este negocio y es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia la cual es lo más importante y por ella hace todo lo que este a su alcance para darles mejores condiciones. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para el cual necesita materiales como: arena, ladrillo, cemento, grava y pago de mano de obra par la construcción respectiva.
texts.en: Maura is 39 years old and lives in her own house together with her sister and her three children. Maura sells tortillas and beauty products. She has had this business for five years, and it is what allows her to bring sustenance to her household and give better living conditions to her family, which is the most important thing for her. She does everything that is within her reach to give them better conditions. To do this, she made the decision to apply to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the construction of a bedroom, for which she needs materials such as sand, bricks, cement, and gravel and to pay for labor for this construction.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, and gravel and pay for labor to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Dioneta

texts.en:
Dioneta is 60 years old, married, and has six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Dioneta has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from a buy and sell fish business.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Leub's Group

texts.en: A 55 year old widowed mother, Leub, supports the family by growing cassava which she has been doing for over thirty years. Leub has four children; two of whom are still in school and need her support.  Not having sufficient working capital, Leub decided to request for a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizers,  hoping that the crops will yield higher which in return will earn her more money to continue supporting her children until they finish school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is a hardworking woman from a rural area. She is 32 years old. Dilorom is married and has 2 children. Her children are little. She is an educated woman. She graduated from Medical college, and has been working in a local hospital as a nurse for seven years.  She has a good reputation. Her husband is a builder. They use their profits to buy food products and clothes for their children and themselves. Dilorom is going to repair her house as her house is in bad condition, but she doesn't have enough savings for it. She is asking for a loan of 700 USD to buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil, etc., for house repairs.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil, etc., for house repairs
